loans.name: Silvio

texts.es:
El señor Silvio se dedica a la actividad de cuidado y venta de planta para jardín , como asi también flores de todo tipo, esta en el oficio hace mas de 20 años.

En el mes de Septiembre comenta el señor Silvio, de que tiene mucho trabajo ya que las florerias de la zona les solicitan anticipadamente gran cantidad de flores especialmente rosa, y clavel, para poder evacuar estos pedidos se requiere trabajar mas hora todos los días, además durante este mes también en la ciudad de Caacupé se realiza el desfiles de las flores, el día 21 de Septiembre, organizado por la municipalidad, para este evento ya tiene una buena cantida de pedidos que fueron realizados por los estudiantes secundarios de la zona.

Gracias a los préstamos que le otorgó la Fundación Paraguaya pudo invertir en la compra de más semillas, plantas y abonos como asi también gran cantidad de metros de carpa denominado media sombra que sirve para proteger las plantas del intenso calor.
texts.en:
Mr. Silvio works at a nursery, caring and selling plants, and flowers of all kinds. He has been doing this for more than 20 years ago.

Mr Silvio tells us that in September he has a lot of work since the florist shops of the area order big quantities of flowers especially roses, and carnations. In order to fulfill these orders, he needs to work extra hours every day, also during this month in the city of Caacupé , the flower parade takes place on September 21th. It 's organized by the municipality, for this event he already has a good number of orders that were made by the secondary school students of the area.

Thanks to the loans by Paraguayan Foundation, he was able buy more seeds, plants and fertilizer, and as well a big quantity of meters of woven black shade cloth used to protect the plants from the intense heat.


Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seeds, plants and fertilizer.

loans.name: Rehema's Group

texts.en:
Rehema has been selling beans and other raw lentils in Zanzibar for two years. Beans are a staple food in Tanzania because they provide much-needed protein and are less expensive than meat. Rehema is currently able to earn approximately $85 each month. She will be using her first loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy more inventory so that she can increase her sales and profit.

Rehema is 20 years old, married, and has one, 4-month-old child. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Fatma, Mwanaisha, and Salma.

loans.use: To buy more food items to sell

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap M., 30, is widowed. Her occupation is as a rice farmer and she also raises pigs for income to support the family’s living. She has one daughter who studies in Grade 9, and they live in Loloksar Commune in Pursat Province.

Sopheap is applying for a $600 loan to purchase more piglets and more food for the pigs, and to buy rice for sale with the rest. The loan will help her to enlarge her business.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets

loans.name: Fortunée

texts.fr:
Miss Fortunée Y. is a young lady born in 1982. Abandoning the benches very early because of her dad's death, she got involved quickly in midwife's training. Having not found a job of her specialty, she made herself hired in a pharmacy of the place.   
Abandoned by her husband, she is alone facing the need of the family composed of four (04) people. With the delays in the payment of the salary, she arrives with difficulty to survive. To remedy, she wish to buy a taxicab motorcycle.  
The profit morale from this trade will allow him to provide to the family's needs; source of her blossoming.
texts.en:
Miss Fortunée Y. is a young lady born in 1982. Abandoning the benches very early because of her dad's death, she got involved quickly in midwife's training. Having not found a job of her specialty, she made herself hired in a pharmacy of the place.   
Abandoned by her husband, she is alone facing the need of the family composed of four (04) people. With the delays in the payment of the salary, she arrives with difficulty to survive. To remedy, she wish to buy a taxicab motorcycle.  
The profit morale from this trade will allow him to provide to the family's needs; source of her blossoming.

loans.use: Achat  de taxi moto

loans.name: Konul

texts.en: Konul Q. is a 20-year-old woman who has been breeding sheep for the last three years. She is married and has a child. Sheep-breeding is the only source of income for Konul and her husband. Konul looks after the sheep and her husband pastures them and sells them in the livestock bazaar. They have divided their chores equally and they really enjoy their everyday work. Konul's dream is to become an entrepreneur with a big farm consisting of 100-200 sheep.  She believes such a business will provide her child a better life and the opportunity for a good education. She has applied for this loan to purchase nine sheep and fodder. Your generosity can help her approach her dream.

loans.use: Purchase nine sheep and fodder

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Mrs. Lilibeth C. is 42 years old. She has 5 children. Three of them are in high school, one is in college and one is at home. Her married life didn’t go well, so when she and her husband decided to separate, her whole family life was affected including her children.

She is into farming. She grows sugarcane and sells it all to some retailers and sugar manufacturing companies. From her harvest, she has been able to provide for the needs of her children. She is asking for a loan from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer. Part of the loan will also be used to start other line of business to augment their income. The loan will enable her to get started in a new business so as to pay the tuition of her children.

Lilibeth now enjoys not only the credit assistance that CEVI provides. She also receives training and insurance coverage by joining CEVI's credit program.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta is a 41-year-old diligent entrepreneur. Her husband Romulo O. is a truck driver for a multi-gas company from whom she got the idea of selling LPG tank. They are blessed with four children. The eldest is Alvin, 19 years old, who stopped during her college studies due to obvious financial crisis. Next to him is Analyn, 18 years old, first year in college, followed by Mae-ann, 16 years old, still in third year high school, and the youngest is John Bryan, 10 years old, who is already in the fourth grade of elementary school. They are living in Barangay (township) Del Pilar, located between the boundaries of Cauayan City and Alicia, Isabela.

Marietta is already confident due to her almost three years of maintaining her LPG tank-selling. She hopes to receive a loan amounting to PHP 9,000 as additional capital for her business and to be able to expand into rice and electronic load retailing in their village. She wants to increase her monthly income of PHP 1,700 out of the business she manages. Marietta said that she will do her best to generate a higher income to pay for her children’s education.

loans.use: business expansion

loans.name: Toshpulot

texts.en:
S. Toshpulot is 35 years old. He has lived for 10 years with the mother of his three children. His parents taught him the art of cultivating the land, and he has always tried to sow his hectares so that he would have a crop in every season.

At this time Toshpulot is sowing potatoes, onions, and carrots. He says that agriculture needs much patience and luck, because there are seasons where there is no profit, and other seasons are very good, but either way he has to keep sowing, profitable or not.

Toshpulot is a client who is now working for the fifth time with IMON International, being very responsible in his payments. He has asked for a loan of 3000 Somoni that will be invested in his crop supplies. Be an important part of the growth of Toshpulot’s business.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia S. is 45 years old single mother of seven children. Four are currently in school while the rest are working. She lives with her children in Moore, in the central region of Ghana.

She is a food vendor and sells Fante Kenkey and maize. Fante Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and taken with hot pepper and fried fish. She has many customers since many Ghanaian enjoy Kenkey for breakfast, lunch and supper. Her major target group is travelers who ply that road to their destination. Those travelers purchased Fante Kenkey in bulk.

Emelia wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to increase her savings to support her children’s education. The government is trying to alleviate the poverty rate so that the economically active poor can also provide for their families. Emelia belongs to a village bank called ‘Independence.’

loans.use: Buy maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Hoji

texts.ru: Хочи 51 год. Она замужем и имеет 4-х детей. Занимается продажей мужских сумок и мужской обуви на рынке "Панчшанбе" города Худжанда, магазин № 8. Она арендует магазин. Ей помогает её муж. Он поставляет Хочи товар из города Истаравшан. Муж Хочи каждые две недели ездит за товаром. Хочи кредитуется в нашей организации 1 год. Сначала она продавала  только сумки, потом расширила бизнес и стала продавать мужскую обувь. Теперь Хочи планирует расширить свой ассортимент и закупить партию мужской одежды.
texts.en:
Hoji is 51 years old. She is married and has 4 children. She sells men’s purses and men’s shoes at the “Panchshanbe” market in Khujand, store #8. She rents the store. Her husband helps her. He supplies Hoji with products from Istaravshan. Hoji’s husband travels for products every two weeks. Hoji has been a borrower with our organization for 1 year. At first she sold only purses, later she grew her business and started to sell men’s shoes. Now Hoji plans to grow her assortments and to purchase a stock of men’s clothing.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase men's clothing for sale

loans.name: Florencia Sonia

texts.es: La Sra. Florencia Sonia C. se individualizo con el credito desde hace dos secuencias, ella trabajaba en grupo CLAVELITOS en diez secuencias, ella se dedicaba a la venta de verduras en la Feria de Ovejuyo, posteriormente, cambio de actividad, ahora se dedica a acomodar, a plazos, sombreros y mantas, también trabaja de empleada de limpieza en la semana, en casas particulares. Ella vive con el esposo que es transportista y sus cuatro hijos, los dos mayores trabajan por horas y continuan estudiando por las tardes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Florencia Sonia C. became independent with the credit she has been on for the past two periods. She worked for the Clavelitos group for ten periods. She used to sell vegetables in the Ovejuyo Fair and then shifted to sell hats and shawls. She also works as a cleaning lady in private homes during the week. She lives with her husband who is a transportation driver and her four children, of which the two older ones work on an hourly basis and study in the afternoons.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia Cortina, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of hats for the party in the Chasquipampa region

loans.name: Atifa

texts.en:
Atifa is a 56 year old woman who lives in the Bekaa with her husband and their two children. Atifa has been working as a sewer since 2006. She sews curtains, clothes and even wedding dresses. Atifa requested a loan of 1500 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tissue, thread and accessories for her sewing. This is her fourth cycle and she has always on time. 
Her previous loans helped her purchase a new sewing machine and improve her work. Atifa is special in her work because she does it well. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. In the future, she plans on expanding her business.

loans.use: Atifa will use the loan to purchase tissue, thread and accessories for her sewing.

loans.name: Kurbonjon

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Махмудова  Курвонжон  -  женщина  1954  года  рождения,  замужем,  имеет  2-х  детей.  Работает  врачом  в  центральной  больнице  Джаббор-Расуловского  района.  С  малых  лет  она  имеет  опыт  в  сфере  животноводства,  поэтому  она  помогает  мужу  Абдуразакову  Абдугафуру,  который  занимается  куплей-продажей  скота.  Они  обратились  в  нашу  организацию  за  кредитом.  На  полученные  деньги  они  планируют  купить  телёнка,  откормив  которого  в  течении  3-4  месяцев,  продадут  по  хорошей  цене.
texts.en:
Kurbonjon M. was born in 1954, is married and has two children. She works as a doctor in the central hospital in the Djabbor-Rasulovski region. Since she was young, she has built experience in the sphere of raising animals, therefore she helps her husband Abdugafur Abdurazakov, who is involved in the purchase-sale of cattle. They applied to MLF Microfinance for a loan. Upon receiving the money, they plan to purchase a calf which, in the course of 3-4 months, will sell at a good price. --- MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
La señora Virginia, Pertenece al Banco Comunal “Cajas Reales”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Chucuito, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno.  Ella tiene 25 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, es madre de 1 hijo, tiene estudios de segundaria completa, vive en la Comunidad de Chinchera Sector Miraflores.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace casi 3 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles el cual utilizó para incrementar su capital en su taller de carpintería.

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 800.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de madera, también comprará lana para elaborar artesanías en miniatura.
 
Su mayor  deseo es mejorar su negocio en su carpintería, al mismo tiempo también en la elaboración de sus tejidos en artesanías.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y los encuentros entre Bancos Comunales.
texts.en:
Virginia is a member of the “Cajas Reales” Communal Bank, which is located in the Chucuito district of the province of Puno, in the department of Puno. She is 25 years old, has a live-in partner, and is the mother of 1 child. She has completed secondary school studies and lives in the Miraflores sector of the Chinchera community.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for almost 3 years. Her first loan was 300.00 PEN, which she used to increase capital in her carpenter’s workshop.

She now needs a loan of 800.00 PEN to purchase wood. She will also buy wool to make handicrafts in miniature form.

Her biggest dream is to improve business in her carpenter’s workshop, as well as the production of her knitted handicrafts.

She likes the savings and chats among the Communal Banks.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wood and wool for handicrafts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en:
Greetings from N. J.Damascene in Gasabo District, Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda!  Jean Damascene is 36years old, married with 4 children aged 12, 8, 5, and 5.

Jean owns a small shop where he sells different kinds of products as found on his picture. He has owned the business for 4 years.  He works every day from 6:00am to 10:22pm and earns a profit of approximately 120,000 Rwandan Francs per month.

Jean is requesting a loan worth 500,000 Rwf from Vision Finance Company s.a which will be repaid over 8 months.  With the increased profits that result from his loan, J.Damascene hopes to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: Expanding his store

loans.name: Pedrito

texts.en:
Pedrito Y. is from the village of Poblacion, Sinacaban,Misamis Occidental. He is 66 years old. Pedrito is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Pedrito owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising chickens for sale. Pedrito has been engaged in his business for over 40 years and earns approximately 1,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Pedrito joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pedrito has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. Pedrito is requesting a new loan of 16000 PHP which will be used for house repair. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Pedrito from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to the borrower's house. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: for house repair

loans.name: Nyame Sun Sum Group

texts.en:
Christiana is 44 years old. She is married and has given birth to a child who is currently in school. She lives with her husband and child in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town.

Christiana is a baker. She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Nyame sun sum’, meaning God’s spirit. The group members are engaged either in farming and/or trading activities. They sell and supply in their local market and nearby communities. They sometimes trek to nearby community markets to sell. The group members want a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy stock in bulk.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes es comerciante por mayor de vasos de cristal donde vende en los locales de eventos sociales, es soltera, no tiene hijos y vive con su Madre en casa alquilada ubicada en El Alto zona Villa Bolívar ‘D’, su Madre trabaja en 
el Magisterio,  

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de Mercadería,  aumentando su stock en cristalería  para la venta en diferentes locales de eventos sociales y así poder incrementar sus ingresos familiares.

Es el primer crédito, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Lourdes.

loans.use: COMPRA DE MERCADERIA

loans.name: Savong

texts.en: Mrs. Savong C. is a farmer in Svay Thom village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Keo Soeun, is a duck breeder. Since his poultry business is going well, he wants to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Savong C. decided to request a loan to buy more ducks and duck food. She will use the rest of the money to buy fertilizer to support her rice field. She is 39 years old and the mother of four children. One of them is a monk and the others attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy more ducks, duck food, and fertilizer.

loans.name: María Santos

texts.es: Doña María V. tiene 56 años de edad, es casada de oficios Artesana,  “Elaboración de cortes típicos”, habita junto  con su esposo, ella y su esposo se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con un pequeño Taller, llevan  tiempo ya  de Tejer   su residencia que se encuentra en el  Caserío Chotacaj de la  Aldea V., del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
María Vásques is 56 and married. She is a weaver, and she makes typical skirts. She lives with her husband. She and her husband do the same work, and they have a small shop. They have been weaving for some time. Their home is locted in the Paraje Chorajche in the Cantón Pasajoc, Totonicapán department, Guatemala. Current customer demand is growing, but the economic condition in which she finds herself is not sufficient to increase her capital. That is why she came to the ASDIR Association to ask for a loan. She will buy raw material to be able to increase her sales. She is also hoping to get his family ahead and to have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material to make typical skirts

loans.name: Tuy

texts.en: Tuy S. is a 52-year-old farmer and a widowed mother. She is blessed with two kids; both are working in a garment factory. Tuy S. inherited farmland from her grandmother and she grows different kinds of crops. In the past, Tuy S. has always hired the neighbor’s cow for the chore of plowing the farmland. Now she hopes to buy her own cow and that is why she is applying for a loan from Kiva.

loans.use: To buy her own cow

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean, 40, is a rice farmer with three children. She has been rice farming since 2000 and tills her rice field to earn a living.

Mary Jean joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to have the chance of obtaining a loan for her business. She requested 14,000 Php which is quite enough to fill her need for farm inputs. With your help she will be grateful that she will be able to finance her business, even with the limited capital she has.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en: Joshua is thirty five years old. He is married with four children who are currently in school. He is a graphic designer who prints books, complementary cards, and tributes. He is a photographer in addition to his graphic design business. Joshua says his machines are getting much older and he needs a loan to buy new machines to replace them. Joshua takes orders from corporate businesses and individuals and he believes in efficiency and timely delivery. He believes your support will help his business succeed.

loans.use: To purchase new printing machines.

loans.name: Thiane

texts.fr:
Madame Thiane  K. habite dans la localité de  Ouakam. Elle est sociétaire  de la caisse de  Ouakam à l’U-Imcec  depuis 2008 et a déjà bénéficié  d’un prêt  antérieur.  C’est une femme mariée  avec 2 enfants. Elle a une activité diversifiée .Elle évolue  aussi bien dans le commerce d’articles divers que dans  l’aviculture. Elle a une expérience  de10 ans dans son activité. Elle sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs destine a l’achat de jouets, draps, couches, chaussures, sacs, greffages et d’habits  qu’elle va vendre dans son magasin situe en face du marche de Ouakam. Ses marchandises sont souvent adaptées aux besoins des clients en fonction des événements. Ce qui la passionne  dans son activité  c’est le contact avec la clientèle  et le fait qu’elle parvienne à s’occuper. Ce crédit lui permet d’élargir sa gamme de produits à offrir à la clientèle  en vue de la satisfaction de son besoin. Par conséquent l’accroissement de ses bénéfices  lui permet de mieux investir dans le domaine de l’élevage.
Toujours  dans son optique de participer activement a la lutte contre la pauvreté   l’U-IMCEC avec l’appui positif des prêteurs   réussit   à soutenir  les populations  a exercer des  activités  lucratives génératrices de revenus, ce  qui favorise un développement  socio économique  apprécié
texts.en:
Mrs Thiane K. lives in the village of Ouakam. She has been a member of the savings bank in Ouakam which belongs to the IMCEC mutual savings and credit union (U-IMCEC) since 2008 and has had one previous loan. She is a married woman with two children. She has a diversified activity. She is developing a commercial business selling various products as well a poultry farming business. She has ten years of experience in her activities. She is asking for a loan of 300,000 francs with which she intends to buy toys, sheets, nappies, shoes, bags, hair weaves ("greffages") and clothes that she will sell in her shop, which lies opposite the market in Ouakam. Her goods are often adapted to the needs of her clients depending on the occasion. What interests her most in her business is the contact with her customers and the fact that she gets to attend to them. This loan will allow her to expand the range of products she can offer to her customers with a view to satisfying their needs. The resulting increase in her profits will allow her to invest more in the poultry farming business. In line with its ongoing vision to participate actively in the battle against poverty, U-IMCEC, with the backing of its lenders, is successfully providing support for people to carry out lucrative income-generating activites; this in turn contributes to a welcome socio-economic development.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of working capital

loans.name: Fama

texts.fr: Fama N. est une femme de 46 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KIR-DIOM depuis 2 ans et a eu à y bénéficier 4 fois de suite de crédit. Son objectif est de mieux développer son embouche ovine et vente de mil, de haricot, d'oseille et d'arachide. Avec ses bénéfices elle compte renforcer son niveau d'épargne et de participer aux différentes charges familiales.
texts.en:
Fama N. is a 46-year old woman who is married and has six children. She has been a member of the village bank in KIR-DIOM for two years and has had four consecutive loans. Her aim is to build up her beef fattening business and the sale of millet, beans, sorrel and ground nut. With the profits she plans to boost her savings and to contribute to the various family expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen her investment capital

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr: Jeanne N., 45 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants est membre du Banc Villageois de Sainte Anne depuis 4 ans et demi. Elle a été 9 fois de suite bénéficiaire de crédit et développe un petit commerce de fruits et de jus naturels. Elle participe à la prise en charge de la santé et scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
Jeanne N., 45, married and the mother of 4 children, has been a member of the Village Bank of Sainte Anne for four and a half years. She has received 9 consecutive loans and is working at expanding her little fruit and fruit juice business. She wants to participate in keeping her children healthy and in school.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: maintain her little business

loans.name: S. Emma

texts.fr: Née en 1972 à Hêtin au Bénin, V. S. Emma vit depuis 17 ans au quartier Agbalilamè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Mariée à OUSSOU KICHO Basile, un professeur, Emma est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. La famille vit ensemble à Agbalilamè. Emma vient en aide à son mari en ce qui concerne les charges familiales. Emma n'a pas frésuenté l'école. Il y a près de 12 ans que Emma mène comme activité, la vente de divers produits (savons, piles, lait, sardines, pâtes alimentaires, insecticides, etc.) à son domicile. Parallèlement à cette activité, Emma vend également du maïs et du haricot. C'est à Adja au Mono, Azovè et Pobè dans le département du Plateau, que Emma se ravitaille. Emma  a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu'elle a bien remboursés. Emma souhaite faire un approvisionnement en quantité suffisante pour pouvoir dégager une marge de bénéfice plus importante mais est limitée par les moyens financiers. C'est ce qui amène Emma à solliciter un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born in 1972 in Hêtin in Benin, Ms. V. S. Emma has been living for seventeen years in the Agbalilamè district, in the town of Sèmè-Podji.  Married to Mr. OUSSOU KICHO Basile, a teacher, she is the mother of three children who are all in school.  The family lives together in Agbalilamè.  Emma helps out her husband where it concerns family expenses.  Emma did not attend school.  For nearly twelve years, she has been running a business selling a variety of goods (soaps, batteries, milk, sardines, pasta, insecticides, etc.) out of her home.  Along with this business, she also sells corn and beans.  She resupplies herself in Adja in Mono, Azovè, and Pobè in Plateau county. She has already benefited from two ALIDé loans, which she has repaid.  She wishes to stock up in sufficient quantities to be able to clear a greater profit margin but is limited by her financial means.  This is what's leading Emma to request a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying various goods (soaps, batteries, milk, pasta, sardines) and some corn

loans.name: Florencio Jerónimo

texts.es:
El señor Florencio es una persona que trabaja como albañil en este municipio el cual atreves de los créditos con ceprodel ha podido mejorar su casa la cual anteriormente esta era de plástico en su totalidad y poco a poco la ha terminado de construir con piedra cantera y ladrillo de barro dándole mayor seguridad y protección a su familia.
Este crédito lo solicita para terminar de construir una pared que todavía la vivienda  está cerrada con plástico donde él se ahorraría la mano de obra  por ser albañil.
Su  familia  la cual esta agradecida con ceprodel por tener una hogar más seguro donde vivir
texts.en:
Florencio works as a bricklayer in this town. Thanks to loans from Ceprodel he has managed to make improvements to his house, which used to be made totally of plastic. Bit by bit he has finished building it with stone and adobe thus providing increased security and protection to his family. The loan will be used to finish building a wall where the dwelling is still closed with plastic. He will save on labor costs since he's a bricklayer. His family is very grateful to Ceprodel for helping to provide a home in which to live that is safer.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Kong T. is married and lives with her children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. She has three children.

T. is engaged in the business of sewing and designing clothes and rents part of her house to garment factory workers, earning an income of 7 USD per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her husband who is a bodyguard at a public department, earning an income of 5 USD per day. Their standard of living has been improved since they have had these businesses.

T. is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to repair the rental rooms for the workers. This is her first loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner.

loans.use: To repair her rental rooms

loans.name: Nget

texts.en:
Mrs. Nget M. is 58 years old and a resident of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. She was married but her husband died years ago. She currently stays at home to do homework and to take care of their family. Nget M. relies on the income from her daughter who is a garment factory worker, and a son-in-law who is a blacksmith. 

Nget M. has been living in an older house which is in need of repair, and the living conditions have often been affected. To solve this, Nget M. decided to ask for a loan of $700 from Kiva’s field partner, HKL, to be used to hire a laborer to mend her old house.

loans.use: To hire a laborer to mend her old house.

loans.name: Dourn

texts.en: Dourn L., 64, is widowed and resides with her 30-year-old daughter in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. She weaves Cambodian traditional silk for an income of about USD 2 per day.  L. is requesting a loan of USD 400 to purchase raw silk to produce more silk products for sale. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to expand her business.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. Her daughter is pictured here.

loans.use: To buy raw silk

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower from Lebanon is a 50-year-old married man. He lives with his wife and two children. Both he and his wife work to support the family. He has been working as a car electrician since 1990. He has a store that he rents for his work. Many people in Lebanon buy cars second-hand, so there is a constant need for reliable repairmen like this Kiva borrower.

He is requesting a loan of $1,200 to make needed purchases for his work. This will be his third loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. 

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his picture, not indicating his name and location, etc.). Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans from Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: To make needed purchases for his auto-repair work

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita O., 52, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Eugenio O., a driver, they are blessed with three children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn money so that their family can have a better life.  She has been overseeing operations of their van for quite some time now.

Mercedita has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her business.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a 19,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying the franchise license needed to legally continue operations of her van.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education. She dreams that they will be successful someday.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: business franchise license

loans.name: Chim

texts.en:
Mrs. Chim N. is an older mother blessed with five children, of whom one is now married and the remaining four are single. To help the family, three of her children are employed at different occupations.

To earn a daily income, Chim N. raises a few pigs and rice crops on her own land next to her house. Additionally, she goes to the forest with her husband to collect burnable oil from trees and turn it into glue to sell (it is used in furniture making).

This is the second loan that Chim N. has requested from Kiva. She will be using this loan to purchase more tools used to collect the burnable oil. With any remaining money from the loan, she will repair her old house that is often cracking.

loans.use: To purchase more tools for collecting burnable oil

loans.name: Carmen Patricia

texts.es: La Señora C. se dedica a la venta de billetes de Lotería con este negocio ella ayuda económicamente a su mamá ya que ella es soltera, nuevamente se acerca a CEPRODEL a solicitar un crédito para comprar zinc, arena, cemento, perlin; y de esta forma construir un cuartito en su casa para su mamá ya que en ella no hay ningún tipo de división y quiere que su mamá tenga privacidad. No posee niños y el único gasto que tiene es el de ella misma.
texts.en:
Mrs. C. sells lottery tickets. The business helps her provide financial support to her mother, who is single. She's seeking another loan from CEPRODEL to buy zinc, sand, cement, and crossbeams so she can build a little room in her house for her mother. Right now the house isn't partitioned at all and she wants her mother to have privacy. She doesn't have any children and her only expense is supporting herself.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy zinc, sand, cement, and crossbeams.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion C., 48, is a married woman from the town of Banga. She began farming ten years ago. She plants rice crops and sell her harvest at her town's market. Currently, she tills a hectare and a half of rice field. She hopes to increase her harvest. She also grows pigs for fattening. 

Salvacion joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Salvacion has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers, seeds and feed for the pigs. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Salvacion from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, it has numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and pig feed

loans.name: Mr. Sokhorn Li Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan has 16 people who have been selected by Mr. Sokhorn L., the village bank president, who is 34 years old. They are located in Pou village in Takeo province. Each member will use his or her portion of the loan in a variety of ways in order to improve their quality of life. Mr. Sokhorn L. is a farmer who owns a two-hectare plot of land where he cultivates rice to sell to support his family.  Meanwhile, his wife, Mrs. Sary T., is a housewife. He tries to work hard, and he wants to expand his business so as to improve his family's living conditions. Mr. Sokhorn L. is asking for a loan to buy rice seed and to hire a plow machine to plow his field. He is a father of six children, three of whO. are studying in school.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and hire a plow

loans.name: Resolucion Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Resolución lo conforman Jessenia Raquel R. Gómez de 30 años, Jasmina del Socorro C. V. de 29 años y Marlene Sánchez G. de 39 años. Jessenia, quien es la coordinadora de este grupo, trabaja desde hace 4 años en venta de ropa tanto nueva como usada de manera ambulante, recibiendo la ayuda de sus hijos de 14 y 12 años en dicha tarea.

Jasmina también vende ropa, pero ella lo hace desde su casa de habitación ofertándola a familiares, conocidos, vecinos y recomendados; Marlene vende elotes y yoltamales, sin embargo ella utilizará el crédito para la compra de nuevos rubros en su comercio diario.
texts.en:
The solidarity group “Resolución” (Resolution) consists of Jessenia Raquel R. Gómez who is 30 years old, Jasmina del Socorro C. V. who is 29 years old, and Marlene Sánchez G. who is 39 years old.

Jessenia, the group coordinator, has been selling new and used clothing as a street vendor for four years. Her children, ages 14 and 12, help her with running the business.

Jasmina also sells clothing, but she operates her business at her house. She offers her products to relatives, acquaintances, neighbors, and referrals. Marlene sells corn on the cob and corn and cheese tamales, but she will use her loan to buy new products to sell in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Rosa Lourenco

texts.pt:
Rosa Lourenço M. nasceu na cidade da Matola, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, mãe de 2 filhos de 7 e 3 anos de idade, o mais velho vai a Escola. Fez o quarto ano na Universidade Pedagógica. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta 2 sobrinhos que vivem com ela.

Nunca sai da sua terra natal, apenas saiu de casa quando se juntou ao seu esposo. Trabalha como docente ha mais de 11 anos é quadro do Ministério da Educação e tem um salario mensal de 5.835.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
 
Ja teve um empréstimo no Banco Millenium Bim para o início da construção da sua casa, mais tarde decidiu não continuar. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de colegas que são clientes da instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo no valor de 17.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, portas, fechaduras, areia e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa.
 
No futuro gostaria de pedir um novo empréstimo para construir uma dependência na sua casa como forma de poder albergar mais pessoas da sua família.
texts.en:
Rosa Lourenço M. was born in the city of Matola, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. She is the mother of two children, ages 7 and 3; the eldest goes to school. Rosa finished the fourth year at the Teaching University. She lives in her own house with her family and supports two relatives (nephews or nieces) who live with her. She never left her hometown and had hardly left her house when she married her husband. She has worked as a teacher for more than 11 years. She is employed by the Ministry of Education and has a monthly salary of 5,835 meticais, which she uses for household expenses. She also saves some money in her bank account. Rosa had a loan before with Millenium Bim Bank to begin construction on her house. Later she decided not to continue with them. She learned about Hluvuku through co-workers who are customers of the institution. This 17,000 meticais loan is her first. She intends to buy construction materials (cement, doors, locks, sand and other items) to continue construction on her house. In the future Rosa would like to ask for another loan to build a room onto her house as a way to be able to house more family members..

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement, doors, locks, sand and other items)

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
Gladis M. es una mujer trabajadora que se dedica al comercio de cosméticos, prendas y su pequeña venta desde hace diez años. Ella con este negocio ha sacado adelante a sus tres hijos de los cuales dos son menores.
M. con el crédito mejorar su negocio surtiéndolos con mayor cantidad de productos.
texts.en:
Gladis M. is a hard working woman who has been dedicated to the sale of cosmetics, garments and small items for ten years. With this business she has supported her three children, two of whom are young. With this loan, M. would like to improve her business by supplying a greater quantity of products.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, garments and basic items for resale

loans.name: Javier De Jesus

texts.es:
Javier de Jesús D. M. tiene su negocio de venta de repuesto y accesorio para bicicletas. Tiene mas de 10 años en este tipo de actividad, es padre de familia de dos hijos, el trabaja junto con su esposa donde ha venido sacando a delante el negocio.
Ellos trabajan de 8 de la mañana hasta las cinco de la tarde, el préstamo solicitado es para la compra de mercadería para su negocio.
Ha trabajado alrededor de ocho prestamos y todos estos han sido para compra de mercadería de su negocio.
texts.en:
Javier de Jesús D. M. owns a shop where he sells bicycle spare parts and accessories. He has been engaging in this activity for more than 10 years. A family man with two children, he works together with his wife, with whom he has succeeded in getting the shop off the ground.
Their working hours are from 8 am to 5 pm; the loan he is requesting will be used to buy products for his shop. 
He has already received eight loans, all of which have been used to buy products for his activity.

loans.use: To buy bicycle spare parts and accessories to sell.

loans.name: C5282 Icyerekezo Group

texts.en:
Celestin is 28 years old, married with one child who is 2 years old. Celestin is a businessman; he owns a little restaurant. This business is profitable that's why it was chosen by him even though he works himself. He is group representative for 8 members, each one with his own business. Celestin in particular has an experience of 3 years and the hours of his business are from 6 in the morning to 9 in the evening every day.

Celestin and his group members are requesting a Kiva loan Via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding their businesses through purchasing more products. Celestin needs to purchase more foodstuffs which will allow him to provide more customers with meals. Hopefully; Celestin will be able to earn some profits; with these profits he expects to earn he will be able to save money and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: Expanding his business

loans.name: Sandra Azucena

texts.es: La señora Sandra azucena P. C. tiene una farmacia ubicada en el barrio santa Ana tiene de tenerla 16 años y medio comenzó su negocio con un capital de c$ 1,000.00 ahorro anteriormente alquilaba para su negocio y actualmente tiene su negocio en su casa, es viuda y sale adelante con su hijo  que estudia en la universidad y con estos financiamientos ha salido adelante y ha mejorado su negocio.
texts.en: Ms. Sandra Azucena Perez C. has had a pharmacy located in the neighborhood of Santa Ana for sixteen and a half years. She started her business with C$1000 savings.  Earlier she rented space for her business but now she has her business in her home. She is a widow and lives with her son who is studying at the university. With these loans she has been getting ahead and improving her business.

loans.use: Compra de medicamentos para su negocio

loans.name: Kantai Ole

texts.en:
Kantai Ole K. is 46-years-old, married to Naisuaku Ene K. and he is the father of four school aged children who all attend school. Kantai is a wheat farmer and he does the farming on his own piece of land which he has been doing for the last four years.

Kantai learned about KADET from a friend who is already a Kadet registered client. This will be his fourth loan which he is planning to use to buy fertilizers and some chemicals for his farming.  With the profits he hopes to make from this loan, he plans to rent more land for farming to increase his wheat production. 

Kantai’s future dream is to be able to buy a bigger piece of land so he can plant more wheat for commercial purposes and buy his own farm machinery. He is a hardworking man who is focused on his set of goals.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, chemicals and fertilizares.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a single woman with seven children. The elder daughter is married, two of the children have graduated, while four still attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, clothing and school fees. 

She operates an open-air food stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passerby. Fatuma faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to establish a cereal shop in the future. 

With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase sacks of Irish potatoes and packets of baking powder. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of Irish potatoes and packets of baking powder.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob is a single man who lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and rent. He has operated a boutique business for the last year, retailing to his neighbors and passersby. Jacob faces the major challenge of high competition from other boutique operators.

Jacob decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve his business. With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase bundles of clothes for resale, and in the future hopes to establish a large wholesale clothes-selling boutique.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 60-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and one child. He has been working as a taxi driver for 25 years and bought his own car to use as a taxi 17 years ago. He is the only income provider for his family. Regarding his older age, he is making a big effort to keep his family doing well. His main route is between his town and its surroundings.

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to perform needed maintenance for his car such as changing the engine and improving the outside look so he can attract more clients and serve them using a proper car.

loans.use: perform needed maintenance for his car

loans.name: Shahtykan's Group

texts.en:
Shahtykan M. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Tahskomur, a small mining town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is 32 and married. Her husband earns money by mining coal. Together they bring up four daughters. Three older daughters are at school and the youngest is preschool age (under seven). 

Two years ago, with the initial investment of 2000 soms, Shahtykan purchased two goats for breeding in order to make additional money to cover family expenses. Now she earns about 6000 soms reselling livestock at a higher price after fattening. She hopes to obtain the loan because she needs money to improve the family’s living conditions. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase a washing machine.  

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase a washing machine.

loans.name: Angel Miguel

texts.es:
Ángel de 25 años de edad, reside en Nueva Guadalupe, departamento de San Miguel, vive con sus padres y hermanos, se dedica al taller de estructuras metálicas desempeñándose desde hace 5 años, este oficio lo aprendió por un familiar y actualmente trabaja de lunes a sábado.
Ángel está reparando una pared de su vivienda, ya que se encuentra deteriorada, por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción como ladrillos, cemento, arena, piedra y hierro; con este préstamo espera cubrir los gastos que demanda el tener en buenas condiciones la casa donde comparte con su familia.
Su aspiración es continuar mejorando la vivienda, además de atender el taller con mucha dedicación realizando el trabajo con calidad para agradar a los clientes y contar con ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Ángel, 25 years old, lives in Nueva Guadalupe in the department of San Miguel. He lives with his parents and siblings and has worked in a metal structure workshop for 5 years. He learned this trade from a relative and currently works from Monday to Saturday. Ángel is fixing a wall in his house which has deteriorated, and for which he is requesting a loan to buy construction materials such as bricks, cement, sand, stone, and iron. With this loan he hopes to cover the expenses necessary to keep the house he shares with his family in good condition.
His aspiration is to continue improving his home, as well as seeing to the workshop with a lot of dedication and doing a high quality job to please his customers and to be able to count on income for his family.

loans.use: The purchase of materials: bricks, cement, sand, stone, and iron

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr: Madame Aissatou C. est une femme mariée e de 66 ans qui habite dans la localité de Yoff. Elle est soutien de famille et s’active dans le commerce d’huile de palme depuis plus de 30 ans. Elle a choisi son activité par passion. Elle est aussi très intéressée  par les profits que lui génère son activité ce qui lui permet de faire face a ses besoins personnels. Elle est sociétaire de la caisse de Yoff depuis mai 2005. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour l’achat d’huile de palme en Casamance destiné à la vente. Son objectif est d’accroitre ses bénéfices et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aissatou C., age 66, lives in Yoff. She's the family's bread earner, and for 30 years, she's been selling palm oil. She chose her business out of passion. She's also very interested in the profits realized from her business, which enable her to provide for herself.

She's been a member of the Yoff credit union since May 2005. She's seeking a loan of XOF 100'000 to buy palm oil in Casamance (Senegal) and to resell it. Her goal is to increase her profits and improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: To buy palm oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sugar,cooking oil ,maize flour and rice to sell

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es: Blanca, de 40 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su esposo José de 42 años, quien se desempeña como chofer, y sus dos pequeños hijos. Desde hace tres años, esta emprendedora mujer se desempeña como comerciante de turrones (dulces típicos peruanos), pero esta actividad tiene acogida solo desde el mes de setiembre hasta  noviembre, que son los meses que se recuerda al “Señor de los milagros” (tradición ligada al Jesucristo limeño). Pero durante el resto de meses ella prepara sanguches y salchipapas afuera de su casa y esta labor la desempeña en su carrito sanguchero  que saca todos los días afuera de su casa, aunque solo realiza su labor desde las 6 de la tarde hasta las 11 de la noche dice que le brinda buenas ganancias. Como es una mujer emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado ampliar su negocio de venta de sanguches con mayor comodidad para sus comensales, es por esta razón que quiere comprar mesas y sillas. Es el sétimo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Blanca tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de ingredientes que necesita para continuar preparando sus platillos; además quiere mejorar su negocio con algunas mesas y sillas.
texts.en: Blanca is 40 years old. She lives i nher own house with her husband, Jose, who is 42. He works as a driver and they have two small children. For three years, this enterprising woman has worked as a merchant of turrones (traditional Peruvian sweets). This activity is only popular from September through November, which are the months that the "Lord of the Miracles" is remembered (a tradition linked to the Liman Christ). During the other months she makes sandwiches and french fries with sausage outside of her house in her sandwich cart that she takes out of her house every day. Although she only does the work from 6 p.m. until 11 p.m., she says that it gives her good income. Since she is an enterprising woman she plans on expanding her sandwich selling business in the future so her patrons will be more comfortable. That is why she wants to buy tables and chairs. This is the seventh loan that she has had with MFP and she promises to make her payments on time. She doesn't want to look bad to the people who made the money possible that will allow her to continue working and seeking progress. Blanca is planning on investing the loan she has asked for in buying the ingredients she needs to continue preparing her dishes. She also wants to improve her business with tables and chairs.

loans.use: To buy products for the preparation of her dishes.

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat is a resident and farmer in Litein Town in South Rift Kenya. He has been in farming for ten years doing mixed farming and producing milk and maize for the local market. He is married with four children, aged between and 1 and 6 years.

Josphat has requested for this loan amounting to 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the acquisition of a dairy cow will mean additional milk production for the family's consumption as well as income that will see the children through further education.

Josphat laments the market prices and poor road systems, which makes delivery to the market expensive, hence cutting in on the farmers' income.

loans.use: Purchase and insurance of a dairy cow.

loans.name: Namig

texts.ru: Namig A. 37 let. On jenat i imeyet odnoqo rebonka  seychas projivayet v qorode Baku vmeste so svoyey lubimoy semyoy. Namig uje 4 qoda kak imeyet svayo kafe qde samje i rabotayet povorom, on qotovit razniye Shashliki iz kurinnoqo myaso, iz myaso baranini, iz ribi i t.d. Namiq seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit i ustroit vixlopnuyu trubu, vitajku.
texts.en: Namiq A. is 37 years old. He is married and has one child. He currently lives   in the city of Baku with his beloved family. For the past years, he has been keeping his own café, in which he also works as a chef. He prepares different types of “shashlik” (shish kebab), with chicken, lamb, fish, etc. At present he needs 200 AZN in order to buy and install ventillation equipment.

loans.use: to purchase ventillation equipment

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.es: Jesusa tiene 43 años y vive en compañía de 3 hijos de los 4 que tiene, en una casa arrendada. Desde hace 18 años emprendió su propio negocio, en un inicio logro instalar una tienda para vender productos de primera necesidad, actualmente se dedica a la agricultura, desde entonces siembra papa y maíz en un terreno que posee y en donde puede cultivar ampliamente. Esta actividad se ha convertido en su fuente de ingreso importante para su familia,  dedicándose cada día a su trabajo, asimismo sus hijos la apoyan en cada tarea que necesita para que sus cosechas sean comercializadas a los mercados mas cercanos a su zona. Le agrada ser independiente, razón por la cual se mantiene trabajando de esta forma y siempre ha procurado que su negocio sea rentable, por tal motivo espera tener más áreas de terreno donde pueda seguir cultivando. Es su crédito número 6  que tiene con MFP y se siente orgullosa de formar parte de su banco comunal porque considera que su grupo es sólido y organizado. Asimismo agradece por el préstamo que es un apoyo importante. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para poder sembrar más papa en terrenos que tiene disponible.
texts.en:
Jesusa is 43 years old and lives in a rented house with three of her four children. At the age of 18, she started her own business. At first she managed a store where she sold basic necessities. Now she is a farmer who cultivates a plentiful amount of potatoes and corn on land that she owns. This business provides a strong source of vital income for her family. Jesusa devotes each day to her work. In addition, her children help her with each task that needs to be done so that her harvest can be sold at the markets closest to her area. Jesusa likes being independent, which is why she continues to work in this manner. She always tries to make her business profitable. For this reason, she hopes to have more land so that she can continue farming.

This is her sixth loan with MFP. Jesusa is proud to be part of her Communal Bank, which is considered to be a solid and organized group. She is thankful for the loan because it is a great help. The loan she requested will be invested in sacks of compost for growing more potatoes on the land she has available.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of compost.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Sabina de 51 años es soltera, tiene casa propia con los servicios de agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito de Monsefú. En la cual los pobladores desarrollan la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesanía.

Sabina se dedica a la compra y venta de pescado fresco en forma ambulatoria en el mercado Moshoqueque, desde muchos años, los martes y viernes son los días que más concurrencia de gente hay en el mercado y su producto sale rápido, los otros días del a semana realiza su venta también por las diferentes calles de la ciudad de chiclayo.  La venta de sus productos la ayudan a solventar sus gastos diarios de su casa.

A solicitado un préstamo Sabina de 2500 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para comprar más pescado fresco y salado, lo que le permitirá incrmentar sus ingresos parapoder pagar su crédito y mejorar su calidad de vida.  El sueño de de Sabina es tener en un futuro cercano tener un puesto propio en el mercado Moshoqueque, que lo logrará con mucho empeño y trabajo.
texts.en:
Sabina is 51 years old and single.  She owns her own home which has water and electricity and is located in Monsefú district.  The residents of this district work in farming, livestock raising and handicrafts.

Sabina's business is buying and selling fresh fish as an itinerant vendor in Moshoquque market.  She has been in this business for many years.  Tuesdays and Fridays are the busiest days in the market and her products sell quickly.  The other days of the week, she also makes her sales in the different streets of the city of Chiclayo.  Selling her products helps her to cover her daily household expenses.

Sabina has requested a loan for 2,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy more fresh and salted fish.  This will allow her to increase her income.  She will use the money to repay her loan and improve her quality of life.  Sabina's dream, for the near future, is to have her own stall in Moshoqueque market.  She will achieve this with a lot of determination and hard work.

loans.use: to buy more fresh and salted fish

loans.name: Bokk Ndeye Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de solidarité est créé le 31/05/207.Il est composé de 15 femmes qui sont issues du même quartier et partage le même centre d'intérêt : le développement de leur territoire.Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Dioncounda est responsable du groupe,elle est divorcée et mère de 05 enfants,elle s'occupe également de sa belle fille.

Elle fait de la transformation et vente de jus de fruits naturel.ELLE pratique cette activité depuis l'an 2000 année de son divorce.

Son prêt lui permettra d'acheter des intrants pour la fabrique de ces jus.

Son objectif est de prendre en charge sa progéniture,payer la scolarité de 3 de ses enfants,augmenter son niveau d'épargne dans le banc villageois.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created on 31st May 2007. It is made up of 15 women who all come from the same neighborhood and have the same interest: the development of their land. Their main activity is running small trading businesses.

Dioncounda, who is in charge of the group, is divorced and mother to five children; she also takes care of her step-daughter.

She makes and sells natural fruit juices and has been carrying out this business since the year 2000 when she divorced.

Her loan will allow her to buy ingredients for making her juices.

Her aim is to take care of her offspring, pay for the schooling of three of her children and increase her savings in the Banc Villageois.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for the preparation of fruit juice

loans.name: Miler

texts.en:
Miler, from the village of Sebasi Clarin Misamis Occidental, is 29 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Miler owns and operates a motor transport service. Engaged in this business for over one year, he earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Miler joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting his first loan for 13000 PHP to repair his vehicle and purchase new tires for better service, he plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle and purchase new tires for better service.

loans.name: Colletta

texts.en:
Colletta is  33 years old, single, and has three children. She owns a boutique shop in Mariakani where she sells new and used clothes to her clients. Her business has been in operation for the last eight years. 

Colletta is requesting her third loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase more bales of clothes for her business. The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and sustain her family. Her future dream is for her business to expand to other areas of operation.

loans.use: to purchase more bales of clothes

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 35 years old, married and has five children.  To earn a living, Peter sells kerosene and he has employed one person.  He works hard in his business to provide education for his children. Through Faulu Kenya, he has expanded his business.  Peter is determined to succeed in his business.  He dreams of opening several outlets of his business in five years.

Peter has requested for 70, 000 Kenyan shillings to buy kerosene.

loans.use: to buy kerosene.

loans.name: Rovshan

texts.ru: Rovshan 33 qoda. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom ,pereselenec iz Kalbadjar region, seychas projivayet v Absheron regione vmeste so sovyey semyoy. Rovshan jenat i u nego 2 rebonka. Rovshan ranshe zanimalsya vipechkoy xleba no uje 2 qoda kak on otkril svoy magazin dla prodaji produktov. Eto uje vtoraya ssuda Rovshana on ochen blagodaren za pevuyu ssudu Kive i lenderom. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit xolodilnik dlya xraneniya produktovv magazine.
texts.en: Rovshan is 33 years old. He is an internally displaced person. He has been relocated from Kalbadjar region and now lives in the Absheron region together with his family. Rovshan is married and has two children. He used to be in the business of baking bread, but since two years ago he opened his own grocery store. This is a second loan for Rovshan and he is very grateful to Kiva and the lenders for the first loan. At this time he needs 2000 AZN to buy a refrigerator for storing food in the store.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator for storing of food

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal La Unión Hace La Fuerza. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar vive el Señor José Luis, tiene 30 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene una niña de siete años la cual es discapacitada, no puede oír ni hablar. Su mujer se dedica a las tares del hogar.

El tiene un pequeño taller de carpintería en el cual realiza muchas obras como puertas, muebles, sillas, anaqueles y otros producto con la madera y los realiza bajo pedidos, dice que lleva siete años con su taller y que gracias a Dios no le ha faltado trabajo, labora de lunes a viernes desde las 8am hasta las 18h00, la materia prima la compra en un depósito de madera en  la ciudad de Portoviejo.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar más madera, pintura, laca, clavos, pega y otros productos para la elaboración de sus obras. Está en el banco comunal hace   dos ciclos y le gusta mucho las charlas.
  
Sus sueños son tener un taller más grande con maquinaria adecuada.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank "La Union Hace La Fuerza" of the canton of Rocafuerte meet every two weeks. This place is known for the delicious sweets prepared by the locals and they are renowned throughout the entire country.

This is where Jose Luis lives. He is 30 years old and he is married common-law. He has a seven-year old daughter who is handicapped. She cannot hear nor speak. His wife takes care of their household.

He has a small carpentry shop where he carries out various projects such as building doors, furniture, chairs, shelves, and other wood products. He takes orders on his projects and he says he has been in business with his carpentry shop for seven years, and thank God that he has not been without work. He works from Monday to Friday from 8am to 6pm. He buys his materials from a wood depot in the city of Portoviejo.

This loan will be used to purchase more wood, paint, lacquer, nails, glue, and other products he needs for his projects. He has been with his communal bank for the past two loan cycles and he really likes the talks.

His dream is to set up a larger shop equipped with adequate tools.

loans.use: to purchase wood, paint, lacquer, nails, glue, etc.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is married and has three children. Her husband is a carpenter. She has received a junior high level of education. Ama sells rice porridge and serves it with bread, milk and sugar at Abura as a peddler. She has been doing this for five years.  She helps to feed, clothe and educate her children with the help of the husband. Ama will use the loan to promote the sale of rice porridge by purchasing rice and other items to cook to sell. With the new earnings from her extended business, Ama plans to save towards the university education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase rice and other items to cook to sell.

loans.name: Mastula

texts.en: Mastula lives in Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. Mastula has a business selling clothes. She has been in this business for five years and she works six days out of every week. Mastula sells her products in a shop, by means of retail. Mastula has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more new clothes for resale. She also generates additional income through tailoring .The main business challenge(s) for Mastula include transportation and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to be a wholesaler and to build her own house .Mastula lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more new clothes to sell

loans.name: Carmen Mercedes

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal El Paraíso se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Carmen, tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 5 hijos, 4 de ellos mayores de edad y la menor de 9 años que estudia en escuela, dos de sus hijos  aun vive con ella. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella tiene un local en el centro de Picoaza en el cual vende de todo un poco en lo que se refiere a prendas de vestir, allí también sus clientes pueden encontrar sabanas, toldos, almohadas, carteras, cortinas entre otras cosas. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta  las 18h00 con la ayuda de su hija y su esposo, nos cuenta que hasta su negocio llegan muchas personas ya que en su local encuentran los productos más barato y de la mejor calidad. Ella compra en Huaquillas o en Guayaquil cada vez que necesita más mercadería. Tiene este negocio 15 años y le va muy bien ya que cuenta con mucha clientela.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar más mercadería como: ropa de todo tipo, toldos, sabanas, carteras entre otras cosas que vende en su local. Está en el Banco Comunal 2 ciclos y le gustan los créditos ya que son de mucha ayuda. 

Su sueño es seguir aumentando su local.
texts.en:
The communal bank El Paraíso [Paradise] meets bimonthly in the Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo, a place known as a commercial zone as well as for its traditional festivals of San Pedro and San Pablo and for its friendly people.  

Here we meet Señora Carmen who is 44 years old.  She is married and has 5 children, 4 of whom are adults and the youngest is 9 years old and attends school.  Two of her children still live with her.  Her husband is a merchant.  

She has a shop in the center of Picoaza where she sells a little of everything with regards to clothing.  Her customers can also find sheets, canopies, pillows, purses, curtains, etc.  She works all day from 8:00 am until 6:00 pm with the help of her daughter and husband.  She tells us that many people find that she offers cheaper products that are of better quality.  She does her buying in Huaquillas or in Guayaquil when she needs more merchandise.  She has had this business for 15 years and things are going well for her as she has a lot of customers.  

With the loan she will buy more merchandise such as canopies, all types of clothing, sheets, purses and other things she sells.  She has been in the communal bank for 2 cycles.   She likes the loans as they help her a great deal.  

Her dream is to continue improving her shop.

loans.use: purchase clothing, canopies, sheets, purses, etc.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is a 63-year-old married woman with two adult children. She is a farmer working in the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. Francisca grows rice crops on her land. She also raises pigs in her backyard. Francisca works hard to support her family.

Francisca requested this loan to purchase fertilizers, piglets and feeds. Francisca hopes to expand her businesses in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, piglets and feeds.

loans.name: Oscar Mauricio

texts.es:
Oscar, vive con su esposa y tres hijos de 8,10 y 16 años, el se dedica a alquiler de taxi donde los clientes llegan y lo contratan para el día o dos días dependen para que lo necesitan, trabaja todos los días de lunes a domingo .
El préstamo lo necesita para arreglo del taxi como (cambio de llantas, pago de nuevas placas, refrenda de tarjetas) de esa forma tendrá en mejor estado el taxi y tendrá mejor equipo de trabajo, podrá darles más atención a sus clientes y de esa forma podrá obtener más ingresos.
