La señora Lourdes  de la Nube Zhispun P. es socia del Bankito Comunal las Novatas, ella vive en  el sector de Medio Ejido una  zona urbana de la Ciudad de Cuenca, se encuentra felizmente casada, tiene 29 años de edad y 4, y se encuentra embarazada de tres meses de su quinto hijo, nos cuenta que este embarazo le está dando un poco de complicaciones por lo que tiene que estar un mayor tiempo en repos;  vive arrendando, su esposo trabaja en una tapicería y forman una familia estable.

Lourdes trabaja en un gabinete de belleza de su propiedad, es muy conocedora de los cortes y peinados que se encuentran a la moda, por que trabaja en esta rama de la belleza desde que tenía 14 años de edad, ya son 12 años de experiencia, tiene su propia clientela, trabaja en su negocio propio hace 7 meses por que se compro el local.

 Este es su tercer crédito en la fundación y se encuentra muy contenta porque con el dinero que la fundación le presta paga las letras de su local y adquiere más productos para llenar su vitrina con productos de belleza.

Su meta es de ampliar su local de belleza y abrir otras sucursales.
texts.en:
The Las Novatas Communal Bank is located in the city of Cuenca. It is a very beautiful city, being the cultural heritage of humanity. It is the third most important city in Ecuador. Its climate is cold, but the heart of our people is very warm. They are kind and hospitable people with their own and with strangers. This bank is make up of seven members who are very good friends. They have known each other for years, and they have united to form a communal bank, look for self improvement, and have a more decent life for themselves and their families. The members live in different central parts of the city of Cuenca. Following are their statements. María Isabel Q. is a member of the Las Novatas Communal Bank. She lives in the urban region of the city of Cuenca. María Isabel is 40; and she has four children, 22, 21, 16, and 8. Her first child is married and lives independently with his family. Her second child studies at CEDEC, and he works for his personal expenses. The other two children are in elementary and high school. María Isabel’s husband emigrated to the exterior, and he sends them money to pay some of the household expenses. They do not have their own house; they rent. María Isabel raises chickens. She has been doing this for two years, and it is going very well. She tells us that with her business she pays debts. With the small earnings that she gets, she increases her business to make it more productive. This is her third cycle working with her communal bank. She is very grateful for all of the benefits she has. With the loan received she will buy more chicks, food, and vitamins for her chickens, and increase her business. María Isabel’s dream is to have her own house to give her children tranquility. Rosa María M. P. is one of the happiest members of the Novatas Communal Bank. She lives in the urban region of the city of Cuenca. She is 39, married, and has six children. They are 25, 22, 20, 18, 15, and 13. Her first two children are married and have their own families. The four youngest children go to school and work for their expenses. Her husband emigrated to the exterior. Due to the world crisis, he sends them money only when he can. She does not have her own house; she rents. Rosa raises chickens. She has had the business for three years, and it is going very well because she has orders from fixed customers. When she has time, she works in her son’s upholstery shop. This is her third cycle with the Fundación Espor. She is very proud of the improvement she has made thanks to the loans she received. With the loan from the Foundation she will buy food for the chickens because she wants to expand the business. Her dream is to have a business selling wood and to expand her chicken business to give her children a better future. Lourdes de la Nube Zhispun P. is a member of the Novatas Communal Bank. She lives in the Medio Ejido area, an urban region of the city of Cuenca. She is happily married, 29, and she has four children. She is three months pregnant with her fifth child. She tells us that this pregnancy is giving her some complications, and she has to spend more time resting. She lives in a rented house. Her husband works in an upholstery shop. They are a stable family. Lourdes works in her own beauty station. She knows a lot about cuts and styles that are in fashion because she has worked in this area of beauty for 14 years. She has 12 years of experience. She has her own customers. She has worked in her own business for seven months because she bought the place. This is her third loan with the Foundation. She is very happy because the money the Foundation loans her pays for the installments on her place. She also gets more beauty products to put in her showcase. Her goal is to expand her beauty location and open other branches.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chickens, vitamins and food to raise them, and to expand their businesses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy drinks

loans.name: Brigite

texts.en:
Brigite N. is 29 years old and married with one child who is two years old. She lives in Nyarugenge district.

Brigite owns her small general store, which sells everything from clothes and towels to cups and plates. She has owned this shop for just two years and employs one other person. Their working hours are from 6 a.m. to 7 p.m. each day.

With this loan, Brigite will have capital to expand her offerings and attract new customers and hopefully earn a greater profit to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her store

loans.name: Gloria Josefina Bonilla Avilés De Pereira

texts.es: Gloria Josefina B. A. D. P. vive en el municipio D. Colon del departamento D. La Libertad junto esposo y sus dos hijas. Gloria tiene 54 años D. edad, hace siete años ella se dio a la lucha D. emprender su propio negocio, un taller D. costura, el maneja desD. su casa. Gloria es una mujer muy alegre, cada día pone lo mejor D. sí en sus confecciones, ya que ella manifiesta que la costura y el diseño son una gran pasión en su vida y es así como ve el trabajo D. todos los días, con un entusiasmo y espíritu emprendedor en su negocio. Ahora ella solicita D. un crédito para poder comprar nuevos cortes en tela y así seguir elaborando D. sus confecciones.
texts.en:
Gloria Josefina B. A. D. P., 54, lives in the town of Colon, which is in the La Libertad department, with her husband and two daughters. Seven years ago she took on the challenge of running her own business, a sewing workshop, which she operates from her home. Gloria is a cheerful woman who puts her best into each of her creations every day; she states that clothing design and manufacture is her life's great passion and that's how she views her daily work, with enthusiasm and an entrepreneurial spirit. She requests this loan to buy new fabric selections so that she can continue making her dresses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric for clothing manufacture.

borrowers.first_name: Gloria Josefina Bonilla Avilés De Pereira

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros R. is from the village of Tinaclaan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old. Milagros is single. To make a living, Milagros owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Milagros has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Milagros joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Milagros has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Milagros is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Milagros from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her income.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Jamuna

texts.en:
Mrs. Jamuna K. lives in Sainbu-Bhaishipati, lalitpur. She lives with her husband and one son. Her husband, Mr. Sahadev K., is a farmer and her son is studying in grade 7.

Mrs. Jamuna K. owns a cow and sells cow’s milk in her neighborhood. She carries milk containers and sells door to door every day in the morning and evening. To meet her rising demand, she is requesting a loan of Rs 30000.00 loan to purchase a young cow.

loans.use: To buy a calf for her milk-selling business

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Benkadi sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 26 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent avec leur mari et enfants dans des familles traditionnelles et  résident dans le quartier Fana coura, ville de Fana, sous préfecture de Fana, Région de KOULIKORO, République du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues par des liens de voisinage et de parentés. 
Ces femmes collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pérenniser leurs activités lucratives. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Avec ce  nouveau prêt elles comptent acheter, des trousseaux de tasses, une grande quantité de condiments alimentaires de différentes sortes et des habillements à Bamako (capitale du Mali). Les produits sont achetés en gros et sont revendus en détail, au  comptant et souvent à crédit au marché, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.  
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de  40.000FCFA par mois. Les bénéfices sont d’une part réinvestis dans l’activité et d’autre part dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi group are married women with an average age of 26 and on average, 2 children. They live with their husband and children in large traditional families and live in the neighborhood of Fana Coura, town of Fana, sub-prefecture of Fana, region of KOULIKORO, Republic of Mali.

They met one another through neighborhood ties and kinship.

These women work with the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwasa in order to perpetuate their money-making activity.

This is their sixth group loan and all the previous loans have been fully reimbursed.

With this new loan they are planning on buying sets of bowls, a large quantity of different kinds of condiments and clothing in Bamako (the capital of Mali). The products are bought wholesale and sold retail, in cash and often on credit to customers made up of women and men.

They each are planning to make an average monthly profit of 40, 000 FCFA. The profits are reinvested in part in the business and the other part in the daily family’s expenses.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bowls, clothing, and condiments

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es: Adolfo tiene 58 años, y junto a él vive su pareja y su hijo de tres años en su casa propia. Es así que para ganarse la vida y mantener a su familia se dedica desde 20 años a su taller de mecánica de motos y motocarros, ubicado en una parte de su terreno que tiene ya que no hay mejor lugar para trabajar tranquilamente. Paralelo a ello, Adolfo tuvo la oportunidad de comprarse una moto en el que parte de sus ratos libres se dedica al transportes de pasajeros al mismo tiempo ofrece arrendar su moto para que otros personas lo trabajen. Es de esta manera como se gana la vida, siendo su mayor motivación el trabajo de mecánica ya que se relaciona con muchas personas además que le resulta más rentable por tener clientes fijos. Con el tiempo espera construir un local más adecuado para su taller. Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP y esta dispuesto a ser muy responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. El espera invertir con el préstamo que solicita en su taller de mecánica, implementándolo con nuevas herramientas y darle mejor acogida a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Adolfo is 58 years old and lives in a home he shares with his common-law wife and their three-year-old son. They are his inpiration to gain a better life. For the past 20 years, Adolfo has operated a mechanic's shop for motorcycles and moto-cars. His shop is located on a portion of his land because there isn't a better place available for him to work quietly. In addition to his workshop, Adolfo had the opportunity to purchase a moto-taxi for himself, and during his free time he either transports passengers with it or rents it to other taxi drivers who are without access to a moto-taxi. When he rents his moto-taxi, his earnings also increase at the mechanic's shop because he has more time to simply interact with his clients and thus create permanent clients who return to him time after time. Currently, he is hoping to find a different plot of land where he can build his workshop, in order to have it in a more convenient location. This is Adolfo's fourth loan with Micro-Finanzas Prisma, and he is very reliable when it comes to his loan repayments. He plans to invest the loan in his mechanic's workshop by purchasing new tools so that he can take better care of his clients' needs.

Translated from Spanish by Suzy Marinkovich, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tools and renovation of mechanic's workshop

loans.name: Norie

texts.en:
Norie E. is from the village of Omunay, Damulog, Bukidnon. Norie is married and has an infant child. To make a living, Norie owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Norie has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Norie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Norie is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Norie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia E. is single and has three children. She has received senior high education.

Cecilia sells jewelry and used clothing at Elmina, which she has been doing for some time now. She uses her income to pay school fees and utility bills.

Cecilia will use the loan to purchase more secondhand clothes to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase more secondhand clothes to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Maravilla Group

texts.en:
This committee was formed by Mrs. Adelaida G., who lives on the 7th kilometer of the Murucuyá neighborhood in Ciudad del Este. She contacted her friends and neighbors to launch a group in their area. The group is called “Mujeres Maravilla” (“Wonder Women”) and is made up of 19 very active women from the same area who show great solidarity with one another. They have different business activities, and some group members were able to start new businesses in order to generate income and thus support their families. For example, Mrs. Ignacia V. did not have a business, but after joining this committee she became enthusiastic and started working as a street vendor selling clothing. She travels around, visiting commercial establishments in remote areas of the city. She earns good money and feels very fulfilled. She is happy to be able to help her family improve their quality of life. She used this loan to buy clothing like jerseys, shirts, pants, and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Staff

loans.use: Buy shirts, jerseys and pants

loans.name: Ana Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Ana  se levanta de horas tempranas 4:30am para elaborar los diferentes sabores de comida y refresco para luego trasladarse a las 6am a su puesto de venta en el mercado la estación finalizando a las 10:30 am.

Este crédito que solicito es  para la compra de arroz, azúcar, frijoles,  carne, pollo,  y otros.
texts.en:
Sra. Ana wakes up in the early morning hours so that she can begin preparing different flavors of food and beverages by 4:30am. By 6am, she has arrived at her vending post at the market station where she stays until 10:30am.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy rice, sugar, beans, meat, chicken, and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, beans, meat, chicken, and other items

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 50-year-old single mother of three children aged 32, 30 and 20 years though she currently lives with her three grandchildren in a rented house.

Florence sells cereals and dry foods in Masindi, Uganda, a business she has done for twenty years. She first started working in a hotel (restaurant), then sold bananas, and finally switched to selling cereals and dry foodstuffs.

Florence dreams of constructing her own residential house which he thinks is possible with profits from her business and credit from HOFOKAM.

This is Florence’s first loan from HOFOKAM which she intends to use to buy posho (a hot, sticky dough made from maize or cassava), beans, and groundnuts (peanuts) for reselling.

loans.use: To buy posho, beans, and groundnuts for reselling

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Djiguiya est composé de six membres : 3 veuves et 3 mariées dans des familles polygames avec une moyenne d’âge de 57 ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent  toutes  Bagadadji, un quartier populaire de la ville de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de mariage, de voisinage, de leurs activités commerciales au marché de Ségou Coura  et d’appartenance à une même association traditionnelle d’entraide des femmes de Bagadadji. 
Les membres du groupe Djiguiya font essentiellement l’achat vente du riz, de l’atiéké et des condiments alimentaires.
Dans le souci  d’augmenter le volume de leurs activités commerciales les femmes du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont à leur 10ème  prêt  solidaire après avoir correctement remboursés les neuf précédents.
Madame Mariam Koné qui est un des membres du groupe fait l’achat vente de  céréales il y a une vingtaine d’année mais depuis 2005, elle excelle dans la commercialisation du riz. 
Elle s’approvisionne  à la place de Niono sise à Ségou et compte utiliser son prêt   pour acheter une tonne et demi de riz auprès des grossistes. Elle vend en détail et en demi gros à domicile et au marché de Ségou Coura à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Madame compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 43000FCFA qui sera utilisé au remboursement du prêt, à la prise en charge de certains petits besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
The group Djiguiya is composed of six women:  three widowed and three married, in polygamous families.  The women average 57 years of age and six children each.  They all live in Bagadadji, a working-class district of Segou City (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  They know one another through ties of marriage, community, commercial work at the Segou Coura market, and belonging to the same women's traditional mutual-assistance association of Bagadadji.  The group members essentially buy and sell rice, atiéké (a cassava couscous), and condiments.  Concerned about increasing the volume of their businesses, the women of the group decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their tenth solidarity loan after having properly repaid the nine preceding ones.  Ms. Mariam Koné is one of the group members, and she has been buying and selling grains for about twenty years.  But since 2005, she has excelled at selling rice.  She gets her supplies at Niono square located in Segou.  She plans on using her loan for buying a tonne and a half of rice from wholesalers.  She sells retail and wholesale out of her home and at the Segou Coura market.  Her customer base is composed of men and women.   Mariam plans on making a monthly profit of 43,000 francs CFA that will be used to repay the loan and to meet certain sundry needs of the family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying rice

loans.name: Mrs. Yan Yim Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan consists of nine people who live in Roleang Kaen village in Kandal province. Mrs. Yan Y. is the village bank president, selected by all the members.  They will use the loan for different purposes. She owns a general store in the local village to earn some money to support her family. Since her business is going well she wants to expand it, but she does not have enough money. Thus, Mrs. Yan Y. decided to ask for a loan to buy more groceries to resell. Her husband, Mr. Chhay Duch, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to grow rice to support his family. Mrs. Yan Y. has two children. One of her children is a seamstress in a garment factory and one attends the local public school.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to resell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 52 years old, married to a farmer and has one child.  She runs a poultry farm to earn a living and is on her second year in this business.  She also does dairy farming to earn extra income.  Previously she raised vegetables.  

Mary joined Faulu Kenya in the New Beginning group after being introduced by a friend.  As a member of the group, she has been guaranteed a loan of 30,000 KES from Faulu Kenya.  With this loan, she plans to buy chicks under 10 days old.  She hopes to become a wholesale farmer in the future.

loans.use: To buy chicks

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more drugs for his pharmacy

loans.name: Houssein

texts.en:
Houssein is a 45-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife and their five children. For the past 24 years, Houssein has been running a car repairing and painting business. Today, for the first time, he is requesting a loan of 1500 USD from Al Majmoua, a Kiva partner, in order to purchase tools for his work, as well as to change the décor of his house by purchasing a new couch and a washing machine. 

Houssein decided on doing his business because he learned it when he was young. Thanks to his long experience, he was able to build networking, and his clients, who are people from his region, mainly his friends and neighbors, feel comfortable repairing their cars at his garage. Hussein is trustworthy in his work. He hopes for the future, to keep on improving his work and always provide the best for his family.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es:
Alexander Fernández V.  es un  señor de 35  años de edad quien vive con su esposa y 2 hijos  en una comunidad llamada El Sauce de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, Provincia de Cartago.  Es una pequeña comunidad rural de aproximadamente dos mil habitantes. Sus pobladores se dedican a la producción de leche y siembra de café. Tiene un relieve irregular y mucho del terreno se mantiene como bosque tropical húmedo. La comunidad tiene paisajes muy pintorescos que combinan el bosque tropical con dos lindas lagunas, plantaciones de café y lecherías.
Hace poco más de dos años, don Alexander se ha desarrollado como microempresario, con un pequeño proyecto dedicado a la  producción de leche y algunos derivados, tales como natilla y queso. El vive  con sus 2 hijos quienes han ayudado a mantener a flote el hogar y su pequeño negocio.  Colaboran tanto en la elaboración como en la comercialización de los productos.
Dice estar muy satisfecho  con este proyecto, ya que le ha generado una mayor confianza, ha servido como una fuente de ingresos para mejorar sus condiciones a pesar de algunos problemas que aquejan a la comunidad y sin dejar de lado que ha logrado mantener a su familia unida. Y no han tenido que emigrar a la ciudad a buscar trabajo.
Actualmente Don Alexander requiere un préstamo de ¢623,000 (Seiscientos veintitrés mil colones) con el fin de comprar una vaca lechera, la cual asegura conocer bastante bien porque es de su vecino. Con esta vaca el pretende aumentar la producción de leche y  así generar más ingresos que le permita seguir creciendo como Microempresario
texts.en:
Alexander Fernández V. is a 35 year old man who lives with his wife and 2 children in a community called El Sauce de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, in Cartago province. It is a small rural community with around 2,000 inhabitants, mostly producing milk and coffee beans. The area has hilly terrain and a lot of it is tropical rain forest. There are some real beauty spots, where the tropical forest meets two lovely lakes, coffee plantations and dairy farms. In a little over two years, Alexander has developed himself into a micro-entrepreneur, with a small business producing milk and milk products such as cheese and cream. His children have helped him keep the home and business running, even helping to make and market the produce. He says he is very happy with this project: it has increased his confidence and provided income to improve their living conditions despite difficulties that have befallen the little community - indeed it has enabled him to keep his family together, as it means he has not had to leave to find work in the city. Now Alexander needs a loan of 623,000 colones ($1200) in order to buy a milk cow from his neighbour. With this cow he will be able to increase his production, generate more income, and continue to develop as an entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a milk cow

loans.name: Nergui

texts.en: Nergui G. is 56 years old and lives with his wife in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. Currently, Nergui operates a taxi service in his town. He has been operating his business since 2002 and has gained much experience over the years. He transports people according to regulations in Narantuul, the biggest market to Hailaast, northern of Ulaanbaatar by a micro-bus. Nergui is a very hard working person and is known as a reliable lender of Xacbank. He has borrowed 3 loans and paid each back in full and on time.  He says, “My wife and I would like to meet our family's needs without help of our children and to improve the quality of my family's life.”  He is requesting a  4,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a microbus for his business.

loans.use: To purchase a microbus

loans.name: Bokk Jubo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité BOKK JUBO est créé au jour de l’inauguration du Banc Villageois GADAPARA qui l’abrite. Il est composé de 08 femmes du même quartier. Elle son formé leur groupe par voisinage et par affinité. 

Madame AÏSSATOU SAME D. debout à droite de la photo, est responsable du groupe. Elle est une femme mariée de 47 ans. 

Elle est vendeuse des boubous en thioup. Elle s’approvisionne à la capitale à Dakar. Elle va sa marchandise au comptant et à crédit dans son quartier et environs. 

Elle va acheter en quantité suffisante des boubous en thioup afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et réaliser beaucoup plus de bénéfices 

Son objectif est d’aider son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille par exemple la nourriture et le payement de la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
The BOKK JUBO solidarity group was created when the GADAPARA Banc Villageois was established. It is supported by the Banc Villageois. It is composed of 8 women from the same neighborhood. They formed their group by neighborhood and kinship. Mrs. AÏSSATOU SAME D., standing at the right in the photo, is the leader of the group. She is a 47 year-old marrried woman. She sells boubous made from thioup (a hand-dyed fabric). She gets her supplies at the capital in Dakar. She sells her merchandise for cash and credit in her neighborhood and the surrounding area. She is going to buy thioup boubous in sufficient quantity so as to better satisfy her clientele and to make a much larger profit. Her goal is to help her husband support the family, for example to pay for the food and the schooling of her children.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy Thioup fabric

loans.name: Tatiana Yaoska

texts.es: Tatiana Yaoska G. R. tiene ya 8 años de tener en su casa una pulpería en la cual venda ropa y accesorios de uso personal, obviamente en sus inicios el negocio no le podía abarcar todo lo que tiene ahora y tampoco podía conseguir la cantidad de clientes que tiene, sin embargo la lucha por superarse y salir adelante es lo que ha convertido ese negocio en lo que es hoy. Entre sus principales metas está ver crecer mucho más lo que hoy llama su pequeña pulpería.
texts.en:
Tatiana Yaoska G. R. has managed a store for eight years out her home, where she sells clothing and personal accessories. Obviously, at the beginning, she was not able to handle everything and neither did she have the number of customers like she does today. Nonetheless, she struggled to overcome these obstacles and has succeeded in making her business what it is today. Among her main goals are to grow what is now her little store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
Dolores tiene 63 años de edad, ella reside en San Miguel, vive con el compañero de vida y tiene un hijo el cual ya no depende económicamente de ella, ella se dedica a la fabricación de ropa y venta de sandalias, (zapato para dama). 
Dolores es costurera hace uniforme escolares trabaja con un proyecto nacional y también elabora ropa a personas particulares, el horario regular de trabajo es de 8:00am-7:00pm, ella estudio en una academia de costura para aprender a fabricar ropa. Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de materiales como son telas, hilo de seda de diferentes colores, también ella le gustaría invertir en la compra de sandalias para vender, esto le ayudara a incrementar las ventas mejorar los ingresos, mejorar la condiciones de vida de la familia.
Ella tiene como propósito manejar su propio dinero para no tener dependencia financiera.
texts.en:
Dolores is 63 years old and she lives in the town of San Miguel. She lives with her life partner and they have a son but he no longer depends on her financially. She makes clothing and she sells sandals (ladies' shoes). Dolores is a seamstress. She makes school uniforms for schools across the country. She also makes casual style clothing. Her regular schedule is from 8am to 7pm. She attended a tailoring academy to learn her trade. She requests a loan to purchase work materials such as fabrics, silk threads in different colors, and she would also like to invest in the purchase of sandals for resale. This will all help her increase her sales and her income. It will permit her to improve her family's living conditions. Her goal is to manage her finances so that she will no longer have to be dependent.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials such as fabrics, silk threads in different colors, and ladies' shoes.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora D., a married woman living in Prk. Indol, Brgy. Nangka, Bayawan City, Negros Oriental, earns her living by operating two enterprises: a general Store and a chopsachem dealership. Her husband, Nestor D., 49, works as a rice operator to earn a living. They have four children ranging in age from 14 to 23. Flora joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired to something better for her family.

With the help of her past 19 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Flora has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time she is borrowing PHP 19,500 to buy more stocks and new products for her general store so that she can continue to save up for the future of her children and for home repairs. Flora D. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more store stock to sell

loans.name: Yanina Margarita

texts.es: La señora N. P. tiene un tramo en el Mercado municipal de Masaya, en el que ofrece diferentes tipos de ropa, con este negocio le ha facilitado el bienestar económico que necesita su familia ya que a sus hijos les ha brindado lo mejor, en esta ocasión la señora está visitando las oficinas de Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito y poder comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas, vestidos y otros para tener mas variedad y aprovechar la temporada que viene porque para ella es mejor, y de esta forma poder dándole un mejor nivel de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Ms. N. P. owns a shop in the Municipal Market of Masaya, where she sells different types of clothes. Her activity has provided the economic welfare that her family needs, as she has given the best to her children. In this occasion Ms. N. P. has come to the offices of Ceprodel to ask for a loan she will use to buy trousers, shirts, blouses, dress and other items of clothing to have a wider variety of items and to take advantage of the upcoming season, as this is the best time for her activity: in this way she will be able to grant a better quality of life to her family.

loans.use: To buy trousers, shirts, blouses, dresses and other items of clothing.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie  is from the village of  San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City, Mis. Occ . She is 66 years old. Josie  is married and has 2 children. To make a living, Josie buys and resells items such as Ready To Wear clothing. As another other source of income she is a town health worker  in her local communtiy. Josie  has been in this business for about two years and earns approximately  1,000 PHP a month for this activity. 

On August 6, 2008 Josie  joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. This is her first loan taken  from PMPC amounting  to PHP 5,000 for additional inventory for her business  to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:

 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional capital for her ready-to-wear business

location.town: Oroquieta-San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City Misamis

loans.name: Flor De María

texts.es: La señora Flor de María M. P. es comerciante del Mercado central desde hace  8 años tiene un salón de belleza en el cual tiene dos  trabajadoras junto con ella, es casada y tiene un hijo en edad escolar por el cual se esfuerza para sacarlo adelante este financiamiento lo solicito para comprar tintes y ampollas  de tratamiento para el cabello,  la señora Flor M. tiene siete meses de trabajar con Ceprodel y con estos financiamientos siente que ha crecido su negocio bastante.
texts.en: Señora Flor de María M. P. has been a businesswoman in the central market for 8 years. She has a beauty salon in which she has two workers besides herself. She is married and has a son of school ago, for whom she exerts herself to help him advance. She is applying for this loan to buy dyes and vials of hair treatments. Señora Flor M. has been working with CEPRODEL for seven months, and with these loans she feels that she has grown her business quite a bit.

loans.use: Buy merchandise, dyes, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is a married man with one child who is still too young for school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and rent.

Nicholas has operated a boda boda (motorcycle) business for over two years, offering transportation to travelers and passersby. Nicholas cites seasonality and thieves as his major challenges. He hopes to own another motorbike in the future. He decided to join Yehu to get loans to boost his business. With this KES 20,000 loan, he wants to purchase fuel and spares parts for his motorbike.

loans.use: To purchase fuel and spare parts for his motorbike.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Isabel vive en casa propia en la zona de Senkata de la ciudad de el Alto, su esposo se dedica al transporte como chofer asalariado, vive junto a su hijo el cual esta en el ultimo curso de colegio. 
El crédito lo destinará en la compra de material de construcción, para construir una habitación para vivir más confortablemente y así mejorara su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

Es el primer crédito en Impro y primero vía kiva.
texts.en:
Mrs. Isabel lives in her own house in the zone of Senkata, Alto City. Her husband is a driver and they live with their son who is a senior in high school.

The loan will be used to buy construction materials to build an additional room. This would allow them to improve their living conditions and quality of life. 

This is her first loan with IMPRO, through KIVA.

loans.use: To build an additional room in the house thus improving living conditions

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a clothing business for the last year,  She sells at the market to her neighbors and market dwellers. She hopes to expand and establish a big clothes shop in the future.

With the 40,000 KES, she wants to purchase a bale of clothes for sale. She decided to join Yehu because it has no legal requirements.

loans.use: To purchase a bale of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es: Alejandrina, de 61 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su hijo menor Juan de 23 años, de los ocho que tiene, pero los mayores ya están casados y tiene sus propias familias. Esta trabajadora dama se ha dedicado toda su vida al comercio, es por esta razón que desde hace 10 años vende menús (comida diaria) a unos comerciantes de un mercado aledaño a su zona; de lunes a viernes cocina muy temprano y les lleva sus platillos a sus comensales. Le pagan semanal y esta muy satisfecha pues obtiene regulares ganancias y así puede mantenerse sola y ayudar a su hijo en los gastos del hogar. Además paralelamente a esta actividad también se dedica a la venta de ropa, por pedido, durante los fines de semana y también obtiene regulares ganancias. Como es muy emprendedora para el futuro tiene el anhelo de instalar su tienda de repuestos de autos, pues sus hijos mayores tienen este tipo de negocios y sabe que las ganancias son buenas. Es el séptimo  crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Alejandrina tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mercadería en ropa, pues se acerca las fiestas de fin de año y tiene varios pedidos pendientes por concretar, de esta manera espera seguir progresando.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is 61 years old.  She lives in her own home with her youngest son Juan who is 23 years old.  She has eight children in all but her older children are all married and have their own families.

This hard-working lady has been selling things her whole life.  For the past 10 years she has been selling meals to salespeople in a market in a neighboring area.  From Monday to Friday she cooks her meals very early in the morning and then delivers them to her customers.  Her customers pay her weekly and she is very satisfied because she makes regular income which means that she can support herself and help her son with the household expenses.

In parallel with this business, Alejandrina also sells clothes to order on weekends and makes regular income from this activity too.  As she is a very enterprising woman, in the future she plans to set up a store selling spare parts for cars since her older children have this type of business and she knows that the profits are good.

This is Alejandrina's seventh loan from MFP and she pledges to make her repayments punctually.  She doesn't want to let down the people who made this support possible as it will enable her to continue working in search of progress.  Alejandrina is planning to invest her loan in buying clothes since the end-of-year festive season is approaching and she has several orders pending which she needs to fill.  In this way, she hopes to continue making progress.

loans.use: To buy clothes to meet her customers' demands

loans.name: Daria's Group

texts.en:
Daria B. is from the village of San Jose. She is 54 years old. Daria is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Daria B.'s Group.

Daria is married and has 7 adult-aged children. To make a living, Daria owns and operates a business venture in the transportation sector providing motorcycle transport services. The main source of income for the business comes from operating tricycle transport services. Daria has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Daria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Daria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase an additional vehicle for the business. Daria is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Daria from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair an existing service vehicle

loans.name: Cecil Mariela

texts.es: Cecil casada, su esposo trabajador en zona franca, mejorar la forma de vida de su familia plan primordial, así que por tal mejora  la vivienda es el inicio.  Se le ha dificultado por la falta de financiamiento. Por tal agradece a la financiera por el apoyo para el desarrollo del nivel de vida, generando recursos para que sea bien invertido. Con el préstamo comprara materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro, zinc, ladrillos entre otros materiales y se construirá la parte de la cocina siendo de necesidad.  Generandole mayor comodidad y protección a la misma vez.
texts.en:
Cecil is married.  Her husband works in the free trade zone.  Improving her family's way of life is her main plan and improving her home is the first step.  This has been difficult because she lacks the money she needs.  For this reason, she is grateful to the institution for the support they have offered her in developing her living standards.  

Cecil will use this loan to buy building supplies such as cement, iron, metal sheets, bricks and other materials.  She will build part of her kitchen as this is necessary.  This will provide her with more comfort and more protection.

loans.use: To buy building supplies

loans.name: Franz Celier

texts.es: El Sr. Franz vive en casa de sus padres es casado su esposa se fue a España  el vive con sus padres que ya son de edad avanzada el les ayuda en su manutención y también sus hermanos, el señor trabaja vendiendo líneas de teléfono celular,  pre pago y post pago  para una empresa de telecomunicaciones de la ciudad de Cochabamba,  el préstamo que sacó es para la reparación de su motocicleta con la que trabaja por que se encuentra en mal estado y necesita repuestos y un mantenimiento en general, es un apersona muy amable y trabajadora, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Franz lives in his parent’s house.  He is married, and his wife went to Spain.  He lives with his parents because they are elderly.  He and his siblings help them with their living expenses.

He works selling cell telephone lines, both prepaid and postpaid, for a telecommunications business in the city of Cochabamba.

The loan that he took is for repairs on his motorcycle, which he uses to work.  The motorcycle is in bad shape.  It needs replacement parts and general maintenance.

He is a very good-natured and hard-working person.  He is grateful to the institution for the support they have provided.

loans.use: To repair his motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy hair weaves and cream relaxers

loans.name: Paciencia

texts.en:
One has to learn and re-learn certain values in life in order to develop the right attitude and become successful. At the age of 50, Paciencia Pisuana is committed to re-learning many things in her life. She only attained a high school education, but she makes sure she understands and applies every lesson she receives from CCT* as a community partner. Paciencia and her husband Ferdinand, who is employed as a chauffeur, live in Dasmarinas, Cavite, where they have raised four children. One of their children stays at home, one is employed, one is in enrolled in high school, and the youngest  is in elementary school.
 
Paciencia is a determined entrepreneur. She patiently manages her own little sari-sari (variety) store daily, which is situated near their home. Here she sells instant noodles, sachets of shampoo, and detergent, as well as soft drinks, which serve as a popular thirst quencher in the hot weather. She also runs a carinderia (small eatery), where she cooks meals for busy working people. In addition, she sells mineral water as an additional source of income. Together, these micro-entrepreneurial efforts enable her to earn Php 10,000 per month.

To help her improve her primary business, she is applying for a Php 9,000 loan. She will use this to replenish the stock of products she offers in her store. She knows she has to do this in order to offer her regular customers fresher options and encourage them to patronize her store. With additional money on hand and with a commitment to continuous learning, Paciencia is positive that she will become more profitable with her business.

As with any other entrepreneur, it is Pacienca's dream to make her sari-sari store grow. She aims to earn more in order to be able to save more and to level up her business. But her deepest dreams are as simple as they can be: amidst all the hassle of running a sari-sari store, a carinderia, and a mineral water business, she desires a peaceful, healthy life - not just for herself but for her entire family.


*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to replenish and expand the stock of goods she offers in her store

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.en:
Nicolas works hard to support his family. Nicolas is married and has a junk shop business in the Philippines.

Nicolas requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase scrap metals and plastics.

Nicolas has been in this business for 25 years now and earns additional income from a general store.

In the future, Nicolas would like to send all his children to school.

loans.use: to purchase scrap metal and plastic

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more firewood and cooking materials to add to her business

loans.name: María Rosalba

texts.es:
María Rosalba A. L. a sus 58 años es una luchadora incansable, pues desde joven y como madre cabeza de familia de dos hijos tuvo que enfrentarse a trabajar en lo que sabe, vender comidas caseras, con el fin de hacerse al sustento y al de su familia. 

María Rosalba trabaja sola y sabe que su sazón es su fuerte, pues sus platos aunque sencillos son de buen sabor y según ella, eso es lo que le gusta a mis clientes. 

Con el fin de lograr mayor agilidad a la hora de elaborar las comidas para vender, María Rosalba necesita de una estufa que le permitirá sacar sus platos mucho más rápido, por ello, necesita de un préstamo puesto que no cuenta con los recursos para hacerlo.
texts.en:
At age 58, María Rosalba A. L., is a tireless hard working woman.  Since she was young, head of the household, and mother of two children, she had been working at what she knows best, selling home cooked meals.  In this way she can support her family.

María Rosalba Works alone and knows that her seasonings are her strengths, because her dishes, although simple, have a good flavor and according to her is what her customers like best.

She needs a new stove in order to speed up her business and be able to get her dishes out quicker.  She does not currently have the necessary resources, so she needs this loan.

loans.use: to buy a new stove

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
El Banco comunal se denomina “SUMAC TIKA-VALLE SAGRADO”; Este Banco se encuentra situado en el Poblado de Qotohuycho, perteneciente a la Provincia de Urubamba, Departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr: Daniel, el socio tiene 52 años de edad;  el socio es casado y tiene 2 hijos los dos son independientes; el socio trabaja como maestro de obras él es albañil y trabaja principalmente en construcciones, el socio requiere este crédito para poder invertir en su vivienda y mejorar su casa, el socio desea comprar materiales para revestir su vivienda, y terminar la construcción que inicio el año pasado. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales para mejorar su vivienda.

El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos y elaborar sus platillos para la venta.
texts.en: This member is part of the communal lender “SUMAC TIKA-VALLE SAGRADO,” located in Qotohuycho, Urubamba Province, Cusco.  Daniel is 52, married and has 2 children living independently.  He is a manual laborer and works in construction.  Daniel seeks credit to buy needed construction materials to improve his house and finish repairs he began last year.  This is an important investment in improving the quality of life of his family.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to repair his house

loans.name: Cesar Roberto

texts.es: Cesar Roberto de 49 años de edad, habita en  casa propia con su esposa y dos hijos. Cesar es un hombre luchador y dedicado a su familia. Durante mucho tiempo ha trabajado duramente en la venta de leña y haciendo viajes de arena y piedra para llevar a su familia el pan de cada día. El  negocio de leña lo tiene en su propia casa y los viajes los realiza en la zona donde habita. Su negocio está ubicado en un lugar de fácil acceso por lo que muchas personas lo prefieren y demandan la buena leña que él vende. El sueño de Cesar es poder dar a su familia una mejor vida y esto es lo que lo inspira cada día para seguir trabajando. Con la fe puesta en Dios y con muchas ganas de trabajar a decidido hacer este crédito a INTEGRAL para poder invertir en su negocio en la compra de más leña y piedras para que los clientes siempre encuentren cada vez que necesiten. De esta manera espera aumentar sus ventas lo cual le darán mayores ingresos que le ayudaran para sacar adelante a su familia y lograr su sueño.
texts.en: Cesar Roberto is 49 years old and lives with his wife and two kids in their own home.  Cesar is a fighter and dedicated to his family, for a long time he has been working hard selling firewood and transporting sand and stone in order to obtain the daily bread for his family.  His firewood business is operated from his residence and the transportation jobs are done in the same area where he lives.  Cesar's dreams is to be able to provide his family with a better quality of life and it is what inspires him to continue working everyday.  With his faith in God and his willingness to work, he is dedicated to making his loan with INTEGRAL work so he can invest it in his business; in the purchase of more firewood and stones so that clients always have supply readily available.  He hopes to increase his sales in this way which raises his income to help get his family ahead and realize his dream.

loans.use: to purchase more firewood and stones so that clients always find them readily available.

loans.name: Sabi Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe!  This is 42 year old Chidoni (holding the yellow folder) from Masvingo.  She is married with three children aged 16, 23 and 25. Of the three, one is currently attending school.  Her husband is a mechanic.  

Chidoni runs a retail cross boarder business selling clothing.  The business has been in operation for 4 years.  She says the main challenges faced are competition and debtors not paying on time.  Chidoni has requested a loan of $400 to increase working capital which will enable her to buy more clothes such as blouses, t-shirts and blankets for the winter.  She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the general welfare of her family.  In the future Chidoni plans to acquire a motor vehicle and build her own house.

loans.use: to increase working capital to buy more clothes such as blouses, t-shirts and blankets for the winter

loans.name: Kheng

texts.en: Mrs. Kheng, a resident of Kompong Chhnang Province for many years, sews nets that she sells to neighbors and other villagers who need to protect their cows or other domestic animals from mosquitoes. Operating this business since 2008, she earns an income of around $3.5 each day to meet her family's daily expenses. She also has a life partner in her husband who plants fruits to earn more profit. They have one daughter working as a garment factory worker who shares her salary with them, while other three children are not yet attending school. Mrs. Kheng will use the loan she is requesting to buy more nets to sew for additional profit.

loans.use: to buy more nets to sew and sell.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 37 years old and lives in Plaridel. She is married with three children. 

Lucy has a bamboo furniture business and earns approximately 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 20,000 PHP to purchase materials for her bamboo furniture. 

Lucy has been a member of PMPC for three years.

loans.use: to purchase materials for bamboo furniture.

loans.name: Mohamad Ramzi

texts.en: Mohamad Ramzi is a 63 year-old married man, and owner of the only Internet cafe in his region. He is a hard-working man who seeks the best to secure his family's living. He opened his Internet cafe to attract teenagers and students to keep them away from drugs and bad habits, as well as to improve his living standard. To allow his customers to spend their time smoothly and happily, Mohamad Ramzi has a small snack stand in his shop where he sells chips, soft drinks, and sweets. He has requested a loan from A. Majmoua to buy a juicer that will help introduce fresh juice to customers, and to increase his inventory of tobacco and sweets. Mohamad Ramzi enjoys being at work because he likes to watch his customers enjoy spending their time at his place. He hopes he can upgrade his machines in the future and expand his shop.

loans.use: To buy a juicer, tobacco, and a sweets for his Internet cafe

loans.name: Im

texts.en: Mrs. Im would like to support the educational achievement of her child.  She is a widow with one child wH. works as a sewing factory worker in Phnom Penh.  She would like to borrow $600 in order to purchase a new motorbike for personal use.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike for personal use.

loans.name: Noly

texts.es:
La Sra. Noly pertenece al Banco Comunal “Esmeralda”, del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 31 años y 02 hijos, la mayor tiene 09 años, estudiante de nivel primario y el menor tiene 02 años de edad. Desde los 16 años  apoyó  a su mamá a vender productos de belleza, y a los 18 años, cuando adquiere la mayoría de edad, decide independizarse  iniciandose en la venta de diferentes líneas de cosméticos ofreciendo sus catálogos de productos de belleza y prendas intimas; gracias al primer préstamo de S/.300.00 nuevos soles, fue posible mejorar su negocio,  buscando con ello generar sus propios ingresos y así  apoyar en la economía de su hogar.
Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, comprará mas cosméticos e incrementará su stock de productos como: lápices labiales, talcos de cuerpo, perfumes, colonias, shampoos, cremas faciales, prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños, y así satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, amigos (as), familiares, vecinos y trabajadores de diversas instituciones públicas y privadas.
Noly, mujer  trabajadora,  anhela tener una tienda de abarrotes y cosméticos; está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse como mujer.
texts.en:
Noly belongs to the “Esmeralda” Communal Bank in Tarapoto district, in the province and department of San Martin. She lives with her common-law husband, is 31 years old, and has 2 children; the older is 9 years old and attends primary school, while the younger is 2 years old. Noly, since the age of 16, has helped her mother sell beauty products. At 18, having achieved adulthood, she decided to become independent and begin selling different lines of cosmetics from her catalogs of beauty products and intimate clothing. Thanks to her first loan of 300 new sols, she was able to improve the business, seeking to generate her own income and thus, help the household economy.

With this loan of 2,000 new sols, she will buy cosmetics and increase her stock of products, including lip pencils, body powder, perfumes, colognes, shampoos, facial creams, and apparel for ladies, gentlemen, and children, hoping to satisfy the needs of her customers, friends, family members, neighbors, and workers from diverse public and private institutions.

Noly, a hard-working woman, dreams of opening a grocery and cosmetics store. She is very grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping women such as her to have opportunities to develop themselves as women.

loans.use: buy cosmetics to sell, including lip pencils, perfumes, and other items.

loans.name: Jameela's Group

texts.en:
Jameela is a very active lady and supports her husband by selling clothes. She purchases the clothes from different cities and sells to her local area customers for profits. Her husband is an electrician and provides electricity repair services to his clients. 

Jameela has given birth to three sons and a daughter. Eldest one works in a factory while two others are studying. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her clothes selling business. She will use the loan in buying clothes in bulk quantity and of better variety which will allow her to make better sales and earn better profits. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Jameela.

loans.use: To buy clothes for selling.

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Kong (pictured with her granddaughter) is a farmer. She grows tomatoes, eggplant and corn. Her husband, Kol, is a builder of wooden houses. They have one son who is married and lives in the family home. The family is living on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Kong is requesting a loan of $1,000 to buy a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Mekhdi

texts.en:
Mekhdi is 24 years old. He is married and has one daughter. From the time he was a child, Mekhdi learned to work in the small business of sheep breeding. After he married, he continued working in the same business, watching the business grow as a result of his sacrifices, and seeing his family progressing more and more.

His hope is to continue growing and improving his business to offer a better future to his family. His wife is a master in a saloon and her monthly income is about 100 USD. Mekhti's business generates the main income which is 150 USD now.  He applied for a 1,000 AZN loan in case to buy additional animals.

loans.use: to purchase 8 sheep and 5 lambs

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en:
Vergie is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children.

Vergie has a shop that sells snacks, detergents, beverages, and soaps. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan for 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy detergents, soaps, and snacks to sell.

Vergie has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Vergie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy detergents, soaps, and snacks to sell.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es:
El señor Wilfredo tiene 48 años de edad y es talabartero, elabora Fajas, sandalias, llaveros, monturas de caballos, todos estos productos elaborados a base de cuero genuino, sus productos los vende en distintos departamentos de todo el pais, como ser Olancho, Comayagua, Choluteca y Danli, tiene varios clientes que le hacen pedidos grandes,  cuenta con dos empleados para la elaboracion de sus productos, gracias a las ganancias que le genera su negocio ha logrado graduar a sus hijos y tambien realizarle mejoras a su vivienda.
don Wilfredo es bien carismático y amable, se le nota que le gusta su trabajo, sus productos son de buena calidad y con diseños para todos los gustos.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de cuero, hebillas, broches y pegamento.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is 48 years. He is a leather craftsman.  He makes belts, sandals, keyrings, and horse saddles.  All of these products are made from genuine leather.  His products are sold in various departments around the country including Olancho, Comayagua, Choluteca y Danli.  He has various customers who place large orders.  He has two employees who make his products.  Thanks to the profits generated by his business, his sons have graduated from school and he is also making improvements to his home.  Wilfredo  is very charismatic and friendly.  He notes that he likes his work, and his products are of good quality and designed for all tastes.
The loan will be used to buy leather, buckles, fasteners, and glue.

loans.use: to purchase leather, buckles, fasteners, and glue.

loans.name: Logan Javier

texts.es: El señor Logan es un hombre trabajador y emprendedor quien se dedica a la venta de repuesto de motocicletas y video juegos. Este negocio lo inicio hace 4 años el cual inicio con poco actualmente  ha ido creciendo.  El invertirá el crédito en lubricantes, baterías rockert y ganher, llantas y video juegos.
texts.en: Logan is a hardworking and industrious man.  He makes his living selling video games and spare parts for motorcycles.  He started his business four years ago.  He started out with little but business has been growing.  He'll invest his loan in lubricants, Rocket and Gohner batteries, tires, and video games.

loans.use: to buy lubricants, tires, Rocket and Gohner batteries, and video games.

loans.name: Rosa Migdalia

texts.es:
Rosa Migdalia, tiene 38 años de edad y casada desde hace 18 años, tienen 4 hijos de 12, 14, 16 y 18 años de edad, quienes actualmente estudian, vive en la aldea la Peña, Santa Bárbara. Su esposo es  caficultor.

Doña Rosa, tiene 18 años de trabajar en el cultivo de café y adicionalmente a la producción de banano, también hace viveros de café para la siembra. Esta experiencia la tiene desde toda su vida. En la familia lo hacen por tradición y porque es una forma de vivir y poderse desarrollar y educar a sus hijos. Ya tiene un área de terreno cultivado de 2 manzanas. El producto de café lo venden en pergamino (grano) húmedo y los bananos lo venden por tallo. A esta actividad le dedica todo el tiempo necesario.
Es primer préstamo que obtiene con ODEF, y es para invertir en fertilizantes, abonos y herbicidas para darle un mejor mantenimiento a la finca de café y banano, y cultivar la tierra disponible que tienen.
texts.en:
Rosa Migdalia, 38, has been married for 18 years; she has four children who are 12, 14, 16 and 18 years old who are currently in school.  She lives in the village of La Peña, Santa Bárbara and her husband’s a coffee grower.

Rosa has been working growing coffee for 18 years and she also grows plantain; in addition, she sets up coffee nurseries for planting.  She’s had this experience her entire life.  It is her family’s tradition because it’s a way of earning a living and be able to develop and to educate her children.  She has a two-manzana [Central American unit of land measure] plot of land under cultivation.  They sell the coffee as damp beans and the plantain is sold by the bunch.  She dedicates all the necessary time to this activity.

This is her first ODEF loan and she will use it to buy fertilizer, manure and herbicide to provide better care for her coffee and plantain plantations and to cultivate the available land they have.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and farm supplies.

loans.name: Rexie

texts.en:
Rexie is 42 years old and lives in Sandugan, Larena, Siquijor.  She is married with three children. To earn a living, Rexie has a business of selling food. She earns about PHP 1,000 each month doing this type of work. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase raw ingredients for her food vending business.

She has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for one month.  In the future, Rexie would like to create a new menu for her business. She hopes also that her children will be able to finish their studying.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Mukhungula W.g Group

texts.en:
Receive greetings from Mukhungula W.G Group in Western Kenya! It is headed by Alice as the facilitator of the group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Alice is a mother of two children. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Alice had a very good maize yield harvesting 11 bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Alice was only able to harvest five bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land. With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Alice and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, Alice will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing. 

In 2012, the members of Mukhungula W.G group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize. She is pictured with her group members in the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Ny, 45, is married and resides with her husband and six children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She and her husband are farmers. Four of her children are employed: two work as garment workers, and two work as construction workers. 

Ny requests a loan of 500 USD to rent a lake in order to grow lotus. In the future, she would like to expand her business of growing rice and lotus, refurbish her house, and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to rent a lake in order to grow lotus.

loans.name: Jim

texts.en:
Jim is a farmer in Eldoret town in North Rift Kenya.  He is 33 years old and works in a tea factory within the locality.  In addition, he has been practicing poultry farming for the last 6 years and selling his poultry produce to the local market.  He is married and has two children, aged 9 and 4.

Jim has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to boost his poultry business by buying a generator and a solar panel for lighting his poultry farm.  He says these will help in feeding the birds at night and bring warmth during the cold seasons.   He says the income from his poultry project be channeled toward the education of his children.

Jim says the farmer's main challenge is the high costs incurred in treating the birds.

loans.use: buy a generator and a solar panel

loans.name: Yafea

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 65 years old, married and has three children.

Yafea has been an owner of a cafeteria since 2000. He offers a variety of drinks and sandwiches. He has sufficient experience in this field. He has a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a loan of $1200 to paint his cafeteria and to make an external ceiling. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to paint his cafeteria and to make an external ceiling.

loans.name: Maria Eileen

texts.en:
This is Maria Eileen, 30, a resident of Bacoor in the neighborhood of Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Fransales, a vendor, and the mother of two children. Together with her husband and children, she manages the household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses and her children’s studies.

Maria Eileen operates a market stall. She sells cooking products and condiments at the community market. She buys quantities of these products and sells them per kilo or per piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1000 PHP in sales every day.

Maria Eileen is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan. She will be using it to buy more cooking products and condiments in bulk to expand her product inventory. Through this loan she expects a boost in her business income.

Maria Eileen dreams of being able to give all of her children a good and high-quality education through all of her hard work. She faithfully meets with her CCT co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more cooking products and condiments in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Para comprar 4 cerdos y leña.

loans.name: Bashiri

texts.en:
Bashiri, 26, works as a motorcycle taxi or “boda boda” driver in Kampala, Uganda. Motorcycle taxis are extremely popular in Uganda because they allow passengers to avoid being stuck in traffic and to navigate the country's rough roads. 

Bashiri likes working as a boda boda driver, because he gets to be his own boss. Before becoming a motorcycle driver, he worked in a restaurant. 
 
Bashiri currently owns an old motorcycle and doesn’t have enough money to purchase a new one on his own. A new motorcycle will allow him to attract more customers, drive without worrying about mechanical problems, and earn extra income from selling or sub-letting the old one in a rural area. He plans to use the increased profits after completing this loan to invest in a small shop. 

Outside of motorcycles, Bashiri cheers for Chelsea football club.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle to replace his aging one, attracting more customers and improving his safety

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 29 years old and lives with his wife and three children.

He opened small garage in 2010 and uses this garage for washing vehicles. This business is the only source of income for his small family. 

Mohammad is satisfied with the income of his business, but he needs this loan to buy water pumps for cleaning the cars. This will increase his customers and increase his income which will help him to improve the financial conditions for his family. 

His dream is to expand his business, and he desires to use part of the profits on his children’s future education. Mohammad is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy water pumps

loans.name: Amour Group

texts.fr: AMOUR est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la première fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Léocadie Dossi (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 45 ans. Léocadie Dossi a arrêté l'école au niveau secondaire mais a appris la coiffure et l'esthétique, activité qu'elle exerce depuis vingt ans dans sa boutique. Léocadie Dossi ne vit plus avec son mari. Léocadie Dossi a un enfant, scolarisé et à sa charge. Léocadie Dossi vit seule avec son enfant. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Léocadie Dossi et son mari. Pour cette raison, Léocadie Dossi vend de façon secondaire des mèches, des tissus et des produits cosmétiques, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de son enfants et à son éducation. Léocadie Dossi s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Léocadie Dossi sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe AMOUR, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des mèches, des tissus et des produits cosmétiques.

loans.name: Oltinoy

texts.ru: Олтиной 47 лет. Родилась в джамоате Хуррамзамин. У Олтиной очень дружная семья. Она имеет двоих детей. Она очень трудолюбивая женщина. В родном селе  она имеет свою столовую. У Олтиной золотые руки. Она готовит очень вкусные блюда. Поваром  она работает  уже  14 лет. В  этой  кропотливой  работе ей помогает  муж  Бахтиёр. Из-за качественного обслуживания  и вкусно приготовленных  блюд у Олтиной хорошая клиентура. Кроме  всего  этого  дополнительно, семья Олтиной занимается откормом и куплей продаже скота. Олтиной сама доит коров, готовит сметану и кефир. Домашние молочные продукты она использует для блюд в столовый. Делая свои  блюда ещё вкусными и полезными. В заемные средства она хочет увеличить свой оборот, разнообразить меню чтобы привлечь еще клиентов и удержать ранних клиентов. Олтиной очень благодарит ООО МДО Арванд за финансовую поддержку и надеется на дальнейшие сотрудничество.
texts.en:
Oltinoy is 47 years old.  She was born in the Khurramzamin jamoat (municipality) and she has a very friendly family.  Oltinoy has two children and she is a very hardworking woman.  She runs her own cafeteria in her native village.  She is an amazing cook and prepares delicious dishes.  She has been working in this field for 14 years already.  Her husband helps her with this difficult work: together they provide quality service and serve delicious dishes.  Oltinoy has many customers.

In addition to all this, Oltinoy's family is involved in fattening cattle for resale.  Oltinoy gets milk from her cows and makes sour cream and kefir from it.   She also conveniently uses the dairy products that she gets from her cows in the preparation of the delicious dishes that she serves.

loans.use: to buy goods

loans.name: Gerónima

texts.en:
Mrs Perez has helped her husband for 4 years in their mechanic workshop, she supervises and manages the store when Mr Palacios has left to buy spare parts or to attend to a client outside of the workshop; he has been working for more than 20 years in this business.

\"Hope is the last thing to lose, we are not going to allow ourselves to be vanquished; we had part of the workshop roofed, but the wind has destroyed it, we have many customers because my husband is a good mechanic, it is only for the lack of resources that our business has not grown more, we lack equipment and tools, we are asking for $1, 500 dollars in order to continue to move forward.\"

Loan Use: To purchase equipment and tools.

La Sra.
