Afterward, he got some more experience by getting together with a friend and starting up a microbusiness selling vacuum-packed frozen goods like cheese sticks, little empanadas, and other snacks.

Two years ago his knack for innovation led him to rent an apartment garage and buy baking equipment. He has been well-received by his clients, so he has gradually been adding new products requested by his customers, like rice, oil, sugar, and grains, such that 50% of his sales are supplies and the other 50% are baked goods.  At the same time, William is using his commercial space to offer phone calling and recharge services that bring him additional income.  William works in his baking business Monday through Saturday and takes in average daily sales of 350,000 COP with an average profit margin of 35%.  

The loan William is requesting from Fundación Mario Santo DOmingo is primarily to buy merchandise and baking ingredients so he can increase his store's inventory.  He'll also buy supplies and ingredients in greater quantity so he can get discounts.  His goal is to expand his business, taking advantage of the market niche he's positioned in, which is making and selling snack foods and natural juices, a business he'd put on the terrace of his store, which is pretty big.

loans.use: To buy inventory, and baking ingredients.

loans.name: Edy

texts.es: Edy, de 32 años, natural del distrito de Quimbiri; es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto con su esposo Wilson de 37 años y sus 02 queridos hijos Juan de 06 años y Naomi de 03 años quienes son su adoración. Edy, es una señora muy carismática y enfocada en sus responsabilidades; se dedica al negocio de un Bar – Recreo con el nombre “Edy Mariluz” ubicada en el distrito de Quimbiri donde ofrece bebidas alcohólicas para el consumo de las personas mayores, igualmente ofrece platos típicos de la selva como: Tacacho con cecina, chilcano de carachama – bagre, que son peces oriundas de la zona selvática de nuestro querido Perú. Cuenta con el apoyo de 03 señoritas que están dispuestas a brindar la buena comodidad a su público concurrente, viene trabajando hace 08 años en este negocio y esta agradecida por la preferencia de sus degustadores. Los fines de semana tienen mayor acogida del público, lo cual le genera mayores ingresos. Los planes para su futuro negocio es abrir una  nueva sucursal con el mismo nombre y en el mismo distrito. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo cual se compromete a pagar puntualmente para así obtener los mejores beneficios posteriormente. Con los  mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará mesas y sillas para renovar su local.
texts.en:
Edy, 32, is from Quimbiri district.  She is a very cheerful, hard working woman living in her own house with her husband, Wilson, 37, and their two beloved children, Juan, 6, and Naomi, 3, whom she adores.

Edy is a very charismatic woman, focused on her responsibilities.  Her business is a bar/snack shop, called “Edy Mariluz,” located in Quimbiri district, where she sells alcoholic beverages to adults.  She also provides typical dishes from the jungle like: Tacacho con cecina (roasted, smashed plantain with pork), chilcano de carachama-bagre (river fish served stewed with tomatoes, onions and culantro), which are native to the jungle area of our beloved Perú.  She has three young women who help her and are willing to provide her public with good customer service.  She’s been in business for 8 year and is grateful for the preference her customers show towards her.  More people come by on weekends so income is higher then.  Plans for the future include opening a new branch with the same name but in a different district.

This is her first loan with MFP so she commits to repay punctually in order to receive subsequent benefits.  She will use the requested 1000 new soles to buy tables and chairs to upgrade her locale.

loans.use: To buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more cloth and threads

loans.name: Carlina's Group

texts.en:
Carlina R. is from the village of Benito Soliven, San Mariano, Isabela. She is 50 years old. Carlina is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Carlina is single. She owns & operates a business selling fish balls and other dimsums to the local community. Carlina has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Carlina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 4th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Dansou

texts.en:
Dansou is 40 years old and lives in the Bodjrenou district of Porto-Novo, Benin's administrative capital. Together with his wife Felicité he looks after their four children, all of whom are schooled.

For the past 12 years Dansou has been making furniture from his workshop. This is his second loan with ALIDE following successful repayment of the first. This loan will allow him to acquire fresh timber to turn into furniture. His ambition is to open a large furniture shop. His greatest strengths as an entrepreneur are his welcoming nature and creative spirit.

loans.use: to purchase wood to build furniture

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
Ernesto V. is from the village of Brgy. Roxas, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 60 years old. Ernesto is married and has four adult children. 

To make a living, Ernesto plants and harvests rice for sale. Ernesto has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 30,000 PHP per harvest or every five months.

In 2011, Ernesto joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. Ernesto is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the first loan taken out by Ernesto from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Chai

texts.en:
Chai V., 55, resides in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. V. and her husband are farmers, earning an income of USD 1 each per day. Two of their children are employed at the factory, earning an income of USD 3 each per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 60 on food and USD 10 on the other necessary expenses. 

V. is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase a motorbike for the children to commute to work. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing KiV. partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for the children to commute to work

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es: Delfina tiene 56 años, vive al lado de sus 3 hijas en su casa propia. Desde muy joven, aprendió a hacer lindos decorados en material de corrospum (material micro poroso, tipo plástico de diferentes colores) para centros educativos, y fiestas infantiles. Entre sus principales clientes son sus colegas, puesto que ella es docente y también los niños. Le entretiene mucho realizar estos trabajos manuales, elaborando diferentes personajes animados en este material, ya que lo hace en su casa y aunque lo considera fácil de hacer, pero lo difícil es perseverar en este negocio, y el tiempo le ha demostrado que sí. Actualmente tiene varios pedidos de diferentes centros educativos durante todo el año, lo cual le da mucha ventaja en sus ganancias. Para el futuro tiene planeado instalar un pequeño bazar donde pueda ofrecer diferentes productos y también elaborar adornos en corrospum. Es su crédito número 6 que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de ser parte integrante de su banco comunal  porque le permite mejorar en su negocio y crearse una fuente de ingresos importante de las cuales esta muy agradecida y seguirá comprometiéndose a seguir adelante en su compromiso de ser puntual en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más corrospum y otros insumos para elaborar materiales didácticos.
texts.en: Delfina is 56 years old and she lives together with her 3 daughters in a house which she owns. When she was very young she learned to make beautiful decorations of foam material (material that is porous plastic made in different colors) for educational institutions and for children's parties. Among her clients are her colleagues (she is a teacher) and children. She enjoys making these hand-made crafts, reproducing different cartoon characters with this material while working at home. She finds it easy to do but the difficult part is to persevere in the business, as time has demonstrated. She currently has various orders placed by different educational institutions throughout the entire year, which is very beneficial with respect to her income. For the future she has plans to set up a small store from where to sell different products and to make her foam decorations. This is her sixth loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she is very happy to be a member of her communal bank. It helps her to improve her business and to build herself a more important source of income. She is very thankful and she will continue to be committed and on time with her payments. The loan that she requests will be used to purchase crafting foam and other products used to make teaching props.

loans.use: to purchase crafter's foam and other material used to make teaching props.

loans.name: Gina Roselia

texts.es:
Gina de 37años, vive en una zona urbana en las Orquídeas (llamado así porque en su originalidad había muchas flores orquídeas) de Guayaquil. Su esposo trabaja en servicios de transporte y tienen dos hijos que estudian en escuela fiscales. su actividad comercail es la ventas de ropa.

Comenzó con un pequeño capital que tenia ahorra, y era representantes de las madres comunitarias donde pudo hacerse conocer y así es como emprendió su negocio de prendas de vestir. Labora desde las 9H00 am a 15H00 pm diariamente. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere comprar mas mercadería como es pantalones, calzados, blusas. Su sueño es ver a sus hijos realizados profesionalmente y poder poner una pequeña boutique.
texts.en:
Gina is 37 years old and she lives in an urban region in Las Orquideas, meaning The Orchids (named as such for the orchids that were originally found in the region) in Guayaquil. Her husband works in transportation services and she has two children who attend community school. Her commercial activity is the sale of clothing.

She started out with a small working capital that she had saved. She was a representative of the mothers in the community so she got to be well known and this is how she started her clothing business. She works from 9:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m. every day. Her dream is to see her children achieve careers and to set up a small boutique.

loans.use: to purchase $300 worth of pants, $400 worth of shoes, and $300 worth of blouses.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 62-year-old married lady and has four children.  For eleven years, she has been operating a retail shop to earn a living.  Besides that, she owns rental houses which generate additional income.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has grown her business and has employed one person.

Her dream is to stabilize her business in the future for more income generation.  She has requested 50,000 Kenyan shillings to open another retail shop and buy sugar, salt, maize flour, soap and cooking fat.

loans.use: To open another retail shop and buy sugar, salt, maize flour, and soap and cooking fat.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is married with two children. Elizabeth is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. Elizabeth is a farmer and raises different livestock to earn a living. She has been doing this just this year. She has requested a loan to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Elizabeth has been a member of PMPC just this year.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Djiguisseme I Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe DJIGUISSEME I sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Fala, un des villages de la commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, FATOUMATA qui est la première debout à droite, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour, de sarclage pour entretenir environs 1 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 60 000FCFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group DJIGUISSEME I are married women who average 36 years of age and three children living in polygamous families in Fala, a village in the Commune of Massigui, Prefecture of Dioïla, Region of Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of organizing their businesses better at the start of the off-season. The crops grown include rice and peanuts. The group members are on their fifth collaboration with the institution. 

With this new loan, FATOUMATA, who is the first one standing at the right (in the photo), intends to buy farm inputs and sundry supplies and equipment and to pay for plowing and weeding for maintaining about one hectare of rice and peanuts.

After the harvests, the produce is sold in the city of Massigui to a customer base composed of women and men. The women plan on making an average profit of about 60,000 francs CFA for each planting season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, manure, weeding, and sundry supplies and equipment

loans.name: Tahopan Group

texts.en:
Mariatu is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She was born in the small town of Mile-Ninety-One City and is 28 years old. Mariatu is married to a businessman and the couple has 2 children who attend secondary and primary schools. Mariatu has been selling market food for many years now. 

With the help of this loan, Mariatu and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Mariatu will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to buy cooking oil, pepper, salt, flour, etc. in large quantities to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, pepper, salt, flour, etc. in large quantities

loans.name: Yadamsuren

texts.en:
Yadamsuren, 28 years old, is an young man who is trying to build his own family life. He lives with his wife, 26, and daughter, one year old, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. He has been running a taxi business since 2009.

This year, he and his wife decided to sell some dairy products during Naadam, a Mongolian national holiday. But to do so they need a big-sized ger, a Mongolian traditional nomadic tent. Its recent market price is a little bit expensive, so he needs financial aid to start up this new business.

Thus, Yadamsuren is taking a loan to purchase a ger for his new business. Let's support him, please!

loans.use: to purchase a ger for his new business.

loans.name: Barna Amalia

texts.es:
Barna de 56 años, es una mujer trabajadora que vende mercadería a sus conocidos y amigos. También es empleada domestica ya que requiere de mas ingresos para darle una buena vida a sus hijos ya que está separada. 

H a trabajado hasta la actualidad para mejorar el estilo de vida de su familia por eso desea seguir trabajando y obtener un préstamo para mejorar su vivienda con algunas bloques, cemento, arena etc. En el futuro desea seguir trabajando y darle una mejor vida a sus hijos.
texts.en: At age 56, Barna is a hard-working woman who sells merchandise to her friends and acquaintances. She is also a domestic worker and needs a higher income in order to give her children a good life, as she is separated. She has worked up until now to improve her family's quality of life and therefore wishes to continue working and to receive a loan in order to improve her home with some blocks, cement, sand, etc... In the future she hopes to keep on working and give a better life to her children.

loans.use: to improve her home with blocks, cement, sand, etc...

loans.name: Duk

texts.en:
Mr. Duk, 48, is married to Mrs. Sy, 52, who is a local farmer in Kompong Speu Province. They spend most of their life time planting crops on their own farmland. They have five single children, two of whom are employed as workers in manufacturers. The couple makes a profit of about $5USD a day from their farming business. Mr. Duk would like to borrow some funds from Kiva in order to build a new kitchen room.   

In the future, Mr. Duk would like to enlarge his crop-planting business and to construct a new house which is bigger than the present one. In addition, he will send his children to study up to at least finishing high school level.

loans.use: to build a new kitchen room.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is 54 years old and married with 5 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Helen has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of PHP 19,500 from Kiva's partner, NWTF, to buy fishing gear and repair her fishing boat. Helen has been in this business for 36 years. In the future, Helen would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children. 

Aida buys and peddles fruits like green mangoes. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy fruits like mangoes to sell.

Aida has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Aida hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fruits like mangoes to sell.

loans.name: Tesmaniada

texts.en:
Tesmaniada is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 
Tesmaniada has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages .
Tesmaniada has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Tesmaniada hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Pura Concepción

texts.es: La señora Pura Concepción es una mujer muy trabajadora desde hace 30 años es costurera donde realiza trabajos como levantar bastillas,  colocación de cierres, vestidos de novia y quince años, vestidos de graduación y más. Hace años su esposo falleció por lo que quedo sola y tuvo que dedicarse de lleno a la costura ya que sería la única forma en que recibiría ingresos. En este momento Pura necesita de un préstamo para comprar tela, hilos y otros para que sus ventas incrementen.
texts.en: Pura Concepción is a very hardworking woman who has been a seamstress for 30 years. She does work such as raising hems, sewing in zippers, wedding dresses, quincañera dresses, graduation dresses, and more. Her husband passed away several years ago, which meant she was alone and had to work full time in sewing because that was the only way she could have an income. Pura now needs a loan to buy fabric, threads, and other items so that her sales can increase.

loans.use: to buy fabric and threads for her business

loans.name: Wilson Fernando

texts.es:
Wilson tiene 23 años, vive con sus padres en Atuntaqui que está a 15 minutos de Ibarra en la Provincia de Imbabura. Wilson se describe como una persona alegre, honesta y trabajadora.

Wilson trabaja solo en la carpintería, elaborando muebles de madera. Es el segundo crédtio que le solicita a Fodemi, el mismo que va a ser utilizado en la compra de madera lo que ayudará a que aumente su producción, sus ventas e ingresos económicos para mejorar su calidad de vida.

Su sueño para los proximos cinco años es ampliar su negocio y poder emplear a personas que necesiten trabajar.
texts.en:
Wilson, 23, lives with his parents in Atuntaqui which is 15 minutes from Ibarra in Imbabura Province.  He describes himself as a cheerful, honest and hardworking person.

He works alone in a carpentry shop making wood furniture.  This is the second loan he’s requested from Fodemi that he is going to use to buy lumber to increase production, sales and income to improve his quality of life.  His five-year plan is to expand the business to be able to employ people who need jobs.

loans.use: to buy lumber.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 36 years old, and married with three children. She presently lives at Lower Sto. Nino, Mahayag, Zamboanga del sur. She has a vegetable garden, and she has had this business  for almost two years. She requested a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her gardening business.

Liza has been a member of Paglaum Multi- Purpose Cooperative for three years. In the future, Liza hopes that she can provide for the needs of the family and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her gardening business.

loans.name: Sreypov

texts.en:
Sreypov, 40, is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. 

Sreypov’s husband is a construction worker and he also buys used motorbikes to resell. 

Sreypov is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a motorbike to resell. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income. 

In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her third loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to resell.

loans.name: Toem

texts.en: Toem is a 57-year-old married woman who lives in Kompong Speu province, Cambodia. She is a good mother who always cares for the family and provides a good education to her children at home. Presently, three of her children have their own individual work and businesses. Toem has been a farmer, cultivating rice crops alongside her husband, for a long time. With this loan amount, Toem would like to purchase an additional cow that can be used for farming work. She tells us that it will be much easier to work with two cows rather than one cow on her project. She hopes that she will be able to improve her business through using this loan.

loans.use: to purchase an additional cow for farming work.

loans.name: Kuir

texts.en:
Kuir is a 30-year-old married woman with no children. She has had a business selling soda and sugar in South Sudan for one year.

Kuir requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase soda and sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase soda and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Egamnazar

texts.ru: Эгамназар трудолюбивый добрый человек. Он женат и ответственный отец троих детей. Более 15 лет Эгамназар занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. В основном он выращивает овощи, такие как лук, морковь, репку и картошку. Эгамназар хочет получить хороший урожай и для этого ему необходимо обрабатывать землю и посеять семена. С этой целью он запрашивает займ в размере 2000$ США. Он планирует использовать займ для покупки минеральных удобрений, семян и топлива. Эгамназар надеется на вашу помощь и милосердие. Спасибо вам большое!
texts.en: Egamnazar is an industrious good man. He is married and is a responsible father of three children. Egamnazar grows crops for more than fifteen years. Mainly he grows vegetables such as onions, carrots, turnip and potatoes. Egamnazar wants to get a good harvest and for this he must cultivate the land and sow the seeds. With this goal he is asking for a loan of $2,000 USD. He plans to use the loan to buy mineral fertilizer, seeds and fuel. Egamnazar hopes for your help and mercy. Thank you very much!

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer, seeds and fuel.

loans.name: Awal

texts.en:
Awal is a 30-year-old married woman with two children; one is in school. She has had a business selling fish in Bor, South Sudan for two years.

Awal is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her child.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Book Diom Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Book Diom de l’association ALLAW rassemble 5 personnes qui évoluent dans le secteur du commerce et de l’embouche.
Leur président, monsieur Cheikh est un homme très actif qui évolue dans diverses activités. Il travaille dans la mairie des lieux, comme chargé de l’entretien des locaux ou il démarre sa journée à 5h du matin jusqu’à 11h. Il a démarré l’embouche bovine depuis plus de 10 ans et s’active le plus souvent les après-midi.
Il vient pour la première fois solliciter un crédit pour acheter un bœuf et le nourrir pour pouvoir le revendre après dans les marchés hebdomadaires.
Cheikh est marié, père de 5 enfants dont l’ainé âgé de 34 ans et le cadet, de 14 ans. Il s’occupe de la dépense quotidienne et de l’éducation de ses enfants. Comme ambition, il aimerait développer son embouche et acquérir une pirogue pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
The Book Diom group of the ALLAW association groups together 5 people who either work in retail or fatten livestock.

The leader of the group, Cheikh, is a very active man with diverse activities. He works as a building maintenance officer in the local town hall, where he starts his workday at 5 am and works till 11 am. He started fattening cattle 10 years ago and does this mostly in the afternoons. He is requesting his first loan so that he can buy an ox and feed it before reselling it at the weekly markets.

Cheikh is married and the father of 5 children, the eldest of whom is 34 and the youngest, 14. He covers the daily expenses and the children's educational costs. His aim is to develop his livestock-fattening business and to buy a pirogue for his children.

loans.use: to buy an ox (to fatten and resell) and cattle feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start a dairy farming business for his jobless wife.

loans.name: Entin

texts.en:
Entin, 34 years old, is in the business of retail selling of clothing and fabric. Her customers come from several villages and they purchase in credit terms and pay the goods in several installment payment arrangement (retail credit sales).

She collects the installment payment from her customers in weekly basis.

All of the loan to be provided by MBK in the amount of $50 is to be used to purchase of merchandise for her business. Her weekly revenue is Rp 300,000 (around $ 30) with profit of Rp 100,000 (around $10).

Translated from Indonesian by Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Selling of clothing (Dagang Kain)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chickens and chicken feed for her farming business

loans.name: Gilda Sebastiao

texts.pt:
Client: Gilda Sebastiao C. Area of business: Retail Loan Amount: 12.000.00 mt ( US$480.00) Purpose of the Loan: Purchase and sale of merchandise Loan Payment Beginning Date: 07/10/07 Loan Last Payment Date: 07/31/08

Gilda Sebastiao C. was born on December 10th, 1965, in the city of Chibuto in the Gaza province. She lost her father before she was born, so her mother and her older siblings were responsible for her upbringing. She went to school until the seventh grade and got pregnant when she was seventeen years old - that lead her to move in with the baby's father, with whom she later had three more children. Twenty years later, her husband, after retiring from the company he worked for, left Gilda and took on a relationship with his fex-wife in the city of Inhambane. In order to provide for her children she tried to find a job but had no success.She, then, came up with the idea to start up a business to sell clothes and assorted products. With the help of a friend she began traveling to South Africa - it still is the place where she buys her merchandise from. She has been able to support five people with the income generated from her business. She became aware of Hluvuku through her son-in-law, who works at Catembe. She was approved for a 12.000,00 mt loan which she spent buying additional merchandise to strenghten her business that was dwindling financially at that point. In the future, she intends to settle in a shop where she can accommodate and sell all of her products. Currently, she has no fixed location to sell her merchandise.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer Cliente: Gilda Sebastião C. Actividade: Comércio Valor de Empréstimo: 12.000,00mt (480.00US$) Aplicação do Empréstimo: Compra e venda de produtos Início: 10/07/07 Fim: 31/07/2008 Gilda Sebastião C. nascido em 10 de Dezembro de 1965 em Chibuto na província de Gaza. Perdeu o pai antes de nascer .tendo sido criado por sua Mãe e irmãos mais velhos , estudou até 7ª classe e aos 17 anos fica grávida e teve que viver com o seu marrido com qual tiveram quatro filhos. Vinte anos depois o marrido teve reforma na Empresa em que trabalhava abandonou-lhe e foi viver com a primeira Mulher em Inhambane . Para garantir o sustento dos seus filhos tentou procurar emprego não tendo conseguido, pensou em iniciar um negócio de venda de produtos e roupa e com ajuda de amigas passou a viajar á África do sul onde até agora tem feito compras.na base deste negócio,consegue sustentar um agregado de cinco pessoas. Atravês do seu genro que trabalha na Catembe , ficou a saber da existência da Hluvuku tendo ido solicitar um financiamento. Com o valor de 12.000,00mt financiado aplicou na compra de produtos reforçando o seu negócio uma vêz que já tinha insuficiência financeira. Futuramente pretende obter uma mercearia onde poderá colocar os seus produtos uma vêz que agora trabalha em regime ambulatório.

loans.use: To increase stocks of clothes

loans.name: Aimalefoa

texts.en:
Aimalefoa T. runs a lawn mowing business. She has five children and her husband is a carpenter. All her five children are attending village school and are supported by their father.

Aimalefoa decided to join SPBD for financial assistance to start up her business, because she feels that her family will be having financial problems in the future due to her children’s educational needs. This is why now she’s a member of the program, running a lawn mowing business. Her customers are mainly village people, and she’ll be looking at ways of getting more customers by having all the equipment needed for better service to offer to clients.

loans.use: Loan will be used to purchase knives, brooms and pay for her children’s semester fees.

loans.name: Soedjodo

texts.fr:
Mr. Soedjodo K. is a master carpenter in Gbadago, Togo. Born on Nov. 28, 1980 in Vogan, Togo, he is married and father of one child. After his primary schooling, he was not able to remain in school because of his parents' poverty, and this pushed him to pursue an apprenticeship. He has now been working in his trade for five years. An upstanding and creative man and good at managing his business, he would like to produce furniture of excellent quality for sale. For that reason, he is requesting a loan of US$ 1000 so that he can purchase wood, machines for his workshop (lathe, plane, table saw, etc.) which will allow him to increase his income and better support his family since his wife does not work outside the home and thus has no income to add to his.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Mr K. Soedjodo est un chef menuisier à Gbadago. Né le 28 Novembre 1980 à Vogan, il est marié et père d’un (01) enfant. Après ses études primaires il n’a pas pu continué les études faute de la pauvreté des parents, ce qui l’a poussé à aller en apprentissage. Ça fait déjà 5 ans qu’il exerce ce métier. Ayant une bonne moralité, un esprit de créativité et de gestion, il veut nourrir son atelier en fabricant des meubles de qualité. Pour cela il sollicite un crédit de 1000$ pour faire le stock de bois, acheter des machines de travail (rebobineur, épulcheur, scie), ce qui lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus et subvenir aux problèmes de foyer, sa femme étant une ménagère.

loans.use:
purchase of wood and machines for his carpentry work

Achat de bois et machines de travail

loans.name: Jihudi Group

texts.en: Featured in the photograph, from left to right, are Salome K., Heleni K., Juliana R. and Sultan Dibibi S.. Together, they make up the JIHUDI group, and all have been involved in the food sales business for the past five years, running groceries in Buguruni. Together, they are asking for a loan of $1,000: each of them will use $250 to boost their business.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es:
Doña Aurora, a young mother, has the strength which allows her, together with her dear husband, to provide satisfaction and well-being to their beloved family. They decided to start a small general store at home to increase the family’s standard of life but unfortunately ten months later her husband was robbed when transporting merchandise he had bought wholesale from a store to his home and now he has to stay in bed because of the injuries caused and the household suffers great pain and economic crisis. Due to the check-ups and continuous pain, doña Aurora has decided to provide for treatment in spite her economic difficulties and she now sells the products from her general store as a street vendor to increase earnings and provide well-being for her dear husband. Thus she has decided to increase the stock and sale to the population of her town. Let us help this industrious mother succeed so her beloved husband may recover.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

La fuerza es una fortaleza que tiene sin duda Aurora, joven madre de familia que siempre ha trabajo con su querido esposo para procurarle satisfacción y bienestar a su querida familia.Decidieron aperturar una pequeña bodega en casa a fin de incrementar la calidad de vida de su familia, lamentablemente a diez meses de haber consumado este deseo su esposo sufrió un asalto cuando trasladaba la mercadería que había comprado en una tienda al por mayor hacia su domicilio; este hecho trajo una enorme pena y crisis económica en su hogar debido a que los daños que le causaron estos inescrupulosos sujetos le causaron mucho daño y a consecuencia tiene que permanecer postrado en cama hasta su recuperación.Los exámenes y continuos dolores han hecho que Aurora decida someterlo a un tratamiento a pesar de la dificultad monetaria por la que atraviesan y ha decidido vender los productos de su bodega también de manera ambulante a fin de obtener mayores ganancias para procurarle bienestar a su querido esposo. Con este propósito en mente desea incrementar la cantidad de sus productos a fin de ofertarlos en mayor cantidad a la población en general de su ciudad.Posibilitemos su petición para que esta trabajadora madre logre recobrar la salud de su querido esposo.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to increase sales at a general store.

loans.name: Dasirah

texts.id:
Dasirah rents an area where she has opened a business selling food. She sells Nasi Goreng (Indonesian Fried Rice) and other items like cigarretes, snacks, bottled water and soft-drinks. With funding from this loan, she hopes to grow her business by adding more items to her menu and therefore increasing her customer base at the restaurant. Her store is open from 7A.M. to 10P.M.. At about 5A.M. she goes to the traditional market to shop for the ingredients she needs to cook with. From the increase in profits, she hopes to better her life for herself and her husband as well as to help pay the rent for the room where she runs her business.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Courtenay Teska Race, Kiva Volunteer.

Dengan menyewa sebuah warung Dasirah membuka usaha dengan menjual makanan lewat warung tersebut, yang dijualnya adalah nasi goreng dan kebutuhan lain seperti rokok, snack, dan minuman botol. Dengan mendapatkan modal dari DINARI Dasirah berharap bisa mengembangkan usahanya dengan menambah beberapa menu makanan sehingga dapat meningkatkan jumlah pelanggan yang makan di warungnya. Dasirah membuka warungnya dari jam 07.00 pagi sampai jam 10.00 malam, sekitar jam 05.00 pagi dia harus berbelanja kepasar tradisional untuk membeli bahan makanan yang nantinya akan di masak untuk makanan. Keuntungan yang didapatkan mampu memenuhi kehidupan dia bersama suaminya disamping harus membayar uang kontrak kamar dan warungnya.

loans.use: to purchase cooking ingredients

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en: Mohamed was a trader.  With the previous loans, he established himself in the market of Makeni and rented a space for the business. Mohamed also decided to sell only t-shirts, which he found have a huge market among the youth.  Like many other youth, who have less opportunity for education, S. dropped out of school due to lack of tuition fees.  Mohamed wishes to expand his business and is requesting for a loan of $700.

loans.use: Mohamed has decided to specialize in selling t-shirts that are popular amongst the youth, and needs capital to purchase the latest fashions and meet his customers' demands.

loans.name: Ricardina

texts.es:
Ricardina is a very affectionate and loving mother and despite her advanced age she is still eager to improve her beloved family’s quality of life. Since her husband’s death, Ricardina has been both a mother and a father to her children. She has worked tirelessly to ensure they do not suffer financially. Now that the children are older and independent she feels very proud, happy, and fulfilled as a mother.

With persistence and single-mindedness, Ricardina has succeeded in building a small house in one of the new housing estates in the city of Juliaca, within which she has also adapted an area to open her own small grocery store. Ricardina wishes to complete the fitting of her her small shop and to increase its stock.

She believes that this investment will help her achieve higher income from her small shop and proviD. her with better security and peace of mind.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

Ricardina es una madre muy cariñosa y amorosa, pese a su avanzada edad sigue deseosa D. mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su amada familia; desD. que su esposo falleció ha desempeñado las funciones D. padre y madre para sus hijos, trabajando incansablemente para que no pasen limitaciones económicas, ahora que ya son independientes se siente muy orgullosa, feliz y realizada como madre.Actualmente con mucho empeño y firmeza logró construir su casita en una D. las urbanizaciones nuevas D. la ciudad D. Juliaca, lugar donD. también adecuó un espacio para abrir su bodeguita. El deseo D. Ricardina es terminar D. implementar y aumentar el stock D. su tiendita, considera que haciendo esta inversión logrará obtener mayores ingresos económicos y se sentirá mucho más tranquila y segura.

loans.use: Capital injection to increase the number of items for sale in her new and small grocery store

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent T. sells building materials. She is married and has three children. Her husband’s income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family. She wants to increase her income, but she is running out of stock.

Millicent is asking for $325 additional capital to buy more goods for sale.

loans.use: As additional capital to buy more building materials for sale.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen M. is a man with a big heart of gold. His group, Kewerimidde women’s group, meets in one of the rooms at his home for free, a case that is rare to find among all groups countrywide. Probably this is one of the reasons why God has continuously blessed him. He is a fisherman with 37 boats, plus a container boat for collection and transportation of fish from the various boats on the waters around Katosi, on Lake Victoria. The fishermen on boats work for him, and the payments are agreed upon by the parties involved depending on their catch. In addition to the fishing business, he is a farmer growing food both for sale and home consumption, and this has eased his home expenses. He also has various other businesses, including shops in Katosi. He is one of the founding members of his group, and although he has all this, he needs the support of the loans for his current businesses and more business ventures. He is married with children.

loans.use: To improve his businesses of fishing, retail and farming

loans.name: Wan Word Movement Group

texts.en:
The members of this group are all local entrepreneurs based in Makeni City, the Northern Provincial Headquarter. The members of the group are Aminata K., M`Balu T., and Hawanatu K.. They are requesting a loan of Le 3,000,000.00 to help them boost their businesses. The leader of the group, Amimata, sells plastic containers (or "rubbers" as they are locally called here), M`Balu sells clothes, and Hawanatu sells palm-oil.

They named their group, Wan Word Movement. This is Krio, meaning One Word Movement, that is, they are ready to agree with each other.

The group leader, Amimata, is 39, she has two children, and a husband who is currently working in the mines.

loans.use: To buy more goods for the business.

loans.name: Aisha's Msimamo Group

texts.en:
Aisha is a single woman with 2 children who are 10 and 6 years old. She began selling clothes in 2007. Every day, she works extremely hard from 8 am to 6 pm at her business and, in doing so, she can earn a monthly profit of approximately $125 from her sales.

Aisha now requests a loan in order to buy more clothes for her business. Notably, she will share the loan proceeds with her subgroup members, Agatha and Subira, who have their own businesses selling food.

loans.use: To improve and expand her business by purchasing additional clothes.

loans.name: Maïmouna

texts.fr: Maïmouna S. est âgée de 23 ans et mariée. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer son petit commerce qui consiste à acheter de la graine d'arachide, à la transformer en pate pour la revendre. cette activité lui permettra de subvenir à ses besoins et de contribuer aux dépenses quotidiennes de la famille. <b>Elle va rembourser ce prêt en une seule échéance au bout de six mois<b/>.
texts.en:
Maïmouna S., 23, is married. She is requesting this loan to bolster her little business buying peanuts and transforming them into peanut butter. This activity will permit her to support herself and contribute to the daily expenses of the family. She is going to reimburse this loan in one single repayment at the end of 6 months.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of peanut butter

loans.name: María Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Inició su pequeño negocio vendiendo ropa interior de damas y caballeros en un canasto hace cuatro años, aprovecha la oportunidad de tener un primer crédito con ADIM invirtiendo el financiamiento para comprar ropa para adultos y caballeros de mejor calidad incluyendo variedad de chinelas, actualmente cuenta con tres canastos y exposición de ropa.  

Atiende el negocio ella sola trabajando todos los días, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, tiene dos hijos pequeños de 4 y 6 años, los que se los cuidan en su casa. Ella sueña con mejorar el lugar de venta y ofrecer zapatos variados para la clientela que se los solicita.
texts.en:
She started her small business selling women’s and men’s underwear in a four years ago. She took advantage of having the first credit with ADIM, investing the financing to buy clothing for adults and gentlemen of the best quality including a variety of flip-flops. She currently has three carts and a clothing display. She runs the business by working there herself every day and with her husband’s help. She has two small children who are 4 and 6 years old who are taken care of in her house. She dreams of improving her sales location and offering varied shoes for her clientele that asks for them.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose M. sells clothing for both ladies and gentlemen at Kotokoraba in Cape Coast. Rose has received a primary education. She is married and has 5 dependents. Her husband is on pension. Rose has been selling clothing since 1993. She is responsible for supporting her husband, paying for utility bills, and paying for other expenses of the family. Her loan will be used to increase her capital to buy more clothing for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her capital base to increase her income to enable her to meet the basic needs of her family.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to increase her capital to buy more clothing for sale.

loans.name: Rahmatullo

texts.ru: Имомов Рахматулло житель города КУрган-тюбе. Женат и имеет троих детей. Уже шесть лет занимается торговлей . Торгует канцелярскими товарами на центральном рынке. Его торговая точка находится на проходной рынка. Торговля не плохая , приносит хорошие доходы. Кроме того , цена на предлагаемую продукцию не большие  поэтому у него много клиентов. Сейчас хочет еще увеличить товарооборот , путем получения кредита. Погасить кредит сможет 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Rahmatullo I. lives in Qurgan-Tube. He is married and has 3 children. He has worked in sales for 6 years now. Rahmatullo sells office supplies at the central market. His sales location is on a main path in the market. Sales are not bad and bring good profits. In addition, his prices are not high and as a result he has a lot of customers. Rahmatullo would like to increase his inventory by taking out a loan. He plans to pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Keo S., 33, is married and lives with her husband and three children in the Kampong Cham province. She works in a grocery store, making around US$3 each day. Her husband works as a teacher and makes about US$1.50 each day. Food prices have soared in the past year as inflation has gotten out of control in Cambodia. Unfavorable climate conditions have also contributed to making the price of rice very high. Keo S. is asking for a loan of US$800 to add items to her grocery’s inventory. She is confident that this will be a good business venture and sees it as a tool to increase her income and raise her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To add items to her grocery’s inventory.

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Norah M. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with two children between the ages of 2 and 4 years old. Norah has been running a beauty salon business since 2006. This is the place where you can buy long hair, short hair, curly hair, straight hair, red hair, blue hair, and then have it attached to your head, woven, cut, or braided, and made to look like your own. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Norah currently earns about 200 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 600 USD in order to purchase hair products and a dryer. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Norah thanks you for her support.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase hair products and hair dryer.

loans.name: Esa Khan

texts.en: Esa Khan is the son of G. F.. He lives in district 16, Kabul, Afghanistan, and he lives in a big family with six members. He wants to repair his house to be able to live comfortably. He has requested an individual loan of 50,000 Afghani for a term of 12 months. He is happy that through this process one can solve his/her problems.

loans.use: Buying construction materials to repair his house

loans.name: Sharifgul

texts.ru: Раджабова Шарифгуль проживает в городе Вахдат. Замужем и имеет восьмерых детей. Домохозяйка . Хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы купить дойную корову с теленком. Это необходимо для того, чтобы обеспечить свою семью  молоком и молочными продуктами. Если она сможет получать много молока , лишнее она сможет продавать соседям и таким  образом она будет получать прибыль. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 8 месяцев.
texts.en:
Sharifgul R. lives in Vakhdat. She is married with eight children. She is a homemaker. She is applying for a loan in order to be able to buy a dairy cow with a calf. This would allow her to provide her family with milk and other dairy products. If the cow gives enough milk, Sharifgul will be able to make extra cash by selling milk to her neighbors. Sharifgul would be able to pay off the loan within 8 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: El Porvenir Group

texts.es: El banco comunal "El Porvenir"  esta  representados por la señora Juana  y conformado  por 5 varones que se dedican al transporte y a la agricultura  y 14   señoras en su mayoría  se dedican  a la venta de horneados, comidas, ropa y refrigerios.  Este es su 1er ciclo en nuestra institución pero demuestran gran entusiasmo y ganas de trabajar para salir adelante. La competencia no les preocupa ya que la buena calidad de sus productos tiene su mercado asegurado en especial con la modalidad de trabajo que tienen. El crédito esta destinado a la compra de insumos y herramientas para mejor su servicio y también la calidad y cantidad de sus productos para incrementar sus ventas y por ende sus ingresos. La experiencia de los miembros del grupo en créditos solidarios hace ver que tienen experiencia en el manejo y administración de fondos así  como en su responsabilidad con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
The communal bank "El Porvenir" is represented by Juana, and consists of five men who work in transport and agriculture and 14 women, the majority of whom sell baked goods, food, clothing and snacks. This is their first loan cycle in this institution, but they demonstrate a great deal of enthusiasm and the drive to work to succeed. Competition does not worry them since the high quality of their products secures their market, especially with their work ethic. The loan will be used to purchase inputs and tools to improve their service as well as the quantity and quality of their products, in order to increase their sales and thus their incomes. The members' experience in credit solidarity groups shows in their ability to manage and administer funds as well as in their responsibility toward their obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational capital

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
Judith es socia del Banco Comunal Manantial.
Judith es casada, tiene 28 años y 2 hijos, Judith se dedica a la agricultura de verduras, que luego comercializa en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad, además Judith tiene una tienda en su casa.
Judith necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar y leche.
Los sueños de Judith son aumentar su negocio y que sus hijos tengan una buena educación.
texts.en:
Judith is a member of the Manantial Communal Bank. She is 28 years old, married and has two children. Judith works growing vegetables which she later sells at market in the city and she also has a shop in her house. Judith needs a loan of $500 to buy rice, sugar, and milk. Judith's dreams are to grow her business and for her children to get a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Ian Nicoll, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, and milk.

loans.name: Cotoca Group

texts.es: El grupo “Cotoca” esta representado por la señora Cecilia e integrado por doce personas D. las, dos D. las cuales son hombres y diez mujeres,  todos ellos se dedican a diferentes actividades comerciales para generar ingresos como la venta D. abarrotes, empanadas en instituciones educativas, ropa y entre los varones se dedican a la contracción D. viviendas y a la plomería. Como en todo ámbito comercial siempre existe la competencia D. productos en el mercado pero cada uno D. los miembros sabe como vencer los obstáculos. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra materiales e insumos para mejorar sus productos y para la mejora D. herramientas D. trabajo para brindarles un mejor ingreso económico y para poder darles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. Una mayoría D. los miembros del grupo obtienen por primera vez un préstamo bajo esta modalidad pero son gente responsable que conoce D. sus obligaciones ya que D. ello depenD. el progreso D. sus familias.
texts.en:
Ms. Cecilia represents the group “Cotoca." The group has 12 members, 2 of whom are men, and 10 of whom are women. They each have different ways of earning a living like selling groceries, selling empanadas in educational institutions, and selling clothing. The men make a living in home construction and plumbing. As with all commercial areas, there is always competition among products in the markets, but each member knows how to overcome this obstacle. The loans will be used to buy materials and supplies to improve their products and work tools so they can increase their incomes and give their families a better quality of life. For most of the members of this group, this is the first time they have applied for a loan in this way, but they are responsible people who know what their obligations are since their family’s progress depends on it.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital de Operaciones

loans.name: Mahran Nazir Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Mahran baji is the wife of N. A. who has been living in Vehari, Pakistan for the last 11 years. Her husband is a loader by profession. He loads different items (e.g. construction supplies, fruits & vegetables) on carts and delivers them to the specified places. She is the mother of three kids: two daughters and one son. All of her kids are getting an education from a school located near to the house. Mahran baji is a very determined lady. She knows that her husband’s income is small but she never realized him about it. She supports him financially by selling thread. She is applying for a loan to buy a new donkey cart because the old cart is rough and rotted.

She is the group leader of four other women from her locality. Zarina baji wants a loan to buy another juicer machine for her juice corner. Shamim akhtar baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading. Naziran baji wants a loan to buy material (chairs, mirrors and scissors) for her salon. Kosar baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits to sell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a new donkey cart

loans.name: Johanna

texts.es: La Señora Johanna O. a sus 35 años de edad, casada, habitante del barrio Waspan Norte en la capital de Managua, su esposo le ayuda económicamente ya que se desempeña como ferretero su tramo situado en unos de los mercado de Managua, tiene dos hijos. Seguir mejorando su vivienda es una de su misión. Doña Johanna mujer emprendedora tiene su propio negocio es una pulpería y también alquiler de cuarto, desde hace dos años y medio de experiencia en atención al cliente. Iniciándolo con fondos de financiamientos y creciendo con el apoyo y la confianza de la micro financieras. Gracia a los préstamos que solicita en Afodenic lograra comprar materiales de construcción para cambiar el techo de su casa que esta en mal estado para la cual requiere comprar zinc, reglones y clavos de acero. Ofreciéndole a su familia seguridad y protección y una vivienda digna.

loans.use: Comprar materiales de construccion para reparar el techo

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es: Vicenta tiene ya sus 50 años de edad, actualmente es separada de su marido desde hace muchos años, tiene varios hijos pero solo 3 dependen de ella. Vive en casa de sus padres. El negocio que tiene Vicenta es el de venta de comida en su domicilio, también tiene 2 equipos de amplificación los cuales prestan sus servicios de amenización de fiestas y también alquila sillas y mesas esto en colaboración de sus hijos. Lleva muchos años en la preparación y  venta de comida. En la zona no tiene competencia para esta actividad ya que sus precios son económicos y sus clientes son principalmente taxistas y vecinos de la zona. El crédito fue destinado para el pago de un dinero a terceras personas ya que su hijo tuvo un accidente en su auto y tuvieron muchos gastos. Vicenta es una buena cliente de agrocapital quien cancela sus cuotas con mucha puntualidad y responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Vicenta is now 50 years old. She has been separated from her husband for many years and has several children, but only three are dependents. They live in her parent’s house. Vicenta sells food from her home to make a living. She also has speakers she rents out for parties along with chairs and tables. Her children help her with this. She has been cooking and selling food for many years and does not have any competition in her area since her prices are low and most of her clients are taxi drivers and people from the neighborhood. The loan is to pay off people since her son had a car accident which incurred many expenses. Vicenta is a good agro-capital client who makes her payments on time. She is a responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: PAGO DE PASIVO A TERCEROS

loans.name: Rosa Nery

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Nery, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 38 años, 08 hijos, 06 de ellos que aun dependen de ella.

Su carácter y su anhelo de cumplir sus sueños, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes con cuyas ganancias aportaría al ingreso económico en su hogar, desde su  inicio a la fecha ha ido ganando clientes. Hoy en día cuenta con clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su bodega a comprar porque en ella  tiene todo los productos  que el ama de casa necesita y es quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos; galletas, fideos y sales en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Rosita, como le dicen de cariño, se siente muy tranquila para continuar con su trabajo y se siente muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela R. por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa Nery belongs to the "Banco Comunal "Mujeres Emprendedoras", District of Moyobamba, Province Moyobamba, Department of San Martín. She is married, 38 years old, has 8 children of whom 6 still are dependent on her.

Her personality and her wish to make her dreams come true, motivated her to start her own business selling groceries in order to support the family income. From the beginning up to now the clients have increased. Today she can count on stable clients who visit her store daily to make their purchases as it has all the products a housewife needs and she personally assists with charisma.

With this loan of S/.2,000.00 she will buy sacks of rice and sugar, cookies, pasta, and packs of salt, milk and boxes of variety of canned fish, as well as "javas" of eggs and personal hygiene items, all of this to offer better service to her clients.

Rosita, as her loving nickname is, feels calm to continue her work and she is grateful to Movimiento Manuela R. for supporting women like her to have opportunities to improve within their environment.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in buying groceries to increase products.

loans.name: La Vecindad Del Cinco Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL 
LA VECINDAD DEL CINCO


Hace 4 años se formo la Alcancía Comunal La Vecindad del Cinco todas viven en el AAHH Cinco D. Noviembre y tienen diferentes negocios que les permiten brindar lo necesario para sus pequeños hijos. La Sra Ermanda A. es la mayor D. su grupo  y  presidenta D. la alcancía, es una mujer muy activa y emprendedora que se dedica a la venta D. tubérculos, viaja constantemente para traer mejores productos a Lima.
La Sra. Ermanda es pieza fundamental en su ALCOM, inspira respeto y seguridad.

Las socias tienen diferentes tipos D. negocio, tales como: vidriería, costura, venta D. comida, pequeñas  bodegas y la venta D. tubérculos. La mayoría son madres solteras y tienen mucho entusiasmo para salir adelante. Ellas saben que tienen mucha competencia y es por eso que renuevan constantemente su stock D. productos.

Ellas están contentas con los préstamos, pero desean aumentar sus ventas comprando insumos y productos que les permita obtener mas ganancias. .
texts.en:
La Vecindad del Cinco Community Bank La Vecindad del Cinco Community Bank was formed four years ago. All of them live in the AAHH Cinco D. Noviembre. They have different businesses, which allow them to proviD. the necessities to their small children. Ermanda A. is the oldest, and she is president of the group. She is a very active and enterprising woman. She sells tubers. She is constantly traveling so that she can bring better products to Lima. Ermanda plays a fundamental role in her ALCOM. She inspires respect and confidence. The members have different types of businesses like a glass shop, sewing, food sales, small mini markets, and tuber sales. Most of them are single mothers, and they are very enthusiastic about getting ahead. They know that they have a lot of competition. That is why they are constantly restocking their products. They are happy with the loans, but they want to increase their sales by buying supplies and products that will allow them to get more earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products

loans.name: Leonora Alface

texts.pt:
Leonora Alface M. de 33 anos de idade natural da cidade de Matola, casada, e mãe de 3 filhas com idades compreendidas entre 6 e 16 anos que se encontram a estudarem nas escolas oficiais de Boane. Leonor estudou ate 4 classe tendo parado por dificuldades de varia ordem.
Vivem com seu marido, filhos e sua mãe que está sob sua responsabilidade.

Saiu de maputo para swazilandia (pais vizinho de Moçambique) em 2003, foi lá onde começou a fazer negocio de venda de roupa diversa. Regressou ao paìs com seu marido e continua a fazer o mesmo negocio.
 
Tem uma empregada que lhe ajuda no negocio. Vende roupa diversa, sapatos e cobertores obtendo um rendimento mensal de 6.000,00MT com qual consegue sustentar a família e ate poupar um pouco para mementos de crise.

Nunca teve empréstimo com outros bancos, desde que regressou da swazilandia, conheceu a Hluvuku-Adsema através de vizinhos e tendo aproximado e obteve o primeiro empréstimo de 20.000,00MT que destinava se ao reforço do stock.

Com o presente credito de, também, 20.000,00MT pretende adquirir mais mercadoria (comprar mais cobertores, roupa diversa e sapatos) para vender no mercado local de boane.

Propõe se a pagar o credito sem problemas para poder aceder a mais empréstimos com o intuito de expandir o negocio e melhorar as condições sociais da família.
texts.en:
Leonora Alface M. is 33 years old and from the city of Matola. She is married and has 3 daughters between the ages of 6 and 16 who are all studying in the official schools of Boane. Leonora attended school until the 4th grade but left school due to various difficulties. She lives with her husband, children and her mother, whom she supports. Leonora left Maputo for Swaziland (a neighboring country of Mozambique) in 2003. There, she began a business selling clothing. She returned to Mozambique with her husband and continued her business. She has an employee who helps her with the business. Leonora sells a variety of clothing, shoes, and blankets, with monthly earnings of 6.000,00 MT that she uses to support her family and even save a bit for emergencies. She has never had a loan with other banks. When she returned from Swaziland, she learned about Hluvuku-Adsema through neighbors and came to the bank for her first loan of 20.000,00 MT which she used to increase her inventory. With the current loan also 20.000,00 MT, she plans to purchase more merchandise (blankets, clothing, and shoes) to sell in the local market in Boane. She plans to pay off the loan without any problems in order to be able to request future loans with the goal of expanding her business and improving her family's social condition.

Translated from Portuguese by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and sell clothing

loans.name: Eliud

texts.en:
Eliud is a 49 year old father of six and grandfather to one. He lives and operates his matumbo meat (cow’s intestines) business in Mukuru slums of Nairobi. He has requested for a first loan of Ksh. 20,000 to enable him start a second-hand shoe business. He hopes to educate his children and develop rental houses. He describes himself as social, friendly and determined.

Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing access to financial opportunities. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Start another business

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is twenty-six years old. She is single and has one child who is in school. She lives with her child in a rented apartment in Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming community in the region.

Margaret is a trader, trading in textile materials. She hawks (goes door-to-door) to sell in her community and treks to other communities to sell. Margaret has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy textile materials in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy textiles in bulk

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn M. is from the village of Sepac. She is 20 years old. Merlyn is married and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, Merlyn owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating as a reloader. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from being a load retailer in the local community. Merlyn has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Merlyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP to invest in expanding the business as a load retailer. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Merlyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Molovemai Group

texts.en:
Molovemai is a group of three borrowers led by John D. K.. John is 51 years old and married with ten children between the ages of 4 and 29 years old. His children's education levels are from first grade to university senior. He also cares for 17 orphans. John is a high school graduate and a vocational school graduate. He and his family lives on the Lawazu Road the capital of Lofa county, northern Liberia.

John's business is general store.He buys items wholesale and sells to residents of Lawazu Road, Voinjama, the capital of Lofa county, northern Liberia. He has been running this business for two years and hopes to expand to a bigger store. 

John has been facing some financial problems with his business, but because he talks to his customers in a good manner and cleans his shop in order to encourage them to continue buying from him, he believes his business will get better. He needs this loan in order to purchase goods such as milk, batteries, candles, body cream, sugar, etc., to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase goods for resale

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en: Mrs. Liezel G. is from the town of Mabini, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years old, married, and is blessed with four school-aged children. Liezel owns and operates a business selling a variety of food products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for more than five years, earning PHP 3,000 monthly from her business. In 2004, Liezel joined PMPC to access its programs and services. Currently, she's obtaining her 13th loan in the amount of PHP 5,000 which will be used for house repair. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use for house repair

loans.name: Bahri

texts.en:
G. Bahri is a 43-year-old loving mother of two children. Her husband is an electrician. For more than nine years Bahri has been selling fish in the city's central fish market. When she started out she turned over only a small amount of money. With time her business has expanded, and today it is quite a stable business. Bahri is requesting 5000 TJS to purchase fish at wholesale prices in order to have stock for selling during the winter. Bahri has previously received loans from Kiva partner IMON International, and has shown herself to be a reliable client. She would to thank everyone for their support.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase fish wholesale

loans.name: Rita Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Rita Isabel, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres con Éxito II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 30 años y es madre de 01 hijo, que aun depende de ella.

Rita Isabel, es una mujer perseverante y capaz. Se dedica a la venta de ropas usadas, en un lugar muy bien acondicionado, ubicada en su misma casa y nos cuenta que le esta yendo muy bien, cuenta con clientes que ya la conocen y saben de su negocio. También se traslada por los diferentes lugares de las zonas, a ofrecer su mercadería.
La fortaleza y la perseverancia que le caracteriza, le ayudo a crecer como mujer independiente y esta muy orgullosa con lo logrado.

Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00, comprará  más mercadería de ropas para surtir su stock como: pantalones, shorts, blusas en todas las tallas y modelos, polos y vestidos para adultos y niñas. 

Se siente una mujer establecida y trabajadora y agradece la oportunidad que el Movimiento Manuela Ramos  la ha ofrecido, para así desarrollarse como mujer y pequeña empresaria.
texts.en:
Rita Isabel is a member of the Mujeres con Éxito II Communal Bank in the Tarapoto district of the San Martin province and department. She is a 30-year-old woman with a live-in partner and one dependent child.

Rita Isabel is a persevering and able woman. She sells used clothing in a well-equipped area of her house. She states that her business is prospering as she has customers who know her business well. She also travels throughout the different zones to sell her merchandise.

Her strength and determination have helped her grow as an independent woman, and she is very proud of what she has accomplished.

With this 500.00 PEN loan, she will purchase more used apparel like: pants, shorts, shirts (all sizes and types), T-shirts, and dresses for women and girls.

She feels like a hardworking woman and is grateful for the opportunity that the Manuela Ramos Movement has offered her so that she can develop as a female small business owner.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is fifty years old. He is married with two children who are in school. He sells used clothes and has many customers.  However, with limited capital he can not provide much variety.  He wants a loan to buy more bales of used clothes and increase his selection to meet the desires of his customers and expand his income for his family.

loans.use: To purchase bales of used clothes

loans.name: Bicentenario Group

texts.es:
El Banco comunal Bicentenario está formado por 10 clientes, pertenecen a la Zona de San Antonio, Villa Copacabana, las socias se dedican a la venta de perfumes alimentos precocidos,  reposteria, venta de juguetes, Cosméticos Durante su permanencia en Emprender, que son 2 ciclos se reestructuro en un 10% de las socias, manteniéndose conformada por todas las socias fundadoras del banco.

La Señora Rosmery Es fundadora del banco, este es su 2do ciclo y asume el cargo de presidenta y lider del banco, en el anterior ciclo la Sra. Demostró responsabilidad  a la hora de asistir a las reuniones y pagar su cuota, se dedica a la venta de tejidos a mano, a la resposteria. En el banco comunal ha aprendido a ser una líder responsable con sus compañeras, exigente con sus compañeras a la hora de pago, amigable, alegre. con el préstamo que se le ha otorgado podra incrementar su capital.

La Señora Paulina es la Tesorera del Banco es una de las fundadoras que dio origen a la conformación del banco Bicentenario se dedica a la venta de alimentos precocidos, y la venta de condimentos en feria, no contaba con capital para comprar mercadería, sin embargo ahora con el préstamo que se le dará  ella podrá comprar  mercadería para aumentar su capital, además que la Sra. también se dedica a la venta de pinturas de manera ambulante.

La Señora Norka Antonia es bastante dinámica, alegre, es la secretaria del Banco, es su primer ciclo durante su capacitacion demostró responsabiliadad y actualmente se dedica a la venta de productos omnilife (suplementos alimenticios naturales), el crédito solicitado, lo requiere para la compra de mercadería y aumento de capital.
Como también la Sra. se dedica al mantenimiento y reparación de celulares con lo que la Sra. Norka asume la manutención de sus dos hijos de manera independiente y sola.
texts.en:
