The Bicentenario Community Bank is formed by 10 members of the San Antonio district, Villa Copacabana. The members sell perfumes, precooked meals, pastries, toys and cosmetics. During its two cycles in Emprender there was reestructuring and change in 10% of the members. All the founding members were maintained.

Rosmery is a founding member. This is her second cycle. She is the President and leader of the bank. During the previous cycle she has shown responsibility in taking part in meetings and paying for her quota. She sells handmade cloths and pastries. In the community bank she has learned to be a responsible leader towards her colleagues, assertive when it comes to payments but friendly and joyful. With the loan she will be able to increase her working capital.

Paulina is the bank's Treasurer. She is one of the founding members of the Bicentenario bank. She sells precooked meals and spices in street markets. She didn't have capital to buy inventory but with the loan she will be able to buy inventory to increase her working capital. She also sells painting as a street vendor.

Norka Antonia is very dynamic, joyful and is the Secretary of the bank. In her first cycle she showed responsibility. She is currently selling Omnilife products (natural health supplements). The requested loan is for the purchase of inventory and increase of working capital. She also works with and repairs cellphones. This is how she is the sole provider for her two children.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of working capital

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Mrs. Rosita N. is 52 years of age, married, and a resident of Dimalco, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. Rosita and her husband, a farmer and laborer, supported one another to set up their little sari-sari (general) store. The couple is blessed with six children, three of whom are already married, two of whom are at school, and the other of whom is still an infant.
Rosita joined Kiva partner PMPC to avail herself of its credit services. She has applied for her first loan of 3,000 PHP to add to her capital for running her sari-sari store business. The future income from this business will be used for basic daily needs and loan repayments. Rosita is hoping that her business will make good progress and that she will be able to send all her children to school.

loans.use: As additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Mbaïta

texts.fr: Mbaïta K., 55 ans, mariée et mère d'un enfant est membre du Banc Villageois de SINATHIABA NORD depuis 2 ans et a eu à bénéficier de 4 prêts qu'elle bien gérés et remboursés régulièrement. Elle fait un petit commerce de bijoux et son objectif est de renforcer son épargne et de participer à la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Mbaïta K., 55, is married and the mother of one child. She has been a member of the “Banc Villageois” of SINATHIABA NORD for two years, and has received four loans which she managed well and paid back regularly. She has a small business selling jewelry, and her goal is to build up her savings and participate in supporting her family.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build her small sales business

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.en:
Juan Carlos is 44 years old and lives in a densely populated neighborhood in the city of Itá with his wife, Lorenza. The couple has a school-age son together.

Juan Carlos owns a woodworking shop in which he makes all types of furniture, including closets, tables, chairs, drawers, and other items that he sells. He has been a carpenter for fifteen years, and has worked exclusively with Fundación Paraguaya.

Juan Carlos is seeking the loan to purchase wood to make some furniture that has been requested.

loans.use: To purchase wood for his business

loans.name: Claire

texts.en:
Claire V. is from the village of Poblacion 2 Oroquieta City Misamis Occidental. She is 19 years old and is single. To make a living, Claire owns and operates a business in the services sector.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating an e-loader "SMART" business. Claire has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Claire joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Claire is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP which will be used to invest in renovating the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Claire from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her tuition fees.  

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Business renovation

loans.name: Ade

texts.en:
Ade sells foodstuffs like pepper, rice, beans, melons and tomato paste at retail prices to her customers. She hopes for expansion in her business. She has a good relationship with LAPO.

Ade is requesting for a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She is married with 4 children. Her husband is a building contractor and he also supports the home. She is grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Bun Chhoeun's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Bun Chhoeun H. is 25 years old and is the village bank president of his group, which consists of nineteen members, located in Sdao Kanleng village in Kandal province. Each member of this village loan will use their share to purchase equipment, supplies and other items to support their different purposes. 

Mr. Bun Chhoeun H. is a grocery seller who owns a general store. With this business he can earn a small income by selling his goods to support his family. Since this business is going well, he wants to expand it, thus he decided to ask for a loan to buy more groceries to enlarge his business. Aside from grocery selling, he is alS. a construction worker.  His wife, Mrs. Sarom Chann, is a farming laborer and alS. supports her husband's grocery selling. This couple does not have any children.

loans.use: to buy more groceries

loans.name: Antonio Pedro Jose

texts.pt:
António Pedro José Marrengule nasceu no Distrito de Maxixe, Província de Inhambane, sul de Moçambique tem 57 anos de idade, viúvo e pai de 1 filho de 26 anos e uma neta de 7 anos de idade, a neta vai a escola. Fez somente 6a classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém para além da sua neta. 
Sai de Maxixe para Maputo em missão de serviço. Trabalha como enfermeiro e é quadro do Ministério da Saúde ha mais de 30 anos, não possui nenhum empregado e tem um salário de 3.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum de vez enquanto na sua conta bancária. 
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigos que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é seu 2° empréstimo no valor de 12.000.00mt com qual pretende comprar material de construção (chapas, barrotes, cimento, pedra e outros) para concluir a construção da sua residência. O empréstimo anterior foi no valor de 10.000.00mt, para a mesma actividade.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para mobilar a casa e comprar uma motorizada, para facilitar as suas saídas de casa para o serviço.
texts.en:
António Pedro José Marrengule was born in the Maxixe district in the Inhambane province in the south of Mozambique. He is 57 years old, is a widower, and the father of one child who is 26 years old and a 7 year-old granddaughter who goes to school. He completed through 6th grade himself but stopped due to lack of funds. He lives in his own home with is family and he doesn't support anyone else besides his granddaughter. He left Maxixe for Maputo when he was transferred. He has worked as a nurse for the Ministry of Health for more than 30 years. He does not have any employees and he makes a monthly salary of 3,000MT, which he uses to pay for his household expenses and occasionally saves some to his bank account. He has never taken out a loan with another bank. He came to know Hluvuku through friends who were also clients of the institution. This is his 2nd loan for the amount of 12,000MT, with which he plans to purchase construction materials (plates, beams, cement, stone, etc.) to finish construction on his home. The previous loan was for 10,000MT and was used for the same purpose. He promises to make his repayments dutifully so that he can access future loans. In the future, he'd like to take out more loans to furnish his home and purchase a motor vehicle to facilitate his trips from home to work.

Translated from Portuguese by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (plates, beams, cement, stone, etc.)

loans.name: Good Samaritan #2 Group

texts.en:
Kumba F. has been selling building materials like zinc, shovels, hacksaws, nails and wheelbarrows at the Red Light market in Paynesville, outside of Monrovia, Liberia, for six years. She started her business with a loan from LEAP. She is 38 years old, widowed and has three children who range in age from 12 to 20 years old. She was not privileged to attend school due to financial difficulties. 

Kumba, who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called "Good Samaritan #2". She plans to use her 14,000 Liberian dollar (LRD) portion of this 56,000 LRD group loan to buy more zinc, shovels, hacksaws, nails and wheelbarrows. Her hope is to grow her business and to continue to support her children so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: To buy more zinc, shovels, hacksaws, nails and wheelbarrows

loans.name: Serah

texts.en: Serah E. moves from one house to another with her cosmetics for sale at Takoradi.  Serah has received junior high education.  She is married and has five dependents. Serah has been selling cosmetics for some time now. She helps her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more cosmetics to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to acquire a plot of land.

loans.use: buy more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Gloria Vilma

texts.es: Gloria Vilma Cuá T. cuenta con 20  años de edad,  Casada, con un hijo, actualmente se dedica a la artesanía “Elaboración de cortes típicos” ya que también aparte de que elabora cortes, también elabora servilletas Típicas , se acerco a la Asociación ASDIR  por un préstamo,  debido a la falta de capital de su negocio, ya que no cuenta con el efectivo necesario para cubrir la demanda, ya que solo ella no puede cubrir la demanda de sus clientes en su actividad por las misma razón necesita de más capital  para  su negocio, como también poder seguir mejorando sus fuentes de ingresos y poder darle a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Gloria Vilma Cuá T. is 20 years old and married with one son. Currently, she works as an artisan making traditional fabric. The fabrics she makes are very distinctive. She also makes traditional table napkins. She approached Asociación ASDIR for a loan due to her business’ lack of capital. She doesn’t have the cash necessary to meet the demand for her products and, as a result, cannot meet her customers’ requests. This is why she needs more capital for her business. She also wants to continue improving the source of her income in order to give her family a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en: Eduardo B. is from the village of Claveria, Misamis Oriental. He is 48 years old. Eduardo is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Eduardo runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products and also from buying and selling fruits and vegetables. Eduardo has been engaged in his business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Eduardo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eduardo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Eduardo is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This will be the second loan taken out by Eduardo from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Kanlé

texts.fr: cette dame fait elle même des biscuits de façon traditionnelle qu'elle vend en gros à des revendeurs et revendeuses; elle fait ce commerce de puis 10 ans déjà. ses biscuits sont faite à base de farine de blé et sont très appréciés. elle voudrait construire un autre four  pour pouvoir faire plus de biscuit et satisfaire tous ses clients raison pour laquelle elle sollicite du crédit de WAGES. ce prêt lui servira également à acheter la farine de blé.
texts.en:
This woman hand makes cookies in the traditional manor wholesale that she then sells to retailers. She has been doing this for 10yrs already. Her cookies are made from a wheat flour and are very well liked. She would like to build another oven to bake more cookies and meet the needs of all of her clients. It's for this reason that she is asking for a loan from WAGES. This loan will also allow her to purchase more wheat flour.

Translated from French by Colleen Creegan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wheat flour and the construction of an oven

loans.name: Victor Hugo

texts.es:
Víctor de 45 años, vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, rodeada de un estero salado) el tiene una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa. 

Cuando el era pequeño su papa vendía panes pero cuando el creció, decidió comenzar vendiendo arroz, bebidas y otros víveres para poder mantener a su hijo y esposa que le ayuda en el negocio. Trabaja desde las 06h45am hasta las 21h00pm. Vende bebidas, granes y otros vives. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar bebidas y cemento para mejorar su casa. En el futuro quiere tener mas grande y surtido su negocio.
texts.en:
Victor is 45 years old and lives on the Perimetral Highway in Guayaquil (a suburban zone surrounded by a salt marsh). He has a small store in the front part of his house. When Victor was young, his father sold bread, but when he grew up he decided to start selling rice, drinks and other basic grocery items in order to support his son and his wife, who helps out with the business. He works each day from 6:45am to 9:00pm selling drinks, grains and other groceries. With this loan, Victor wants to buy drinks and cement to fix up his home. In the future, he hopes to expand his business and offer a wider variety of items.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Staff

loans.use: To purchase cement, concrete blocks and bricks

loans.name: Aura Estela

texts.es: La Sra. Aura Estela C. Sánchez   ella  es Trabajadora activa  del colegio público “Instituto Nacional de San Rafael Del Sur”  desempeñándose como Maestra de Educación Secundaria, tiene  veinte y cuatro  años de trabajar para esta empresa, es casada actualmente. Ha tenido  doce créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha realizado para comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar su casa de habitación y este crédito lo está solicitando para la ampliación de su cocina,  los cuales le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Aura Estela C. Sánchez is a secondary school teacher at the public school “Instituto Nacional de San Rafael Del Sur.” She has worked at this school for 34 years. She is married. She has taken 12 loans with CEPRODEL, which she has used to buy construction materials to improve her home. With the loan she is requesting she will expand her kitchen. These loans have benefited her greatly, since in this way she has been able to improve the living conditions of herself and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy stone, sand, cement, etc.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
This is Norma E., 65, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. Widowed and left alone to support her college enrolled oldest child and her youngest who is in high school. Norma works hard. By the grace of God, she has managed to support her child's schooling up to college level. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send her youngest all the way through college.

Norma operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling at retail rates.  Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a Php10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Norma dreams of being able to renovate her house soon, with all of her work with the business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Simona Esperanza

texts.es:
La Sra. Simona Esperanza Munguía F.,  es comerciante activa   del mercado la terminal, inicia a exhibir su mercadería desde las 6 am posteriormente se desplaza a vender ambulante en los buses quedando en su puesto fijo su esposo y este crédito lo utilizo para incrementar su inventario de cosmético tales como: pinturas, vanidades, crema, shampoo, aretes, piraña, gorra, etc. Ella realizas sus compras una parte en Managua y otra a proveedores que le entregan en su puesto de venta.

Sra. Munguía F. está muy agradecida con ceprodel por que le ha ayudado a crecer su negocio con cosméticos y chinería ya que ella solo vendía pan
texts.en:
Mrs. Simona Esperanza Munguía F. is an active businesswoman in the market. She begins by displaying her merchandise at 6 am, and then she sells her products at bus stops. She and her husband will use this loan to increase their inventory of cosmetics such as makeup, vanities, cream, shampoo, earrings, caps, etc. She makes part of her purchases in Managua and the other part from suppliers that come to her stand.

Mrs. Munguía F. is very thankful for Ceprodel because they have helped her grow her cosmetics and China business since she used to only sell bread.

loans.use: To buy lipstick, nailpolish, shampoo, vanities, cream, earrings, etc.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose L. is currently in the business of baking and selling bread (mandazi) and is requesting a loan to stock more baking flour.  Rose is 30 years old and is married to a husband who is a policeman. She has four children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: Stock more baking flour

loans.name: Amelia Del Carmen

texts.es: La Sra. Amelia del Carmen C. V. es trabajadora Activa del colegio público “Monte limar” desempeñándose como Maestra de Educación Primaria tiene doce  años de trabajar para esta institución. Ha tenido  doce   créditos con CEPRODEL y cada  uno los ha  realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción para  ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación y este lo está solicitando para la compra de dos bovinos para el destace de res ya que se está dedicando al negocio del destace, de cuales  los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en: Amelia del Carmen C. V. works as an elementary school teacher at 'Monte limar' school.  She has been working there for twelve years.  She has had twelve loans with CEPRODEL and each one has been used to buy building materials for extending and improving her house.  This loan will be used to buy two cows for butchering since her business is butchering cows.  Her CEPRODEL loans have greatly benefited her since they have helped her improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy cows

loans.name: Sinore

texts.en:
Sinore S. is a 37-year-old woman. She sells traditional belts, shawls and jewelry at Enkaroni market in Bissil to individuals and other traders who take them to the busy Namanga Road near Tanzania and Nairobi. Her husband, S. N., aged 40 years, is a farmer. Together they have three children: Charles, 14 years old; Lemayon, 10 years old; and Sopiato, 4 years old. Sinore has been running her business for thirteen years; her monthly profit is Kshs 12,000.

Sinore was introduced to Kadet Ltd. by the credit officer in charge of the Kitengela Office. With the loan, she will use Kshs 10,000 to buy jewelry and beads and Kshs 10,000 to buy traditional shawls. If the loan boosts the business, Sinore plans to build a shop and stock it with jewelry and traditional shawls.

Sinore describes herself as hardworking and ambitious; she dreams that one day she will be able to transport jewelry to Nairobi city and open a stall at the Masai Market.

loans.use: To buy shawls, belts and beads for making jewelry.

loans.name: Rosaura Cristina

texts.es:
Rosaura Cristina M. T. tiene 31 años. Es casada, vive con el esposo y los hijos viven  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDOS SOMO MAS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Marañon, por la parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz fréjol. 

Rosaura se dedica de manera especial al cultivo de maíz, arroz y fréjol desde hace 5 años. Los productos lo comprar en Comercial López en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar terreno.

Le gusta hacer deporte
texts.en:
Rosaura Cristina M. T. is 31 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and children in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.  She has 2 children.

The 'Unidos Somos Más' (Together We Are More) community bank is located in Marañon district, in Puerto Pechiche parish, in Pueblo Viejo canton.  The members of this community bank work in short cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and beans.

Rosaura has been growing corn, rice and beans for 5 years. She is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for her crops.  The support of this loan would help her financially to cover her needs.  She faces challenges such as insect infestations, crop diseases and changes in the climate.  Her dream is to buy her own plot of land.  She likes taking part in sports.

loans.use: Farming supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is 31 years old, married and with two children.  He runs a retail shop so as to earn a living.  He is also employed as a driver.  He has been running the business for four years.  Through Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his money.  He hopes to become a prosperous businessman in the future.  He has requested 40,000 Kes to buy sugar, cooking fat, maize and wheat flour.

loans.use: To buy sugar, cooking fat, maize and wheat flour

loans.name: Acuario 2 Group

texts.es: La foto fue tomada en la ciudad de Orizaba, en casa de Leticia R. una integrante del grupo "Acuario 2". Se ven las 11 integrantes en la foto. La señora Leticia se dedica a la compra de tiempo aire para célulares que inició hace 5 años. Solicita el préstamo para la compra de tiempo aire y accesorios para teléfono. Sus ganancias aumentan ya que en esta temporada solicitan muchas recargas para célular.Al momento de solicitar este prestamo se siente satisfecha ya que con ello obtendrá más ganancias. Tiene 49 años, estudió hasta el bachillerato, es madre y tiene en total 3 hijos de los cuales los tres son varones. Quiere este crédito para comprar una vitrina para poder poner sus accesorios y exhibirlos.
texts.en: The photograph was taken in the city of Orizaba, at the home of Leticia R., one of the members of the Acuario 2 Group ("aquarium"). The 11 members are pictured. Señora Leticia has been buying and selling air time for cell phones for 5 years. She applies for this loan to buy air time and phone accessories. This season she has better earnings because many customers ask for recharge cards for their cell phones. When Leticia applied for this loan, she was satisfied because it will enable her to earn a higher income. She is 49, studied until high school and is the mother of three children, all boys. She wants this loan to buy a showcase to display her phone accessories.

loans.use: To buy air time, accessories and a showcase for cell phones.

loans.name: Goretti

texts.fr: Goretti N. est commerçante, et client d’ACB depuis 2009.  Elle a 36 ans, née à Rwanda, mariée, et elle a 2 enfants entre 3 ans et 4 ans.  Elle a une éducation primaire, et tous ses enfants vont à l’école.  Elle va utiliser son prêt pout l’achat de 20 sacs de pommes de terre, et payer pour le transport.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’épargner, et d’autofinancement.  Elle voudrait devenir grossiste, et construire une maison d’habitation pour la famille.
texts.en: Goretti N. is a merchant and a client of ACB since 2009. She is 36 years old, she was born in Rwanda, she is married, and she has 2 children between the ages of 3 and 4. She has a primary school education, and all of her children attend school. She will use her loan to purchase 20 sacks of potatoes and to pay for the transportation. Her strategy for making her business grow is to save money and form a capital fund. She would like to become a wholesaler and to build a home for her family.

loans.use: To purchase 20 sacks of potatoes.

loans.name: Julio César

texts.es:
En el Municipio de Granada, Departamento de Granada, muy arduamente el señor Julio César M. B. se dedica a la labor de Fontanero desde hace tres años en la empresa ENACAL-Granada, quien es soltero, con un único dependiente quien es su mamá.

Los anhelos que este señor tiene es el de tener una casa cómoda en donde se sienta bien su mamá y con toda la seguridad posible, es por esta razón que ahora él se decidió a visitar las oficinas de CEPRODEL para solicitar un crédito y realizar un mejoramiento de vivienda que consiste en hacer cambio de techo  y de esta forma poder contribuir al bienestar y satisfacción de su mamá.
texts.en:
In the city of Grandada, in the department of Granada, señor Julio César M. B. has worked very hard as a plumber for three years.  He works at the company, ENACAL-Granada.  He is single, and his only dependent is his mother.

His dream is to have a comfortable home where his mother feels at ease and as safe as possible.  This is why he decided to visit CEPRODEL's offices to request a loan and to make improvements to his home that include replacing the roof.  In this way, he will contribute to the well-being and satisfaction of his mother.

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Eklou

texts.fr: Monsieur Eklou a 26 ans et est marié. Il fait comme activité la climatisation auto et a associé la vente des pièces détachées. Cette activité lui  permet de  répondre  financièrement  aux besoins de ces 2 enfants.  Il  a commencé l’activité en 2006 et  s’approvisionne à Accra au  Ghana.  Il a son établissement  en face  de la société  Ayi-Transport.  IL demande un prêt  pour acheter les  pièces  détachées pour satisfaire plus de  clients.
texts.en: Mr Eklou is 26 years old and married. He installs air conditioning in cars and sells spare parts. This activity enables him to provide for his two children. He began his activity in 2006. He gets his supplies in Accra in Ghana. His business is located opposite the premises of the company Ayi-Transport. He applies for a loan to buy spare parts to serve more customers.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Bonne Semence Plus Group

texts.en:
Lukaya is the manager of the Community bank named “Bonne Semence Plus”. It is composed of 19 members united in solidarity of receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Lukaya started her business in 2001 selling miscellaneous goods. Today, she operates a general boutique. She is 38 years old, married and the mother of four children aged 4 to 13 who go to school. She has already received MFI HOPE DRC loans nine times and fully repaid them. With the weekly profit of about $110, she intends with the next loan to increase the inventory of her business by buying cans, sugar, sacks of rice and beans and other store items to resell at profit. Currently, Lukaya is happy to be part of one of HOPE’s groups because her business has been reinforced through the loan she received. Her dream is to someday become a wholesaler. She sells in the northern area of Kinshasa.

loans.use: To increase her business inventory

loans.name: Segundo Florentino

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 40 años de edad, es soltero y reside junto a su familia en un centropoblado el Pueblito ubicado en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Segundo trabaja en ele colegio Nº 10793 como profesor de educacion primaria ubicado en el centro poblado asata  Isabel, adicionalmente se dedica a la agricultura, el suele sembrar maracuyá, y limón esta actividad la aprendio de su padre.

Segundo desea adquirir fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo, con esta acción el espera obtener una buena cosecha. Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Segundo es una persona bastante tranquila y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es poder crecer como empresario y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Segundo is 40 years old and single.  He lives with his family in a community called El Pueblito, in Olmos district.  This is an agricultural area with quite a lot of commercial activity which is located in Lambayeque province, more than one and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo.

Segundo works in School No. 10793 as an elementary school teacher.  The school is located in Asata Isabel community.  He also farms, growing passion fruit and lemons.  He learned this business from his father.

Segundo would like to acquire fertilizers so that he can look after his crops.  In this way, he hopes to obtain a good harvest.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

Segundo is a calm and responsible person.  His biggest wish is to grow as a businessman and get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his crops

loans.name: Forkland Group

texts.en:
Violeth W. is in her early 30s and is married with three children. She has been running a general store since 2005. She works from 6:00 a.m. to after midnight and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be Violeth's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzani. She used the previous loans to increase the shop's inventory and also started selling second-hand shoes. She has paid back her loan successfully. She hopes for a loan to still increase on the shop's inventory. Her dream is to one day open a clothing shop.

Violeth will share this loan with her loan group, Forkland, which has a total of 25 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Violeth is first on the left.

loans.use: to increase the shop's inventory

loans.name: Leny

texts.en:
Leny G. is 34 years old and married with a school-aged child. She is from the village of Brgy. Roxas, Solano,Nueva Vizcaya. To make a living, Leny owns and operates a business raising crops. Her main source of income comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Leny has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month. 

Leny joined ASKI in 2011 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting her first loan of 35,000 PHP from ASKI to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Leny plans to use the additional revenue generated with her loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Ma. Regina

texts.en:
Ma. Regina C. works hard to support five children. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Ma. Regina requested a PHP 3,500 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have a good light source that is waterproof during the rainy season.

Ma. Regina is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To purchase solar lamp.

loans.name: Carlos Alejandro

texts.es: El señor Carlos Alejandro es un hombre muy responsable desde hace 10 años adquirió su vivienda de interés social pero este tipo de casa habitación son muy pequeñas, por lo que Carlos opto por iniciar una construcción en la parte trasera de su casa que fue con ahorros propios. En este momento se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un préstamo para terminar la recamara como lo es enjarrar, pintar y poner ventanas. De esta manera el vera terminado su proyecto para ofrecer un mejor patrimonio a su futura familia ya que aun es un hombre soltero.
texts.en:
Carlos Alejandro is a very responsible man.  Ten years ago he got his government subsidized house.  However, this type of house is very small so Carlos started to add on to the back of it using his own savings.

He now needs to request a loan to finish the bedroom.  He will plaster, paint and install windows.  This way he will see his project completed and will have a better patrimony to offer his future family since he’s still single.

loans.use: to finish off a room he's building.

loans.name: Kory Jaulitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “KORY JAULITAS” iniciará el ciclo décimo cuarto en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Germán Busch.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes, la asociación comunal está dirigida por una mesa directiva a la cabeza de la señora  Virginia.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: comercio, producción y servicio de comida y tejido de máquina
 
La señora Virginia indica que hace un año que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido en máquina que viene trabajando con la ayuda de su esposo iniciando este con la compra de la máquina de tejer.
 
El crédito que sacará ahora es para aumentar su capital (compra de lana) que lo venderá por mayor en las ferias. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta salud
texts.en:
The communal bank "Kory Jaulitas" will start their tenth loan cycle with Pro Mujer (Kiva Field Partner) as part of Centro Focal German Busch. It is made up of eight members. The communal bank is directed by a board of directors, headed by Virginia. The businesses of the members of the communal bank are various, and among them are: commerce, production, and catering, and knitting.

The loan that she requests now will be used to increase her capital (to purchases yarn) to sell in wholesale at the fairs. this form of work helps her to generate an income to support her family in what possible. She is married and she has two children.  

When she was asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she said that she appreciates the health care.

loans.use: to purchase yarn.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en: Jimmy is 47 years old, married, and has three adult children. He earns about 20,000 PHP per harvesting season as a farmer working in the Philippines. Jimmy grows corn and has been doing so for three years. Jimmy is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and seeds to grow. In the future, Jimmy hopes that his farming business will improve to support the needs of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Sughran's Group

texts.en:
Sughran is a widow who sells buffalo milk to financially contribute to her family. She took over this business after the sudden death of her husband few years ago. Now she has 2 buffaloes. She takes care of these buffaloes, gives them timely food & water and sells their milk to her community clients. She has 5 sons. Two of them work in a factory. The next two attend school and are getting their education. Her youngest son is 7 years old and has not started attending school yet. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to buy another buffalo to expand her milk selling business. The additional buffalo will not only become an asset for her business but also increase her profits in future. 

She has many years of experience in her business and hopeful that an investment will bring positive changes to her business. Her elder son is 27 years old and she hopes that she will be able to marry him off in the near future with the help of increased profits. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 4th loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a  book (called Asasah Passbook) is Sughran.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for dairy business.

loans.name: Omurbek's Group

texts.en:
Omurbek, 36, is a member of this group. He is a resident of a small fishing town, Balykchi. He is one of 42,000 residents with his own ideas of running a small business. “Being the main breadwinner of the family and having a one-year-old son motivates me to try new things, and help the family make a living”, says Omurbek. He is involved in two main activities: working in a local small joint-stock company and purchasing young cattle, fattening and reselling them. 

In December 2010, Omurbek applied for a loan of 15,000 soms from a local bank for the business start-up. After providing thorough care for a couple of months, he resold the animal for a good deal. This activity yielded a monthly income of 6,000 soms. Currently he owns two head of livestock, which he will also take care of and resell later. Having learnt about the loan opportunity from Kiva, Omurbek informed his like-minded fellows and gathered a group. The purpose of the loan is to purchase a calf for further growing and reselling. Omurbek hopes that someday in future he will build the house of his dreams for his family. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
 MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a calf for fattening and resale

loans.name: Come And See Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very please to present to you members of the “Come and See” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 500,000 SLL for each in order to invest in their businesses. 

Amie is the leader of this group. Amie is 32 years old and married with four children: two in primary school and two in secondary school. Amie sells bulgur wheat, beans, gari (food made out of cassava roots), etc. She has been doing this business for many years now. With the help of this loan, Amie is going to buy the above mentioned items in wholesale to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy bulgur wheat, beans, gari, etc. in wholesale to add to her business

loans.name: Otgonganbat

texts.en:
Otgonganbat is 42 years old, married to Munkhjargal, a 45-year-old woman.  Their marriage has been blessed with two children, Uyanga, aged 21, a university student, and Khansumberel, a seven year-old son who attends primary school. The family lives in a small house in the outer district of Ulaanbaatar. Munkhjargal has been operating fruit wholesale business at Bars, a local outdoor market, since 1999. She imports her products from Ereen, the border city of China, and sells to local stores and outside of the city as well. Her business has been developing considerably during the last few years hence she has a large number of constant customers. 

Otgonganbat is requesting 3.700.000.00 MNT /Mongolian Tugriks/ loan to cover his house with bricks and block stones. Since the temperature goes below -40 C during the winter time in Ulaanbaatar, he wants to make his small house warm and cozy. 

Otgonganbat graduated from the Railway University and National Academy of Governance in 2005. Since then he has been working as an engineer at Ulaanbaatar Train Station. He is a hard-working, responsible and trusted client of our institute who is very thankful for the lenders for giving him an opportunity to improve his family’s living standard.

loans.use: to buy essential materials to renovate his small house

loans.name: Damaris

texts.es:
La Sra. Damaris  pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Eucaliptos”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 30 años y 01  hijo de 09 años;  estudiante del nivel primario.
Ante la necesidad de generar sus propios ingresos económicos  inicia  su negocio con un capital de  S/. 300.00  nuevos soles, ella se dedica al servicio de lavado de vehículos menores; como motocicletas, y motocarros, ésta actividad es muy rentable y no genera muchos gastos. Actualmente cuenta con un mejor servicio  de atención a sus clientes, su clientela son amigos y público en general.
Con este préstamo de/. 1200.00  nuevos soles, comprará su motobomba, cajas de escobilllas, toallas, caja de detergentes, cajas de jabones, baldes plásticos y silicona a granel en litros, con ello brindará un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
Damaris es una mujer emprendedora y activa,  su sueño es contar con un espacio más grande y poder brindar servicios de lavado a vehículos  pesados; está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Damaris is a member of the Communal Bank “Los Eucaliptos” (The Eucalypti) which is located in the District of Tarapoto, Province and Department of San Martín. She is 30 years old and has a nine-year-old son who is an elementary school student.

Since she needed to generate her own income, Damaris started a business with capital of 300 PEN. She provides a service of washing smaller vehicles, such as motorcycles and motorcars. This business is very profitable and has few expenses. She now offers the best service to her customers, which consists of friends and the general public. With this loan of 1200 PEN, she will buy a power washer, brushes, towels, boxes of detergents, boxes of soap, plastic buckets, and silicone glaze by the liter. This will allow her to provide better service to her customers.

Damaris is a hardworking and active woman. Her dream is to have more space so that she can provide washing services for larger vehicles. She is very grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy a power washer, brushes, towels, boxes of detergents, boxes of soap, plastic buckets, and silicone glaze by the liter.

loans.name: Aziza

texts.en:
Aziza is a 62-year-old woman; she is married and has seven sons and four daughters. She has her own business of selling fruits and vegetables.  

Because a feast is right around the corner there is an opportunity to sell large amounts and generate more income, so she needs to purchase fruits and vegetables in bulk to sell and increase her income. Aziza hasn't enough money to pay for this, so she needs to take a loan of $3,000 from FATEN. 

When Aziza gets this FATEN loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to purchase more fruits and vegetables and increase her income so her family will have a better standard of living. Aziza is photographed in the place she sells fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables in bulk to increase her sales for an upcoming feast.

loans.name: Donny

texts.en:
Donny is a 35-year-old man who is married to Lea, a 36-year-old lady. They have one daughter named Helen who is seven and is studying at the second grade of Primary School. 

Donny runs a used clothing business. He has been operating the business since 2002. Donny rented a small room in the market to display his products. He is assisted by his wife in running the business. He usually operates the business from 8 am to 5 pm.

Donny dreams of improving his business to enable him to generate more income for his family but he doesn’t have enough capital to do so. This is the reason that leads him to seek a loan from TLM. Donny got information from TLM’s field officer on the Individual Lending Program. He then submitted a loan application to TLM and requested a loan of IDR 5,000,000. He wants to spend the loan on used clothing to be sold. Donny hopes that TLM will approve his loan application.

loans.use: To purchase used clothing to sell

loans.name: Enhtuya

texts.en: Enhtuya is 38 years old and lives with her son and husband in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in the Hovd province of Mongolia. Her family rents the yurt on a monthly basis. Her husband receives a disability pension and her son is a high school student. She started her business in 2010 by selling vegetables at the Han-Ord local market. She buys the vegetables at wholesale prices and resells them at retail price. She is planning to expand her business. She is a diligent woman who says "I started my business with 60,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT). I learned that things go well if they are managed well." She is requesting a loan for 500,000 MNT to buy vegetables.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha, 30, is a farmer who earns $3 per day.  Her husband earns $8 per day as a worker.  They have three children, one is studying and the other two are too young to be in school. 

Every month, she spends $83 on food, $5 on electricity, and $10 on other expenses.  Sokha requests a loan of $1000 to buy a hand tractor for farming that she can also rent to other farmers when they need to plow their fields. 

She used to lose money as a farmer, but doesn't want to change her career because Sokha doesn’t know what else she could do to earn a living.

loans.use: to buy a hand tractor for farming.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en:
Vicente is 63 years old and lives in Lobogon, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. He is married with two children. 

Vicente has a fisherfolk business and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. He has requested a loan  of 10,000 PHP to purchase more fish to sell.

Vicente has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Vicente hopes to have many fishing boats in order help their financial and daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Actualmente la vida del socio Miguel no a variado mucho, sigue trabajando con su negocio de entretenimiento y sigue criando animales para la venta de los mismos, en esta oportunidad el socio desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de animales menores como comprar cuyes al por mayor y gallinas; el socio comprara en un total 15 pares de cuyes y 15 pares de gallinas; el socio desea poder ahorrar y comprar un terreno para construir, el socio por el momento criara estos animales los engordara, se reproduciran y los vendera a mayor precio.
texts.en: The life of our member Miguel has not changed a lot.  He continues working in his entertainment business and continues raising animals to sell.  On this occasion, he would like to invest his loan in buying animals such as guinea pigs and hens wholesale.  He will buy a total of 15 pairs of guinea pigs and 15 pairs of hens.  He would like to be able to save up and buy a plot of land so that he can build.  Right now he will raise these animals, fatten them, breed them and then sell them for a higher price.

loans.use: to buy 15 guinea pigs and 15 hens to sell

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita is 65 years old and lives in Dolipos Alto, Oroquieta City. She is married and has 8 children. Florita has a business selling spices, earning approximately PHP 10,000 each month. She has requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase more spices to sell.

Florita has been a member of PMPC for a year. In the future, Florita hopes to have a space in the market in order to earn money to use for the family's daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase more spices

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a 56-year-old married woman with six children. Her husband is a fisherman.

Gloria is a food vendor. From selling fruits and vegetables, Gloria decided to venture into selling cooked meals. 

She requested this loan to purchase raw ingredients such as pork and chicken meat, vegetables and spices. Gloria hopes for her business to grow more. She hopes to open a restaurant in the future.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients such as pork and chicken meat, vegetables and spices.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita, aged 51, is married with three children and lives in Macabayao, Jimenez. She sells groceries to earn a living and has had this business for six years. Each month, she earns PHP 4,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase rice for her retail business.

Teresita has been a member of PMPC for 10 years.  In the future, she hopes to have her own convenience store in this locality.

loans.use: To purchase rice for her retail business

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en:
Phoebe is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Phoebe has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages . She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 16,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Phoebe has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Phoebe hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba is married. She sells maize at Brasi near Abura. She adds her income to that of her husband’s to pay utility bills. Aba will use the loan to purchase additional bags of maize for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to build a shop.

loans.use: to purchase additional bags of maize for sale.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en: Abdul is a thirty-five-year-old married man with five children living in Kasese Uganda. His goal is to educate his children. He has been a poultry farmer for ten years. He started with capital of UGX one hundred thousand and now has over UGX one million five hundred thousand as his working capital. His major challenge is the high cost of feed. His dream is to have over 2000 birds. Abdul needs the loan to buy birds for poultry keeping.

loans.use: to buy birds for poultry keeping.

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick is 32 years old, married, with two children aged two and four. 

He runs a retail shop to earn a living, and has been in the business for eight years. He describes his business environment as good because there is limited competition. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya he has been able to save his income. He hopes to expand his business to wholesale in the future. He has applied for a loan of 50,000 Kenya Shillings to buy sugar, maize flour, rice and cooking oil.

loans.use: To buy sugar, maize flour, rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Akouavi Céline's Group

texts.fr: Le groupement JESUDEGBE 2 est composé de vingt personnes qui sont des amies et qui font des tontines ensemble.  C'est la première fois que ce groupement sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupement, du nom de Akouavi Céline est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Akouavi Céline âgée de 44 ans, est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Saturnin. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Akouavi Céline vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par Akouavi Céline et son mari. Akouavi Céline a arrêté l'école au niveau secondaire mais appris la couture par la suite. Activité qu'elle exerce dans son atelier depuis dix ans environ. Pour faire face aux besoins de sa famille, Akouavi Céline vend des chaussures et des tissus de façon secondaire à son activité. Akouavi Céline s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Akouavi Céline sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupement JESUDEGBE 2, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des fourniture de couture et des tissus.

loans.name: Nofal

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Nofal, one of the Ruma agents who lives in East Serang, Indonesia - a suburban city located about 3 hours drive from Jakarta. 

Nofal is happily married, and he and his wife have been blessed with 2 children. In order to support his family, Nofal runs a small shop that sells not only kids toys and mobile phone airtime credits, but also facilitates utility bill payments. 

Nofal started the mobile phone airtime business about 2 years ago after he was introduced to Ruma by Ruma field staff. He was excited to start selling mobile phone airtime because he wanted to increase his income to be able to save for his children's education. 

Nofal would like to acquire a working capital loan from Ruma and Kiva lenders in order to process more transactions. He is a hardworking and humble man. He performs well and has become a trusted seller and service provider in his community. 

In the photo above, Nofal is carrying his son. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone services in his community.

loans.name: Claire

texts.en:
Married and mother of four (04) children, Madam Claire T. is a retailer for 15 years. After her primary studies, she has started the trading with her senior sister. Became married woman in a family where everything is at her charge due to the irresponsibility of her husband who has taken up residence in the night clubs and cabarets, she fights for the well-being of her children. Model and modest, she undertakes a good relation with the children whose future life constitutes her first preoccupation. Very enterprising and having the sense of a good management, she masteries well her commercial activities which provide for her a substantial incomes at the need of her family. Very model, she has always repaid on time her three credits granted. This fourth credit of $850 to be repaid in eight (08) months will allow him to supply in cans and rice -sacks to face the increasing request of the customary on the market in these periods of year-end. This project will allow her to make much profitable her activity for the development of her incomes in view to the improvement of her family living conditions.

Mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants, Madame T. Claire est revendeuse depuis 15 ans. Après ses études primaires, elle a débuté le commerce avec sa grande sœur. Devenue femme mariée dans une famille où tout est à sa charge à cause de l’irresponsabilité de son mari qui a élu domicile dans les cabarets, elle se bat pour le bien-être de ses enfants. Femme modèle et modeste, elle entretient une bonne ambiance avec les enfants dont leur avenir constitue sa première préoccupation. Très entreprenante et ayant le sens d’une bonne gestion, elle maîtrise bien ses activités commerciales qui lui procurent un revenu substantiel au besoin de sa famille. Très exemplaire, elle a remboursé toujours à temps ses trois crédits obtenus. Ce quatrième crédit de $850 remboursable en huit (08) mois lui permettra de s’approvisionner en bidons d’huile et en sacs de riz pour faire face à la demande croissante de sa clientèle sur le marché en cette période de fin d’année. Ce projet lui permettra de rentabiliser au mieux son activité pour l’augmentation ses revenus en vue de l’amélioration de ses conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy whole rice-sacks and oil can

loans.name: Hadia

texts.en: Hadia lives in the Vituka area, on the outskirts of Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. She is married with four children. She sells maize flour, beans, rice and other types of dry food to food vendors and several restaurants in the Temeke district of Dar es Salaam. She buys these food items from wholesalers and packs them in bags of 5-10 kilograms ready for resale. She is planning to increase stock for these food items as she usually faced with stockouts. Hadia is worried about these stockouts, as competitors may take this as an advantage and reduce her market share. To meet her plan she is need of USD 550.

loans.use: Increase stock of food goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of a jiko (cooking stove), a box of chips storage and a chips cutting machine.

loans.name: Obid

texts.en: Obid R. is married and has 3 children.  He used to work in a factory as a welder but after the economic collapse, the salary was not enough to support his family. He decided to sell children clothes in the market, because he loves children very much. His wife is an accountant, but she could not find a good job too so she decided to help her husband in his business. Obid brings goods from the wholesale market and his wife and his eldest daughter sell them in the market.  Obid is an active client of Micro Invest. His first loan was for 100USD and he used it to develop his business. Gradually he increased his working capital and now his business is one of the better known trade places in the market.  Obid would to a loan of 800USD to rent another store space for his daughter, P.S.In the photo is of his daughter Farzonahon.

loans.use: Open a new trade store.

loans.name: Mohammad Masan

texts.en: Mohammad Masan lives in district 7 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and has two children and also has the responsibility of supporting his father and mother. He has a retail shop. He wants to expand his business so he wants to take an individual to buy peaches, baga of nuts, pears, limes, apples, peanuts, oranges, and extra items to help him make a good income and support his family. He is happy with the opportunity to take this loan.

loans.use: To buy produce for his grocery store

loans.name: Safarali

texts.ru:
Safarali N. is 42 years old, has a secondary technical education and is married with 4 children. He lives in the Shahrinav region, in the village of Bogiston. Safarali has a sales kiosk that sells food. He has been in this business for 3 years. He plans to use the loan to increase his product selection. His store is located 10KM away from the center of the region and is one of only two stores in the village that sell food products to local residents. Because the stores in the center of the region close early, residents returning from work cannot always purchase necessary food items. Safarali’s store takes into account the needs of the clients and is open until late evening giving residents the opportunity to purchase necessary products.

Safarali plans to pay back the loan during a 12 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Нозимов Сафарали, возраст – 42 лет, образование среднее техническое, женат, имеет 4 детей. Живет в Шахринавском районе, в джамоате Богистон. Сафарали имеет торговую точку по продаже продуктов питания. Этим бизнесом занимается уже в течение 3 лет. На сумму кредита клиент планирует увеличить ассортимент продаваемого товара. Магазин клиента находится в 10 км от центра района и является одним из двух магазинов в этом кишлаке, которые продают местному населению продукты питания. Так как в ценре районов большинство магазинов закрываются рано, жители возращаясь с работы не всегда могут приобрести необходимые им продукты питания. Магазин Сафарали учитывая потребности клиента не закрывает свой магазин до позднего вечера и поэтому население кишлака имеет возможность приобрести необходимый им товар. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase product selection

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen E. is married with 4 children, is 38 years of age and hails from Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells provisions and Drinks. She has been in business since 2002 and needs the loan to enable herself to buy more provisions and drinks for sale.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks

loans.name: Mich

texts.en:
Mrs. K. Mich, age 29, was married in 2000 and has one son and two daughters. Since she got married, she has been in the business of growing corn and cucumbers on her farmland in the village. Her husband, Mr. Yard Yin, is also in business with her in the village. They sell their products to the middleman who comes to purchase directly in the village.

K. has borrowed money from MAXIMA three times already. Now she is requesting another loan, in the amount of $500. She will use this money to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides, and a secondhand water pumping machine.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides, plus a secondhand water pumping machine

loans.name: Nestapa Tay Ramatana

texts.id:
Nestapa works very diligently in a furniture business with a monthly salary of $80. He wishes for a better life, and thus, was very grateful to receive this opportunity from DINARI. He will use the loan to buy his own woodworking and carpentry tools, which he can use to accept freelance orders for additional income.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Joan, Kiva volunteer.

Nestapa adalah seorang yang sangat ulet dan tekun bekerja, dia bekerja di sebuah usaha furniture dengan gaji 800.000/bulan. Nestapa menpunyai keinginan untuk maju dan untuk itulah dia sangat senang ketika mendapat pinjaman modal dari DINARI karena modal tersebut akan dipakainya untuk membeli alat-alat pertukangan. Dengan mempunyai alat sendiri secara otomatis akan bisa menambah penghasilannya dalam berusaha.

loans.use: To buy woodworking and carpentry tools

loans.name: Luz María

texts.es:
Luz María’s husband moved from Ciudad de Victoria to work, and therefore the money he sent occasionally took long to reach Luz and the daily expenses could not be covered. For that reason she began to sell second-hand electronic devices to obtain earnings that would allow her to pay the daily expenses of her three children, 16, 13, and 6 years of age.

Presently Luz is requesting a loan of $950 to be repaid in 6 months, and with this money Luz will buy merchandise, as clients looking for new items occasionally leave without. Therefore she needs more variety so her clientele always can find something new. With your support Luz will be able to keep her business going and also support her children to study a professional degree.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

El esposo de Luz María, salió de la Ciudad de Victoria a trabajar. Es por eso que en ocasiones el dinero tardaba mucho tiempo en que llegara a manos de Luz, y los gastos diarios no podían ser cubiertos. Fue así que comenzó a vender aparatos electrónicos usados, para poder tener una ganancia que le permitiera pagar los gastos diarios de sus tres hijos de 16, 13 y 6 años.

Actualmente Luz está solicitando un crédito de US $950 que está dispuesta a pagar en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Luz podrá comprar mercancía, puesto que en ocasiones llegan clientes a buscar cosas nuevas y se van sin nada. Es por eso que necesita tener más variedad para que sus clientes siempre encuentren algo nuevo. Con tu ayuda Luz logrará sacar su negocio adelante, además de ayudar a que sus hijos estudien una carrera universitaria.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to increase sales of electronics.

loans.name: Claudia Gabriela

texts.es:
Claudia Gabriela E. is married to Jose Enrique Betancourt Garcia who works at a local company. They have a three year old son. She has a business selling traditional sweets. She started it two years ago with the help of her mother in law and her father. She operates in a space that belongs to her mother in law and her father gave her the initial capital to start the business. Due to her hard work and dedication the business has prospered.

She now need a loan of USD $250 which she will repay in six months, to buy merchandise since the upcoming holidays are a good time for sweets vendors

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Claudia Gabriela E. esta casada con José Enrique Betancourt García quien se desempeña como empleado en una empresa de la localidad, son padres de un niño de 3 años, tiene un negocio de venta de dulces típicos lo inicio hace 2 años, con la ayuda de su suegra y su papa; en un local que su suegra le presto y su papa le facilito el capital inicial para arrancar el negocio. Debido a su empeño y dedicación el negocio ha prosperado mucho.

Ahora ella requiere un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 6 meses para comprara mercancía ya que para los dulceros las fechas que se aproximan son buena temporada para las ventas

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Bupe

texts.en:
Mambo from Kyela Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 37-year-old Bupe N.. She is married and has 4 children aged between 9 and 20. She has 2 dependents, who live with her because are orphans. In 1990, Bupe established her charcoal business. Bupe has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan from SELFINA and now requires a loan in order to buy more additional stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

These small, black and dirty pieces of dry earth are important not just to charcoal sellers but to their customers who rely on charcoal to cook their meals. Many Tanzanians still use small coal pots, in which they arrange mkaa (charcoal) and add either paper, dry grass, old plastic bags or kerosene in order to light them. The fire requires constant fanning to ignite and maintain the flame, and makes cooking quite a hot and laborious task. It may not be the easiest or most environmentally friendly form of cooking, but it is the only option many people can afford.

loans.use: To buy more additional stock in bulk.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea C. sells groceries in Boeng Mealea Village, Siem Reap Province, earning about $3 per day. Her husband, Mr. Hen Hoeurm, 32, makes $2 per day grinding rice. They have four children, one married and three others attending school. With a growing business and increasing family’s expenses, C. is seeking a loan to purchase more grocery stocks and to repair their grinding workshop; these measures will help them to expand their businesses and increase family income so they can pay their children’s school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery stocks and fix  their grinding workshop.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth A. sells plates, saucepans, and other kitchen utensils. She is single, and her income is not sufficient for Elizabeth and her 4 children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional kitchen utensils to expand her business

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.en:
Mavluda U.  has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2002 and is a serious client. She trusts us and we trust her since she has not had any problems with previous loan repayment. Mrs. U. lives in Khujand. She is married and has 5 children She sells men's and children's wear. She works with direct suppliers so she is able to sell at low prices. She has repeat customers and good turnover. 

Mrs. U.  wants to import new goods so she is asking for a KIVA business development loan of 2600 STJ for 4 months to develop her business and import new seasonal wear.

loans.use: importing new seasonal wear

loans.name: Stumai Saidi's Selous Group

texts.en:
Stumai S. is 30 and married with two daughters, ages twelve and three. She has owned a clothing business for the past five years. She sells clothes door-to-door and also delivers specific orders to her customers. She works daily from 9 am until 5 pm and earns a monthly profit of about $260.

Stumai has previously taken a loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used it to increase her stock of clothes and has paid the loan back successfully. Stumai is now hoping for another loan to purchase clothes to sell for Iddi, the Muslim holiday celebrating the end of Ramadan.

Stumai is part of a group called Selous. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Stumai is in the center. The women on either side of her are part of her group, and Stumai will share this loan with them. One has a small grocery and the other owns a salon.

loans.use: To purchase clothes to sell for the Muslim holiday Iddi.

loans.name: Zonia

texts.es: Zonia (49) años vende productos de abarrote en su domicilio, constituyendo así su propia bodega, adicionalmente se dedica a la venta comida a la hora D. almuerzo. Su esposo Raúl es pescador y mientras está en casa la apoya mucho. Ambos tienen como responsabilidad a su último hijo, quien cursa el nivel secundario, hacen todo lo posible para que no le falte nada y siga adelante en sus estudios. Ahora Zonia, requiere de un capital para incrementar la mercadería de su negocio, además de apoyar a su esposo con la implementación de instrumentos para la pesca, por lo que ella solicita este préstamo.
texts.en:
Zonia is 49 years old and sells grocery products in her home, constituting her own grocery store. Additionally, she works selling food at lunchtime. Her husband Raúl is a fisherman and when he is home he helps her a lot. Both are responsible for their last son, who is in secondary school. They do everything possible so that he is not without anything and so that he advances in his studies. Now Zonia requires capital to increase the merchandise in her store as well as to support her husband with the production of fishing instruments, which is why she is requesting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the merchandise of her small store as well as to acquire fishing supplies for her husband.

loans.name: Wassa (The Joy) Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Wassa est un regroupement de cinq femmes (quatre mariées et une célibataire) de Kimparana (Préfecture de San région de Ségou) qui sont des voisines de quartier. Elles ont en moyenne 29 ans sont mariées et mères d’au moins 2 enfants.

Elles mènent différentes activités comme la vente de fruits, de légumes et de boissons non alcoolisés locales. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis deux ans. Le montant du prêt est passé de 50.000 FCFA au premier prêt à 100.000 FCFA pour le cinquième prêt. Elles se procurent de leurs marchandises au village de kimparana (bananes, goyaves, papaye, jujube etc.…). Les produits sont vendus au marché de kimparana à la maison et dans les écoles. Ainsi avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent réaliser en moyenne 90.000 CFA. au cours du prêt. En dehors du remboursement des prêts elles comptent utiliser une partie de leur revenu pour faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Wassa group is made up of five women (four are married and one is single) from Kimparana (Prefecture of San, in the Ségou Region). On average, they are 29 years old and the mother of at least two children.

They run various businesses, such as selling fruits, vegetables, and local non-alcoholic beverages. To bolster their businesses, the members joined the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso two years ago. The amount of loaned money ranged from XOF 50'000 (ca US$ 100) for the first loan, up to XOF 100'000 (ca US$ 200) for their fifth one. They purchase goods (bananas, guavas, papayas, jujube, etc) in the market of the Kimparana village. The products are sold in the Kimparana market, at home, and in schools. With this new loan, they foresee to make, on average, XOF 90'000 (ca US$ 180) for the duration of the loan. In addition to paying back the loan, the also intend to use part of their revenues to pay for daily family expenses.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Ndathé

texts.fr: Ndathé, 45 ans, mariée, 10 enfants et 02 autres en charge est membre du banc villageois de CESIRI depuis 1 an et demi. Elle veut renforcer son commerce de tissu teinté (Ganila, 1er choix  et 2ème choix). Elle vend aussi des produits de beauté. Ses revenus lui permettent d’entretenir ses enfants et d’équiper sa maison. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Ndathé, age 45, is married and has ten children plus two others to look after. She has been a member of the village loan group CESIRI for a year and a half. She wants to bolster her business in dyed fabrics (Ganila, first choice and second choice). She also sells beauty products. Her income enables her to care for her children and to equip her house. She is requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dyed cloth

loans.name: Huong Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Bùi Thị Hường năm nay 44 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2003. Hiện nay công việc đem lại thu nhập chủ yếu cho gia đình chị là từ chăn nuôi và buôn bán giò chả. Với mức thu nhập 2.500.000đ/ tháng kinh tế gia đình chị Hường đang ngày càng ổn định và phát triển hơn
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15.000.000 đ để đầu tư mua thực phẩm phục vụ cho việc sản xuất kinh doanh của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Huong Thi B. is a 44 years old woman. She joined the TYM fund in 2003. At the moment, she is raising livestock and making grilled chopped meat for living. These businesses bring in 2,500,000 Vietnamese Dong and gradually improve the family’s financial situation. Mrs. B. plans to make the next loan of 15,000,000 Vietnamese Dong to buy food supply for the businesses.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy food supply

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 32-year-old Maria J. M. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with two children ages one and eight. Maria has been running a pharmacy since 2004. She works at the business for 13-16 hours a day, six days a week. Maria currently earns about $120 from her business. She is requesting a loan of $675 to purchase additional stocks of medicines. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Maria thanks you for your support.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of medicines

loans.name: Maendeleo Group

texts.en:
Hana has been a bread seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 7 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $80. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours. She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more bread for her business.
