She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business, improve her home, and pay the school fees of her children.

Hana is 38 years old, is divorced, and has 4 children. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Jabu, who also has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more bread for her business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary F. is in the business of selling charcoal and local brew from her home and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Mary is 30 years old, married and her husband is a teacher. She has 5 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits earned from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama F., 45, is married and has given birth to five children: three boys and two girls. She says all of them are still in junior high or primary schools. Her husband is a farmer. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a small farming community called Hweakwae in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the dwellers of this community is farming. The land is rich in nutrients and as a result, many inhabitants combine trading and farming activities.

Ama is in the palm-oil production business. She procures palm fruits from local farmers to prepare the oil. She distributes to customers who come to buy in bulk and retail. She also sells to food vendors in her community. Ama wants a loan to procure palm fruits in bulk so that she can produce the oil in bulk and distribute it to the increasing number of her customers. It is her dream to help her husband give their children the best education they can afford since it is the best legacy they can give them.

loans.use: To procure palm nuts

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Juan Manuel C. le está haciendo falta la elaboración de la losa en el patio trasero. Pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que le realizara la construcción. 
Es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para llevar acabo la elaboración de la losa ya que el trabaja todo el día y su casa está sola y quiere que esté mas segura.
texts.en:
Juan Manuel C. has a house but the wall in the rear patio hasn't been finished. He doesn't have the necessary funds to buy the materials or to pay someone to install them. For this reason, he is requesting a loan so he can have it finished. Now that he is working all the time, the house is unattended and he wants to make it more secure.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish building his wall

loans.name: Hidita

texts.es:
La señora Idita, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Vencedoras de Villa Universitaria”, vive en el Jr. Cajamarca Nº 136 – AA.HH. 10 de Agosto, Distrito de Tarapoto, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 54 años y es madre de 06 hijos, 01 que aun depende de ella.

Con su primer crédito de S/. 300.00 por iniciativa propia emprendió su  negocio de Venta de plátanos y leña, con sus precios cómodos y a pedido de sus clientes, realiza sus ventas y nos cuenta que le va muy bien.
En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio ubicada en su propia casa, donde sus principales clientes son moradores de la comunidad, vecinos y amigos.
Con este préstamo de S/. 300.00 que cancelará a un  plazo de 04 meses, comprará  más productos para surtir su negocio como racimos de plátanos, tercios de leñas, sacos de yuca, para mantener contenta a su clientela.

Hoy se siente muy tranquila  y contenta del servicio que brinda a sus clientes. De Manuela Ramos, opina que es una institución que la ayudo a salir adelante.
texts.en:
Mrs. Idita is a member of the communal bank “Las Vencedoras de Villa Univesitaria (The Victorious of Villa University)”, and lives on 136 Cajamarca St., settlement of 10 de Agosto, District of Tarapoto, Region of San Martin. She has a partner, is 54 years old, and is the mother of six children, one of which depends on her.

With her first loan of 300 PEN she launched, of her own initiative, a business selling bananas and firewood. With her convenient prices and at the request of her customers she has made her sales and she tells us that it goes very well. Today she continues with the same business located in her house. Her main clients are the residents of the community, neighbors and friends.

This loan of 300 PEN, which she will pay on a four month plan, she will purchase more products to stock up her business such as bunches of bananas, bundles of firewood, and sacks of yucca in order to keep her customers happy. Today she feels very calm and happy with the service she provides to her customers. She feels that Manuala Ramos is an institution that has helped her to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase bunches of bananas and firewood

loans.name: Rasheeda Sultan Ahmad Group

texts.en:
My name is Rasheeda and I have resided in a city named Borewala, Pakistan for the past 8 years. Borewala city is famous for its shrines. I am an uneducated lady as I didn’t realize the value of education at that time, why it’s compulsory. Now I know the value of why it's really compulsory when I see my two sons free.

I have set my mind that I’ll send my sons into a school and for this purpose I started operating a business sewing clothes. I saved income from my business and admitted my sons into school. My husband's name is S. A. and he sells construction supplies and specifically wooden beams to his customers. He has 5 years of experience in this business. I am applying for a loan to buy beams to increase the profit of my husband. I am the group leader of two other women from my locality. Nazia baji wants a loan to buy animals (goats) to sell. Khursheedan baji wants a loan to buy paint boxes to resell. This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy beams for shuttering business

loans.name: Relia Edelvis

texts.es:
RELIA S. D. S., pertenece al Banco Comunal “CARMEN CABREJOS” vive en el Jr.Comandante espinar Nº 648. del distrito D. Calleria, en la ciudad D. Pucallpa, tiene 51 años D. edad, 4 hijos mayores D. edad, y su esposo es mecánico.

Se inició en el negocio D. venta D. ropas y con el primer préstamo D. S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró blusas y faldas para luego venderlos en la ciudad D. Contamana, ahora está ingresando al negocio D. venta D. productos D. belleza.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,300.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará perfumes, cosméticos y nuevos productos D. belleza para su stock.
 
“Manuela Ramos es una ONG que apoya a una gran cantidad D. familias, con pequeños préstamos que permite a las mujeres D. esta zona a iniciar, o a mejorar sus negocios y estoy contenta con esa ayuda” refirió.
texts.en:
RELIA S. D. S. is a member of "Banco Comunal "CARMEN CABREJOS", she lives in Jr. Comandante Espinar No. 648, district of Calleria in the town of Pucallpa. She is 51 years old, and has 4 grown-up children, and her husband is a mechanic.

She started selling clothes and with the first loan of S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles she bought blouses and skirts to be sold in the town of Contamana. Presently she is starting business selling beauty products.

With this loan of S/.1,300.00 Nuevos Soles, she will buy perfumes, cosmetics and new beauty products for her stock.

"Manuela Ramos is a NGO which supports a substantial amount of families through small loans that allow the women of this area to start or improve their businesses, and I am very pleased with this support", doña Relia said.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase perfumes, cosmetics.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon M. sells corn mills and components in Abotoase near Hohoe. Simon did not receive any formal education. He is married and has six dependants. His wife is a petty trader with a small income. He is responsible for all the financial needs of the children. With the high demand for corn mills and components, his loan will be used to buy to more components of the corn mill to sell. He hopes to save the new profits from his business.

loans.use: To buy more components for corn mills

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe L. is from the village of Mahayahay, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 56 years old. Fe is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Fe owns and operates a sari-sari or general store. She sells daily use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Fe has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Fe joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from GDMPC. She used the previous loan to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. Fe is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP that she will use to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Fe's second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership includes farmers, fisher folks, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es: Doña Rosa Maria tiene la edad de 43 años, casada su esposo trabaja en la agricultura, tiene dos hijos los cuales estudian, reside en el barrio Sabana Grande en la capital de Managua, tiene seis años de elaborar las ricas rosquillas y perreque el cual inicio con dinero propio y con deseo de superación por apoyar  a su familia, sus planes es apoyar a sus hijos en los estudios, a si como la elaboración de otro hormo en su casa de habitación para producir mas rosquillas. Con este crédito quiere invertir en la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de las rosquillas va  a comprar: maíz, queso, manteca, dulce y otros productos para hacer sus ventas y poder tener mejores ganancias al invertir y vender más. Da las gracias a la institución por el apoyo con los préstamo ya que ha salido a delante con su negocio
texts.en:
Doña Rosa María is 43 years old, married and the mother of two children who are studying. Her husband works in agriculture. She lives in the neighborhood of Sabana Grande in the capital city of Managua.

She has been producing her delicious donuts for six years. She started her business with her own money. She wants to support her family and help her children in their studies. She plans to install another oven in her home to produce more donuts.

Rosa María will use this loan to buy ingredients for her donuts, namely corn, cheese, butter, candy and other items. By investing and selling more she expects to earn more profits. She thanks her lenders for this loan which will boost her business.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, cheese and butter

loans.name: Juana Domitila

texts.es: Juana Domitila L. A. tiene 53 años de edad. Es madre soltera. Vive en su propia casa con sus 2 hijos que trabajan de manera independiente. Desde hace mas de 5 años que se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos. Por las mañanas vende su queso y cuajada en su vivienda, por lo que sus vecinos recurren a su casa en busca de estos productos Doña Juana los vende a un precio muy accesible. Sus hijos ayudan con estas tareas. El sueño de Juana es obtener su propio medio de transporte y estar siempre unidos en familia. El dinero que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima como queso, leche, cuajada y crema.
texts.en:
Juana Domitila L. A. is 53 years old and is a single mother. She lives in her own home with her two children, who are independent and work. For over 5 years, she has sold dairy products. In the mornings, she sells cheese and curds in her home, and her neighbors come to her house to find these products. Juana sells them at a reasonable price, and her children help her with this work.

Juana's dream is to obtain her own means of transportation and to always be together with her family. The loan that she has requested is for working capital to buy raw materials like cheese, milk, curds, and cream.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Susan Auma

texts.en:
Susan Auma is 37 years old and married to Samuel. They have three children ages 15, 11, and 10. She has been selling household utensils and tools for three years, during which she has increased her stock and products.  She aspires to run the business in a permanent building and offer larger quantities. 

She had a challenge getting credit because the informal village savings group she belonged to did not give loans and members could only access their savings refunds upon exit or from small emergency-only loans. It was only after a friend who was a co-member in the savings group informed her about KADET that she was able to access a loan. This will be her second loan and she intends to use the money to increase her stock. She has also engaged a local tinsmith for regular supplies of cheap locally-made household tools.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to  relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To buy more stock of household items.
